loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Neema is a 35-year-old married woman with four young children. She owns a Mama Lishe, or local cafe, in the Kinondoni area of Dar es Salaam thatshe runs with an additional employee. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Neema is requesting $US350 to purchase additional stocks of sugar, wheat and maize flour, rice, and beans to enable her to serve more customers in the future and thus hopefully increase her profits from the cafe.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Beatrice is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a kuku, or poultry, business that she started last year. Although she is a new entrepreneur, she has been making a monthly profit of approximately $US140. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. "Kuku" means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Beatrice is requesting a loan of $US275 to increase the number of chicks in her business and to purchase additional feed. With the expected increased profits, Beatrice hopes to increase the scale of her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and feed

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Asha is a 39-year-old divorcee with three children, all of whom are in school. She owns and operates a store that sells phone accessories such as mobile phone cases, phone docks, chargers and so on. Despite being a ‘developing’ country (forgive the label, there remains no consensus on an acceptable definition), it is amazing how many people have mobile phones in Tanzania and in Africa in general. Not just professionals, but grandmothers in villages, school kids, street sellers. It can probably be attributed to a number of factors, led by the fact that mobile phones are the only form of phone communication available to most people because there are few land lines, and followed closely by how relatively cheap mobile phones are here.

Due to the widespread demand for mobile phones as well as the enterprising attitude of Asha and her two employees, Asha makes a monthly profit of approximately $US100. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional phone accessories to be able to earn more profits. In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Angela is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. Additionally, another family member is dependent on her. She owns a small Mama Lishe, or local café, that she started in 2005 and runs with two employees. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Angela is requesting $US275 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and beans and to add more chairs for customer seating. In the future, she hopes to open another café, which would allow her to serve her delectable food to even more customers.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Kure

texts.en: Kure J. is 45 years old, married and has five children. Since 1990, he has made a living operating a palm-kernel plantation that he owns in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is applying for a loan of $1,200 to process palm kernels into palm oil.

loans.use: To process palm kernals into palm oil

loans.name: Honesta

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Honesta is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, aged 16 and 12. Additionally, she supports two other dependents: an orphan who is a relative as well as a boarder who studies in her neighborhood. Honesta runs a small soda shop cum bar in the Mabibo area of Dar es Salaam. She started the shop in 2006 and is assisted in its running by her children. It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing, a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania! Additionally, Honesta’s bar is a good spot to relax over a beer if you manage to finish work early on a Friday afternoon. It’s the kind of place where you kick back on a plastic chair under a tree, with a local beer in hand, the aroma of roasting ‘mishikaki’ (kebabs made on an open fire) wafting around you, and talk to anyone and everyone who happens to wander by.

Honesta puts the $US300 per month that she earns from the store towards her family’s needs and into the maintenance of her business. She is requesting a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of soda and beer. She intends to repay this loan in 12 months. With the profits from this loan, Honesta hopes to expand her soda shop cum bar in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Lailaty

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Lailaty is a 51-year-old single woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a new entrepreneur who started a Mama Lishe, or local café, in 2007 where she serves delicious cuisine to her customers. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that actually entails. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Lailaty’s monthly profit from the café, where her children and two employees assist her, is approximately $US300. She is requesting a loan of $US275 in order to purchase more stocks of rice as well as additional chairs and tables to accommodate more customers. In the future, she hopes to further expand her café.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs and seating

loans.name: Lawerence

texts.en: Lawrence owns and runs a palm-kernel farm. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where he has been in this business since 1998. He needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more pesticides and weed-control chemicals to use on his plantation.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and weed-control chemicals

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose U. is 50 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling drinks, bowls and coolers. She has been in this line of work since 1993 and wants to expand her business by selling food from her store. To make this possible, she needs a loan of $850 to buy food and more bowls. She wishes to extend her thanks to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To begin selling food from her business and to buy more bowls.

loans.name: Omar

texts.fr:
S., a young craftsman in iron, is based in Ziguinchor. He is requesting this loan to acquire new equipment, because the demand is higher than the offer. Thus he will be able to increase his profit and consequently his purchasing power.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

S., jeune menuisier metallique, est base a Ziguinchor. Il sollicite ce pret pour acquerir de nouveaux materiel ; car la demande est superieur a l'offre. Ainsi il pourra realiser davantage de benefices et par ricochet accroitre son pouvoir d'achat.

loans.use: Wrought iron workshop

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Asiah is a 40-year-old married woman with two children (ages nine and 16). She and her husband are also responsible for two more children under the age of 18 who are orphans related to the family. Asiah has two businesses: a photocopy shop and a beauty salon. She established the salon seven months ago and is already earning $US400 from the profits at the salon. Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

Asiah is requesting a loan of $US275 to purchase necessary items such as hair products, wigs, and cosmetics for her salon. She hopes to pay back this loan in six months.

loans.use: To buy additional beauty salon inventory

loans.name: Kamchihon

texts.ru:
Kamchihon A. lives in the Khuroson region of Tajikistan. He is 50 years old and is married with six children. He works as a private carpenter. His income is not enough to provide for the family. Therefore he also sells livestock. In order to buy additional livestock, he plans to obtain a loan for a period of 10 months. The loan would help increase sales and profit.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Абдурахимов Камчихон проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 50 лет , женат , имеет шестерых детей. Работает плотником по найму. Имеет небольшие доходы , которых не хватает для того , чтобы обеспечить семью. Кроме этого , для того , чтобы улучшить положение занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота. Для того , чтобы купить дополнительных животных планирует получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и увеличить доходы.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Osareyekemwen

texts.en: Osareyekemwen O. is 28 years old, married with four children and lives Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She makes a living selling foodstuffs such as melons, vegetables, oil and rice. Before opening her shop in 2001, she studied this business for five months. Osareyekemwen needs a loan of $600 to buy more food items to sell. This will help to boost her income, and she wishes to thank her lenders for making that possible.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Agatha is a young Tanzanian entrepreneur; she is only 24 years old. She has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, about 1.5m by 1m, often with a border (called pindo in Swahili) along all four sides , and a central part (called mji) that differs in design from the borders. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print applied by a rotary printing machine. Most often it is a multicolored, dark wax print on a lighter background. Kitenge is similar to the kanga, but of a thicker cloth and has edging on the long side only. Kitenge is also a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Sales from Agatha’s store enable her to earn approximately $US200 per month. She is requesting a loan of $US275 in order to purchase wholesale quantities of cloth that she can retail for a handsome profit. With these increased profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies in wholesale to boost her business

loans.name: Tillomurod.

texts.ru:
Tillomurod M. resides in the Khuroson region of Tajikistan. He is 52 years old and is married with six children. His family’s only income is his animal husbandry business. He’s been involved in this work for five years. Tillomurod is planning to obtain a loan for constructing an additional department in the stall. This would improve the conditions for growing cattle. Tillomurod plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Муродов Тилломурод проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 52 года , женат и имеет шестерых детей. Единственным источником дохода его семьи является его бизнес в сфере животноводства. Уже пять лет занимается животноводством. Тилломурод планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы пристроить дополнительный отсек в коровнике. Это поможет ему улучшить условия для разведения скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Smilja

texts.en:
Smilja is a widow from the village of Laktai.  All of her children are married and she now lives alone.  She receives a small retirement pension in the amount of 350 KM (less than $270 USD) per month.  She also does some small-scale farming, like many families in Bosnia, to produce enough food for her needs. 

 Smilja is requesting this loan from Zene za Zene in the amount of 1200 KM because she wants to buy pigs.  It is her wish to fatten the pigs, then sell them for a profit or slaughter them to sell their meat.  This additional income will be incredibly important to her.  The small pension she earns is not enough to meet her expenses, and Smilja is relying on this new business to help her earn money she needs to get by.

loans.use: To buy pigs to fatten and sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. makes a living producing cellophane. She is 28 years old, married and has four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in her current line of work for five years. She learned this business from a friend, and needs a loan to buy more materials to make additional cellophane.

loans.use: To buy more materials to make additional cellophane.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She owns and operates a beauty salon that she just established four months ago. By working 13 hours a day for six days every week, she is already showing a monthly profit of $US200 from the salon! Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

Mary is requesting a loan $US275 to buy additional supplies such as hair dryers and other hair products for her store, which will allow her to serve more customers and generate additional income.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Efe I. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old, married and has two children. Since 2005, he has made a living selling drinks, and has applied for a loan of $525 to buy more beverages to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Lellou

texts.fr:
Mr. Lellou has a hardware shop in the Tilene district, not far from the center of town. He is requesting this loan to bolster his stock of iron and cement. He hopes to recruit a salesperson to help him with his shop and sell these products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

M. LELLOU s'est installe au quartier TILENE, non loin du centre ville. IL a une quincaillerie, il demande ce pret pour renforcer son stock de fer et ciment. Il envisage de recruter un vendeur pour l'aider dans la vente de ses produits.

loans.use:
adding to his stock of hardware products for re-sale

Quincaillerie

loans.name: Danica

texts.en:
Danica is a widow from the town of Laktasi.  She receives a small retirement pension in the amount of 350 KM (less than 270 USD) per month.  To support herself, Danica has been selling milk to the local dairy, and can make up to 350 KM a month with these sales.  This business has been going well for her, but Danica's cow is old, and she will need to get a new one to keep up her income.  

Danica is requesting this loan in the amount of 1200 KM to buy a young dairy cow that she will use for milk production. She thinks she can increase the amount of milk she can sell to the dairy and increase her household income with this investment.

loans.use: To buy a young cow and sell its milk

loans.name: Sayli

texts.ru:
Saili P. resides in the Abdurahmon Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 40 years old and is married with four children. She is trained as a nurse and works in the local policlinic. In her free time she works in agriculture. Her husband and children help her. She has collected her first harvest. For another harvest, she would like to purchase quality seeds and mineral fertilizers. Therefore she would like to obtain a loan for the period of 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Пирова Сайли жительница района А.Джоми. Возраст 40 лет, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование средне-техническое, по специальности медицинская сестра. Она работает мед.сестрой в местной поликлинике. В свободное от работы время клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством. Помогаютей ее муж и дети. В данный момент она собрала первый урожай. На повторный посев она хочет закупить качественные семена и минеральные удобрения. На что она решила взять кредит сроком на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Mirzomuddin

texts.ru:
Mirzomuddin P. lives in the Jomi region. He is 33 years old and has 3 children. He has a bachelor's degree in journalism. Since his salary is very low, which is not sufficient to maintain his family, he has been in the farming business for the past 6 years. He plants corn on the small piece of land he owns every year. He uses the corn as a feedstock for chickens and cattle. He sells any extra corn to the neighbors. Since he is the sole provider for his family, this activity helps him to pay for all of the necessities. At this point in time, Mirzomuddin wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers so he could grow quality crops. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Пиров Мирзомудин житель района А.Джоми . Возраст 33 года, женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование высшее,по специальности журналист. Так как заработная плата маленькая и ее не хватает на содержании семьи клиент вот уже 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он сеет кукурузу на своем набольшом участке каждый год. Кукурузу использует как корм курам и фураж для своей коровы. Лишнее продает своим соседям .Этот вид деятельности позволяет ему содержать свою семьюьТак как кормильцем семьи является он сам. В данный момент Мирзомудин хочет купить семеня и минеральные удобрения ,что бы получить качественный урожай. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agness K. is a married Tanzanian woman who raises poultry. She has been in this business for four years. She raises both broilers and layers. The eggs are sold wholesale to distributors. She also runs a clothing shop. She earns a lot by selling poultry products. The income derived is used to meet the daily demands of her family. She is requesting a loan of $1200 for her business. Her business area is Lumo, beside Dar-es-Salaam city.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru:
Gulmorod K. lives in the Khuroson town. He is 65 years old, married, and has 8 children. He has secondary education. He is a teacher by training and works in school. Because his salary is very low, he is involved in buying and selling animals. He purchases young sheep at a market, feeds them for one month, and sells them at a profitable price. At this point in time, he would like to purchase 4 sheep, for which he needs funds. For this reason, he decided to obtain a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Камолов Гулмурод житель района Хуросон.Возраст 65 лет, женат, имеет 8 детей. Специальность средне-техническое.По специальности учитель. Клиент работает в средней школе . Но так как заработная плата очень малненькая клиент занимается куплей продажей сельхоз животных. Он покупает на рынке молодых барашкев , откармливает их в течении 1 месяца и перепродает на рынке ,по выгодной ему цене. В данный момент клиент хочет купить 4 барашкев для чего емй нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sheep

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a shop that sells a variety of items at the Mbagala market in the Temeke District of Dar-es-Salaam. She purchases products from the wholesalers at the Kariakoo city shopping center and then resells them. She wants to run a wholesale shop. Income generated from her business is used to meet daily family demands and also to pay the school fees of her two children. She is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Amirali

texts.ru:
Amirali B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has secondary education and was trained as a telecommunications worker. He works at "Tochiktelecom" in Khuroson region, and additionaly, he is in the business of buying and selling animals. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. He would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase several sheep. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобиев Амирали проживает в районе Хуросон.Возраст 37 лет.Женат имеет троих детей,образование среднее.По специальности связист ,работает Точиктелекоме в районе Хуросон,дополнительно занимается бизнесом купли продажи скота .Имеет опыт в бизнесе3 года.Хочет получит кредит для покупки овец.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Karimhon

texts.ru:
Karimhon A. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He works as a teacher at a local school, and additionally, he is in the business of buying and selling animals. He has been in this business for the past 2 years. He plans to provide meat and milk to the local residents. He would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase sheep. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Abрахимов Каримхон проживает в районе Хуросон.Возраст 34 года.Женат имеет двоих детей,работает учителем в средней школе,дополнительно занимается бизнесом купли продажи скота ,имеет опыт в бизнесе 2 года. планирует обеспечит мясом,и молоком жителей.Хочет получит кредит для купли продажи крупно рогатого скота.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
Born on March 29, 1976 in Abomey, the ancient capital of Benin, Ms. Emilienne A. is married to Mr. Nicolas Avoce. She has two children who are both in school. Three years ago, she opened a computer store which offers different services to the public, such as photocopying, scanning, typing of documents, and even training in computers. In order to offer quality services to the public, she is requesting her second loan for 360,000 francs so she can buy computer accessories.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 29 Mars 1976 à Abomey dans la capitale historique du BENIN, dame A. Emilienne est mariée à monsieur AVOCE Nicolas. Elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Elle a ouvert depuis trois ans, un centre informatique qui offre au public différents services tels que la photocopie, le scannage, la saisie de documents et même la formation en informatique. Dans le but d'offrir au public des services de qualité, elle sollicite pour son deuxième crédit 360 000 francs pour l'achat d'accessoires informatiques.

loans.use: Purchase of two laser printers, two cartons of A4 paper, and 4 ink cartridges

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and has two lovely daughters who are 3 and 8 years old. His family lives in Drogobych, where he also operates his woodwork business manufacturing wooden products and offering woodwork services. He has been working at his workshop day and night for the last 10 years. Presently, he has about $4,000 in business. 

Volodimir is a Christian businessman. He manages his enterprise on the basis of Christian values and ethics. He is also a skilled professional and his expertise allows him to run his business successfully. Volodimir offers only high quality products and cheerful and customer-friendly service. He is requesting a loan of 4000 Grivnas to purchase raw materials and increase his income as a result.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina H. is a Tanzanian business woman. She runs a grocery store in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam city. She sells a variety of items, including soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to expand her business. Income generated from the business is used to feed her family. Her business dream is to operate a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina lives in her mother’s home on 7th of August Street in the Villa San Juan section of La Paz city; she has two children and has been separated from her husband for more than 10 years. She sells fruit, especially apples; her stand is located on a centrally located street in La Paz where she sells her products Monday through Saturday and on Sundays she sells food in a field near her home. With these two activities she can cover her minimum necessities. The loan she is seeking is to increase her capital and buy more fruit and ingredients to prepare the food that she sells on Sundays and maintain the source of her work.

She has been a client of Impro since May 2007 and her payment history is very good, therefore she qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Paulina vive en casa de su madre en la calle 7 de agosto de la zona Villa San Juan de la ciudad de La paz; ella tiene dos hijos y esta separada del esposo hace mas de 10 años. La actividad que realiza es la venta de fruta, en especial manzanas; su puesto esta ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de La Paz lugar donde vende sus productos de lunes a sábado y los días domingos vende comida en una cancha cercana a su domicilio. Con estas dos actividades ella puede cubrir sus más mínimas necesidades; el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más frutas e insumos para preparar las comidas que vende los Domingos y mantener su fuente de trabajo.

Es cliente de Impro desde mayo de 2007 y su historial de pagos es muy bueno, por lo tanto califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy fruit for her fruit stand and also by ingredients for her business selling food.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing I. is 40 years old, married and has two children. She owns a store were she sells groceries and other items. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria and has been in business for one year. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more provisions to sell, and wishes to extend her thanks to everyone who chooses to help her.

loans.use: To buy more provision to sell

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is divorced. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo, a small town in Western Ukraine. It has always been hard for Nadezhda to meet even her most basic needs. To provide for herself, she decided to start her own small business selling clothing and footwear in the central marketplace. Nadezhda has been in this trade for 15 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $5,000. Her net profit is $600 a month.  

Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped Nadezhda expand her clothing and footwear business. Through persistence, hard work, and further loans, she is hoping to increase her sales even more in the future. Nadezhda would like a loan to increase her turnover capital. This loan will not only help Nadezhda's business grow but will also give her a better livelihood.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience A. is 32 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she has made a living selling clothes since 2003. She needs a loan of $350 to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lucienne Founke

texts.fr:
Born around 1971 in Kétou in the Plateau department of southeastern Benin, Ms. Lucienne Founke O. is married to Roger Singbo and has 4 children who are all in school. Ms. O. lives in Lokokoukoumé, one of the neighborhoods in the city of Cotonou, where she sells various types of fruit such as bananas, oranges, pineapples, and other seasonal fruits. She buys her stock in the most remote villages of Benin, where fruit is relatively less expensive. Her current stock does not allow her to keep up with customer demand. In order to meet this ever-growing demand, she is requesting this loan so she can improve her business.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers les années 1971 à Kétou dans le département du Plateau au Sud-est du Bénin, dame O. Lucienne Founke est mariée à SINGBO Roger et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Dame O. Lucienne Founke est domiciliée à Lokokoukoumè un des quartiers de la ville de Cotonou où elle exerce son activité de vente de diverses sortes de fruits tels que les bananes, les oranges, l'ananas et autres fruits de saison. Elle s'approvisionne dans les villages les plus reculés du Bénin où les fruits sont relativement moins chers. Son stock actuel ne lui permet pas de satisfaire entièrement la demande de sa clientèle. Pour faire face à cette demande de plus en plus grandissante, elle demande ce crédit afin de mieux se positionner sur le marché de vente de fruits saisonniers.

loans.use: Purchase of three baskets of mangos and a pile of pineapples

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow. She lives in Korolyovo and supports herself by operating a business selling clothing and footwear in the central market of her home town. Nataliya offers a nice selection of assorted merchandise. She has been in this business for 5 years. Her current monthly profit is $600. 

Nataliya has been using the services of Nadiya Ukraine for awhile. She is constantly seeking to be even more efficient and successful in her business. Nataliya is hoping to get a loan of 3000 Grivnas to increase her stock of assorted merchandise and meet the growing demand of her customers. Her determination and focus on success makes her an aspiring and promising entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija Sambalukamba is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She has four children. Her business is to sell bedcovers and clothes. She purchases inventory from the Mchikichini petty business market and sells it to customers in the Mbagala area in Temeke Dar Es Salaam. She is requesting a loan of $550 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Born in the 1970s in Cotonou in southern Benin, Ms. Elisabeth A. is married and has five children, of which two are still in school and under her care. For more than a decade, she has lived in Agblangandan, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou, where she sells saltwater fish and freshwater fish in her shopfront. The size of her client base has become so large that it is almost impossible for her to keep up with the ever-growing demand, due to a lack of financial means. In order to do so, she took out her first loan in 2007 for 50,000 francs, which allowed her to stock up sufficiently. The experience was very profitable for her because her capital was increased. With the goal of reinvesting even more into her business, and satisfying customer demand, she is requesting her second loan for the sum of 200,000 francs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers les années 1970 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN, dame A. Elisabeth est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont les 02 derniers scolarisés sont à sa charge. Elle s'est installée depuis plus d'une décennie à AGBLANGANDAN un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou où elle se livre à la vente de poisson de mer et aussi de lac à sa devanture. L'affluence des clients est devenue si importante qu'il lui était devenu quasi impossible de pouvoir satisfaire la demande de plus en plus croissante des clients faute de moyens financiers. Pour ce faire, elle a contracté en 2007 un premier prêt de 50 000 francs qui lui a permis de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante. L’expérience a été très profitable pour elle car son capital s’est accru. Dans le but de renforcer davantage cette activité et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle vient solliciter pour son deuxième prêt la somme de 200 000 francs.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cartons of frozen fish

loans.name: Queenette

texts.en: Queenette N. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells and rents building materials like ladders, head pans, wheel barrows, etc. She has been in this business since 2004. She needs the loan of $1200 to buy more building materials for sale and rental.

loans.use: To buy more building materials for sale and renting

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac A. is a tailor who sews different styles of clothing for his customers. He is 52 years old and married with four children. Isaac lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where he has been in business since 1980. He is seeking a loan of $850 to buy another sewing machine and more materials to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and more material to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario lives in her own house on Landaeta Street, in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and has two grown children. Rosario is 56 years old. She makes flower pots using artificial flowers which she paints, decorates and puts together herself. She sells these crafts in markets as well as in shopping centers which allow for art exhibits.

With this activity, she covers all her basic needs and can support herself. The loan she is requesting is to buy more supplies, such as pots, flowers and other supplies, so she can continue with her business. Her record with IMPRO is good. She has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and her payment history qualifies her to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosario vive en casa propia en la calle Landaeta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; ella esta separada del esposo tiene dos hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Rosario tiene 56 años de edad, la actividad que realiza es la elaboración de macetas con flores artificiales que ella pinta, decora y arma con sus propias manos hasta el acabado completo. Estas artesanías ella las vende en las ferias y también en centros comerciales que se dedican a la exposición de este arte. Con esta actividad ella cubre sus necesidades y puede mantenerse y cubrir sus necesidades; el crédito que solicita es para comprar más material, como ser macetas, flores y otros, para continuar con su negocio. Su antecedente con IMPRO es bueno, ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005 y su historial de pagos la califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson lives in his parents´home on Arturo Borda street in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. He is 26 years old and his work is assemblying computers and installing software. In addition to this activity, Wilson is a technician and he also repairs radios and other electrical equipment.

He is requesting a loan to make repairs to his home. The wood flooring in the living room is deteriorating because of humidity and runs the risk of collapsing if it is not fixed immediately. His record with IMPRO is good, his payment history is excellent and this qualifies him to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Wilson vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Arturo Borda de la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 26 años de edad y la actividad a la que se dedica es el armado de computadoras y el software de las mismas; además de esta actividad, Wilson es técnico y también arregla radios y artefactos eléctricos.

El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su casa ya que el piso de machimbre de la sala esta cediendo por la humedad y corre el riesgo de hundirse si no se efectúan los arreglos inmediatamente. El historial que tiene con Impro es bueno, su historial de pagos es excelente y esto lo califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy supplies to repair the floors in his home.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married and has three children. He lives with his family in Ordzhonikidze. Sergei makes and repairs shoes in a small shop he owns. He started the business 16 years ago. He has gained a reputation for outstanding quality which brings more customers to his shop each day. Presently, he has about $3,000 of turnover capital. His monthly income is about $1,000. 

Sergei would love to see his turnover capital and income increase. He wants to gain firm stability and aims at further development of his enterprise. This time he is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to buy raw materials which would help him realize his goals. Sergei has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine and will be able to promptly repay this loan.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Sidi Alida

texts.fr:
Ms. Sidi Alida L. was born on November 30, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Mr. Yacoubou Yaya, a reseller of used vehicles, and she has one child. During the first half of her day, Ms. L. sells fabric to the public and private businesses of Cotonou. During the second half of her day, she sells ready-to-eat meals, such as salads, fried chicken, and spaghetti in front of a popular bar. Her average daily profit is 25,000 Francs (about $56). She is requesting this loan so she can keep up with customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Dame L. Sidi Alida est née le 30 novembre 1985 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN. Elle est mariée à monsieur YAYA Yacoubou, revendeur de véhicules d'occasion et mère d'un enfant. Pendant la première moitié de la journée, dame L. Sidi Alida se livre à la distribution des tissus dans les services publics et privés de Cotonou. Dans la seconde moitié de la journée, elle se livre à la vente de repas prêt à manger tels que la salade, du frit au poulets et du spaghetti à la devanture d'un bar bien fréquentée. En moyenne, elle fait un chiffre d'affaire journalier de 25 000 francs. Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cartons of frozen goods, 3 baskets of condiments, and 5 cartons of spaghetti

loans.name: Christophe Koffi

texts.fr:
Christophe Koffi A. is 33 years old, married and the father of 2 children who both attend school. He lives in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. For the last five years he has worked as an herbicide and insecticide merchant. Due to the demand of his clientele, Koffi would like to use this loan to increase his business by purchasing more products to sell. The income from his business will help him meet the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Christophe Koffi A. est âgé de 33 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Il réside à Avetonou, nu village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est revendeur des herbicides et insecticides depuis lus de 5 ans. En fonction de la demande de la clientèle, Koffi souhaite, par ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son activité en achetant plus de produits pour la revente. Les fruits de son activité lui permettront de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of herbicides and insecticides for resale

loans.name: Success

texts.en: Success I. is 42 years old, married and has six children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling food and phone cards. She has been in this business since 2000, and has applied for a loan of $1,200 to buy more food and phone cards to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food and phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Fatou  Idy

texts.fr:
Fatou Idy S., age 58, is married and has 2 children to support, out of which one school-attending daughter. She's the president and an energetic member of the Alwar village bank. Her business consists in going to Cap Skiring and to Kafountine to buy dried fish and conch, and to resell them at the Tilène market where she has a stall. She wants to bolster her business to better provide for her family, that she has to support on her own. Fatou is seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou Idy S. âgée de 58 est mariée avec 02 enfants en charge dont une fille qui fréquente l’école. Elle est présidente et dynamique membre du banc villageois de Alwar. Son activité consiste à acheter des poissons secs et du yett au Cap Skiring et à Kafountine pour revendre au marché Tilène ou elle dispose d' un étal. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer l’entretien de sa famille qui est entièrement à sa charge. Fatou sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase and resell dried fish and conch

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca L. P. was born in 1972 and is currently 36 years old. She resides in the Buena Vista area of the town of La Ceiba, which is in the municipality of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, department of Solola. Every day since she was a young girl, Francisca L. P. has wanted to become a successful member of her community. When she was young, her parents did not give her the chance to go to school. But she was a fighter, always trying to meet great people and glean something from them so that she would have a successful future. Thanks to her efforts, she was was able to set up a small store selling and buying traditional clothing, which is what most people wear in her community. Every day she is friendly and respectful of people and so her business has been growing. This is why she needs enough money to fulfill her clients' needs. She decided it necessary to go to the Asociacion ASDIR office in order to apply for a loan, always with the goal of her business becoming the most well-known businees in the community. This way she can fulfill her clients' needs and create better living conditions for her family. Francisca L. P.'s community know her as a helpful person with good principles. She has created jobs for her community through her current business which helps all members of the community have an example of a person who is always capable of achieving goals as long as he or she seeks to be a better person every day.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Francisca López P., nació en el año de 1,972, actualmente cuenta con 36 años de edad, su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en el Sector Buena Vista de la Aldea La Ceiba, jurisdicción municipal de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, departamento de Sololá, día adía desde su niñez doña Francisca López Perechú ha venido siempre con el objetivo de lograr ser una persona exitosa en la comunidad, en su niñez sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de asistir a una escuela, mas sin en bargo ella lucho y siempre se propuso conocer personas importantes y lograr captar algo de ellos para lograr ser una persona con futuro, gracias a sus esfuerzos ella logro establecer un pequeño negocio en compra y venta de Ropa típica que es el que mas se utiliza en la comunidad de su residencia, día a día la gente con su amabilidad y su buena conducta en la comunidad este negocio se ha ido creciendo, por tal razón que le falta capital suficiente para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela se vio en la necesidad de acudir en la oficina de la Asociación ASDIR, para solicitar un crédito siempre con en objetivo de que su negocio sea el mas conocido en la comunidad y así lograr satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela y lograr una mejor condición de vida para su familia. A dona Francisca López P., se le conoce en la comunidad como una persona con buenos principios y colaboradora y en la cual ha generado fuentes de trabajo en su negocio que tiene actualmente y también esto contribuye a que cualquier persona de la comunidad tenga como ejemplo que uno siempre tiene la capacidad de lograr las cosas solo teniendo díaa día el objetivo de ser cada día mejor.

loans.use: Store: "Buying and selling Traditional Clothing"

loans.name: Massiratou

texts.fr:
Born around 1961 in Porto-Novo in the department of Ouémé, southeastern Benin, Mrs. Massiratou S. is married and the mother of four children, of whom Faoziath and Kabil, in 10th and 8th grades respectively, are still in her care. She sells electrical equipment and hardware in a store not far from her home in Avotrou. In order to meet the ever-growing demand of her customers, whom she can no longer satisfy due to lack of capital, she is requesting a loan to buy inventory and strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1961 à Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud-est du Bénin, dame S. Massiratou est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont Faoziath et Kabil respectivement en classe de seconde et de quatrième au cours secondaire sont encore à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse des matériaux d'électricité et de quincaillerie dans une boutique non loin de sa résidence à d'Avotrou. Afin de contenir la demande sans cesse croissante de clients qu'elle n'arrive plus à satisfaire pour raison d'insuffisance de capital , elle sollicite ce prêt pour s'approvisionner et renforcer son activité.

loans.use: To buy 10 rolls of electrical cord and miscellaneous electrical items.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie G., age 49, is a widow and the mother of 4 adult and married children. She's been a member of the Alwar village bank for 7 years. Her business consists in buying and reselling palm oil and lemons. She purchases her goods in Guinea and sells them in Dakar. To improve her living conditions, she wants to strengthen her business, after the latter experienced some decline due to her husband's illness, followed by her becoming a window. Marie is seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Marie G., 49 ans est veuve et mère de 04enfants adultes et mariés. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Alwar depuis7 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre de l’huile de palme et du citron. Elle s’approvisionne en Guinée et vend à Dakar. Elle veut renforcer son commerce qui a connu une baisse avec la maladie de son mari suivi du veuvage pour améliorer ses conditions de vie. Marie sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase and resell palm oil and lemons

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi A. is 35 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. For more than 6 years, she has worked as a grain seller in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan she wishes to purchase corn, millets, rice and beans to resell. The profits from her sales will allow her to better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Essi A. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales, depuis plus de 6 ans, à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter du maïs, du mil, du riz et du haricot pour la revente. Les profits de ses ventes lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: The purchase of corn, millets, rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Victoire Zansi

texts.fr:
Born on July 25, 1979 in Cotonou, southern Benin, Mrs. Victoire Zansi Z. is married and the mother of two children, both of whom have been to school and are in her care. She lives in Avotrou, one of Cotonou's working-class neighborhoods, with her husband and children, and sells ready-to-eat meals at the side of a fairly busy road within a few dozen yards of her home. In tandem with this business she also distributes shoes and ladies handbags that come from Lomé in Togo. In order to make selling shoes and ladies handbags a lot more profitable, she plans to display these items in a store already rented not far from her home. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so she can achieve her goals and also improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 25 Juillet 1979 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN, dame Z. Victoire Zansi est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Elle vit à AVOTROU l'un des quartiers populaires de Cotonou avec son époux et ses enfants où elle se livre à la vente de repas prêt à manger au bord d'une voie assez pratiquée et située à quelques dizaines de mètre de son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité elle fait aussi la distribution de chaussures et de sacs dames en provenance de LOME au TOGO. Pour rendre la vente de chaussures et de sacs dames beaucoup plus rentable, elle envisage les exposer dans une boutique déjà louée non loin de son domicile. Pour cette raison, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de réaliser ses projets et aussi afin d'améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 6 dozen ladies handbags.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Bintou Sané, age 51, is married and the mother of 2 school-attending children that she has to support. She's been a member of the Alwar village bank for 7 years. To bolster her business, she wants to buy pieces of sheet metal, cement and paint to renovate her luncheonette. She also wants to buy tableware and food products (beef, black-eyed pea, sugar, condensed milk and spaghetti) to prepare meals to sell (breakfast, soup and dinner). Her revenues enable her to provide for her family. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Bintou Sané âgée de 51 est mariée avec 02 enfants qui vont à l’école à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Alwar depuis 7 ans. Pour renforcer son activité elle veut acheter des tôles, du ciment, de la peinture pour réfectionner sa gargote et acheter aussi de la vaisselle et des denrées (pattes de bœuf, niébé, sucre, lait concentré et pâtes spaghetti) pour la préparation des repas à vendre (petit déjeuner,soupe et diner). Ses revenus lui permettent d’assurer la prise en charge de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To renovate her luncheonette and to buy food products

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou E. is 39 years old, married and the father of 6 children. He is a farmer in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Mr. Kokou hopes to increase his production by leasing more land that is suitable for cultivation. The increase of his production will allow him to earn more to support his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Kokou E. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants. Il est cultivateur à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Kokou espère par ce crédit accroître sa production en baillant d’autres parcelles cultivables. L’augmentation de sa production lui permettra de dégager plus de bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: To lease land suitable for cultivation

loans.name: Niètaga (Le Succès) Group

texts.fr:
Niètaga is a group of seven women, all married, with an average age of 35 and on average 5 children, living in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-spouses, and children in the first district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

United by bonds of neighborhood and profession, they are engaged in a variety of activities: food service; firewood sales; sales of locally produced, non-alcoholic drinks; sales of ice, fruit and vegetables, cooking salt, etc. In their search for suitable financial resources to bolster their businesses, the members joined the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly reimbursed their first loan, they are requesting their second. They intend to use it to buy a truckload of firewood, two sacks of sugar, one sack of rice for porridge, and one sack of cooking salt. They purchase their firewood from rural people who have a permit to cut wood in the villages near Koutiala, and the other articles are bought from the merchants at the big open-air market of Koutiala.

They sell retail, for cash or frequently on credit, out of their houses, door-to-door, and in the market of the first district, to a diverse and varied clientele: bakers, housewives, clerks, etc.

With this loan, they expect to earn an average profit of 80,000 FCFA which will be used to make the payments on the loan and contribute to family living expenses. In the future, the members of Niètaga group intend to diversify their businesses, adding on other profitable activities.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Niètaga est un regroupement de sept femmes toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs époux, des coépouses et leurs enfants au premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala ( région de Sikasso République du Mali).

Unis par des liens de voisinage et professionnel elles mènent différentes activités : la restauration, le commerce du bois de chauffe, des boissons locales non alcoolisées, de la glace, des fruits et légumes, du sel de cuisine etc. Dans leurs recherches de ressources financières complémentaires pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont intégré le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt de groupe, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt qu’elles comptent utiliser pour acheter, la contenance d‘un camion en bois de chauffe, deux sacs de sucre, un sac de riz pour la bouillie et un sac sel de cuisine. Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans ayant des permis de coupe de bois dans les villages voisins de Koutiala et les autres articles sont achetés auprès des commerçants du grand marché de Koutiala.

Elles vendent en détail au comptant souvent à crédit à domicile, en ambulant et au marché du premier quartier à une clientèle diversifiée et variée : boulangers, ménagères, employés etc.

Avec ce prêt, elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen 80 000 F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille. Dans l’avenir, les membres du groupe Niètaga comptent diversifier leurs activités en y ajoutant d’autres activités rentables

loans.use:
Purchase of foodstuffs and firewood for re-sale

Achat de produits alimentaires et du bois de chauffe

loans.name: Kokoutse

texts.fr:
Kokoutse G. is 35 years old, married and the father of 4 children. He works as a motorcycle taxi driver in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan he hopes to buy his own motorcycle as he does not own the one he drives now. With this new motorcycle he will earn more and be better able to support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Kokoutse G. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il espère par ce crédit acheter sa propre moto puisque celle qu’il conduit ne l’appartient pas. Avec cette nouvelle moto, il gagnera plus pour mieux supporter les exigences de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of his own motorcycle

loans.name: Tiessiri (Le Courage) Group

texts.fr:
Tiessiri is a group of five women, mostly single, with an average age of 30 and on average 2 children, who live in traditional extended families in the Sogomougou district of the town of Koutiala (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

They have varied businesses: selling firewood, brooms, incense, costume jewelry, guinea-fowl eggs, etc. United by relationships of neighborhood, by friendship and professional ties, these women decided, in their search for complementary financing, to join the credit program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. They are on their second group loan, and the first was reimbursed without difficulty.

They intend to use this new loan to buy a truckload of firewood, guinea-fowl eggs, and various other items (such as earrings and necklaces guaranteed to last). They purchase their firewood from rural people from the villages surrounding the town of Koutiala who have permits to cut wood. As for costume jewelry, that comes from Abidjan (the capital of Côte d’ Ivoire).

The products are sold (often raw, or ready-to-eat as are the guinea-fowl eggs) in the surrounding markets, or out of their homes, for cash or often on credit, to a mostly female clientele. As for the firewood, that is sold to men as well as to women, but also to enterprises (bakeries, restaurants, etc.)

They expect to make on average 75,000 FCFA which will serve to pay off the loan and to help to cover family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Tiessiri est un regroupement de cinq femmes à majorité célibataires qui a une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Sogomougou de la ville de Koutiala (Région de Siikasso République du Mali).

Elles exercent differentes activités: le commerce du bois de chauffe, de balais, d’encense, de parures, des oeufs de pindade etc. Unies par des relations de voisinage d’amitié et professionnelle ces femmes ont décidé dans leurs recherches de ressources complémentaires, d’intégrer le programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans. Elles sont à leurs deuxième prêt de groupe et le premier a été remboursé sans difficulté.

Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter un chargement de camion en bois de chauffe, des oeufs de pintade et divers articles ( tels les boucles d’oreilles et de chaînes garanties). Elles s’approvisionnent en bois de chauffe auprès des paysans des villages environnants de la ville de Koutiala ayant une autorisation de coupe de bois. Quant aux parures elles proviennent d’Abidjan (capitale de la république de la Côte d’ ivoire).

Les produits sont vendus (souvant crues ou préparés comme les oeufs de pintades ) dans les marchés environnants, à domicile au comptant en détail et souvant à crédit à une clientèle généralement féminine. Quant au bois de chauffe il est vendu aussi bien aux hommes qu’aux femmes mais aussi à des entreprises (Boulangerie, restaurant etc....).

Elles espèrent réaliser en moyenne 75 000 CFA. qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux dépenses de la famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of firewood and costume jewelry for re-sale

Achat de bois de chauffe et parures

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou D., age 51, is a widow and the mother of 5 children, out of which she has to support four. She's been a member of the Manguiline Kadiamor village bank for 7 years. She wants to strengthen her business of transforming seafood. Fatou purchases shrimps in Pointe Saint-Georges, transform them, and resell them in Dakar. In doing so, she improves the living conditions of her family and support her four student children. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou D., 51 ans est veuve et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Kadiamor depuis7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de transformation de produits halieutiques. Fatou achète des crevettes à la Pointe Saint George, les transforme elle même et les revend à Dakar pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et soutenir ses quatre enfants qui sont étudiants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Transformation and reselling of seafood

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Mrs. Haoua Dembelé is 50 and lives with her 7 children (3 sons and 4 daughters) and her husband in a monogamous household in Sogomougou district in Koutiala Prefecture (the third economic region of the Republic of Mali). For financial reasons she was not able to attend school and began early on to undertake money-generating activities, particularly the sale of snacks and dyeing cloth. In the end, she opted to specialize in dyeing cloth, a business her mother had always been in (she learned the skill from her mother).

After 20 years of doing this work in her home, she has an excellent reputation in the town of Koutiala. Her products sell easily and the demand for them is steadily growing.

In order to meet this demand, Mrs. Haoua Dembélé decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now requesting her first individual loan.

She buys her “bazin” (a sort of damask; cloth much prized in Mali and in West Africa) in the big open-air market of Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and sometimes at the market in Koutiala from specialized wholesalers. She sells her products at home, in the big outdoor market of the town of Koutiala (displayed under a shed roof), or door-to-door, for credit or cash. She sends part of her production to San (the neighboring town near Koutiala) where her sister sells dyed “bazin”. Her clientele is essentially made up of women and a few men. The period before festivals is when she produces and sells the most.

With this loan, she intends to buy 1 length of “rich bazin” in white, 5 lengths of less rich “bazin”, 5 kg of dyes of different shades, and 5 kg of potash.

She expects to make a profit of 80,000 FCFA monthly which she will use to make the payments on the loan and contribute to family expenses, investing any remainder back into her business. Mrs. Haoua Dembélé intends to diversify her activities by opening a shop where she can sell dyed “bazin” and a sales point for dyes and potash for other Koutiala women engaged in dyeing cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Haoua Dembelé à 50 ans, et vit avec ses 7 enfants ( 3 garçons et 4 filles) et son mari dans une famille monogame au quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala.(troisième région économique de la république du Mali). Pour des raisons sociales elle n’a pas fréquenté l’ècole et s’est très vite interessée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente des friandises et la teinture. Finalement elle opta pour une spécialisation en teinture de tissus, activité que sa mère mène depuis toujours (et auprès de laquelle elle appris ce métier).

Après 20 ans d’exercice de cette activité à son domicile, elle jouit d’ une réputation sans pareille dans la ville de Koutiala. Sa production est ecoulée rapidement et la demande est de plus en plus importante.

Afin de faire face à cette demande Madame Haoua Dembélé décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et est à son premier prêt indivudiel.

Elle s’approvisionne en Bazin (tissus très prisé au Mali et en Afrique de l’ouest) au grand marché de Bamako( la capitale de république du Mali) et quelques fois au marché de Koutiala auprès des commerçants grossistes du domaine. Elle vend sa production à domicile, au grand marché de la ville de Koutiala sous un hangar sur une étale, en ambulant à crédit ou au comptant. Elle envoie une partie de sa production à San (ville voisine de Koutiala) où sa soeur fait le commerce de bazins teints. Sa clientèle est constituée essentiellement de femmes et de quelques hommes. Les périodes de fêtes constituent les périodes de grande production et de vente.

Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 1 pièce de bazin riche de couleur blanche, 5 pièces de bazin moins riche, 5 kg de teinture de différentes couleurs et 5 kg de potasse.

Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 80.000FCFA par mois qu’elle utilisera pour payer les intérêts du prêt subvenir aux dépenses de famille et investir le reste dans l’activité. Madame Haoua Dembelé compte diversifier ses activités en ouvrant une boutique de vente de bazins teintés et un point de vente des teintures et de potasse à l’intention des teinturières de Koutiala.

loans.use:
Purchase of lengths of white "bazin" damask (cloth that is highly prized in West Africa)

Achat des pièces de bazin blancs (Tissus très prisé en afrique de l’ouest

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Franklin is a taxi driver. He works from Monday to Sunday and his wife works at a fast-food restaurant in one of the neighborhoods in the south part of La Paz. He has three school-age children who are 14, 13 and 11 years old. Franklin and his family live in the Alto Seguencoma area of La Paz, in a rented house.

His loan will be used to repair and maintain his taxi, which is his working tool and with which he is able to earn the income he needs to support his family.

This is the first time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO. The loan will help him a great deal, as he will be able to do a thorough maintenance so his vehicle will be in good working condition for at least a year. This way he will improve his income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Franklin es chofer de radio taxi; trabaja de lunes a domingo y su esposa es empleada en un snack de la zona Sur de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene tres hijos en edad escolar de 14, 13 y 11 años cada uno. Franklin y su familia viven en la zona de Alto Seguencoma de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.

El crédito será destinado la reparación y mantenimiento de su radio taxi que es su herramienta de trabajo y con la cual logra ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia.

Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito le ayudará de gran manera ya que podrá realizar un mantenimiento completo y el vehiculo podrá trabajar en buenas condiciones por lo menos un año, y así mejorará sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

loans.use: Maintainence and purchase parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
Ramatoulaye D., age 54, is married and the mother of 5 children, out of which 3 attend school. She's been a member of the Manguiline Kadiamor village bank for 7 years. She wants to strengthen her business that consists in selling brooms and honey. She purchases her products in Guinea-Bissau and resells them in Dakar. Ramatoulaye helps her husband in supporting the family, by providing for her children's school expenses and improving the familial well-being. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Ramatoulaye D., 54 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 fréquentent l’école est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Kadiamor depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente de balais et de miel. Elle achète ses produits en Guinée Bissau et revend à Dakar. Ramatoulaye aide son mari dans l’entretien de la famille en assurant les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et en améliorant le bien être familial. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To purchase and resell brooms and honey

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata is a young woman who has recently opened a beauty shop. She is requesting this loan to acquire more equipment for her shop. With the modest income she makes from her work, she is able to support herself. She would also like to hire one or two girls to help her in putting the new equipment to use.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Fatoumata est jeune qui a ouvert un salon de coiffure ces temps-ci. Elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son equipement ; Avec le modeste revenu, elle parvient a se prendre en charge. Aussi elle veut en acquerant ce nouveau materiel recruter une a deux filles pour l'aider.

loans.use:
acquire new equipment for her beauty shop

Coiffure

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca is a saleswoman and sells goods such as fabrics for suits, perfumes and cosmetics by catalog. She sells her goods in offices and markets and charges her customers by the day, week or month. She is divorced and is the only means of support for her family; she has a daughter who is about to finish school. Her home is located in the Achachicala area of the city of La Paz

Her loan will be for purchasing more goods, fabrics, perfumes and cosmetics. This is the fifth time she has applied for a loan, and the second time she has asked for Kiva´s help. Her record qualifies her as a top client who meets her payment obligations. Her work and her efforts qualify her for this loan because of her experience in this type of sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Blanca es comerciante y vende mercadería, cortes de telas para trajes, perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo. Dicha mercadería la vende en las oficinas y mercados para cobrar a sus clientes cada día, a la semana o al mes. Es divorciada y la única que solventa a su familia ya que cuenta con una hija que esta por terminar en el colegio. Su domicilio ubicado en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz

El crédito será destinado la compra de más mercadería, telas y la compra de perfumes y cosméticos. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requiere la ayuda de Kiva; su historial la califica como cliente 1 con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. Su trabajo y esfuerzo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en la venta de mercadería a pedido.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as fabrics, perfume and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rose E. was born around 1966 in Adja Dévé, in Couffo Department. She is a widow and the mother of two children – Blaisine Male, born on July 12, 1987 in Hagounmè, also in Couffo Department, and a student of business and marketing, and Pierrette Male, born on July 8, 1990. Mrs. E. trained as a secretary. Since 1994 she has been living in Sainte Rita, a neighborhood of Cotonou. Mrs. E. is on her third loan. She sells food products such as beans, corn, rice and manioc flour, and fruits such as oranges and bananas. She gets her supplies from the markets in Dogbo and Avoze in Couffo Department. Customer demand has increased, and since she does not have sufficient financial means to meet such demand, she is requesting this loan so she can better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame E. Rose est née vers les années 1966 à Adja Dévé dans le département du COUFFO. Elle est veuve et mère de 02 enfants MALE Blaisine née le 12 Juillet 1987 à Hagounmè toujours dans le département du Couffo est étudiante en Marketing et Action Commerciale et MALE Pierrette née le 08 Juillet 1990. Dame E. Rose est secrétaire de formation. Depuis 1994, elle réside à Sainte Rita, l'un des quartiers de Cotonou. Dame EPKE Rose est à son troisième crédit. Elle vend des produits vivriers tels que le haricot, le maïs, le riz, de la farine de manioc et des fruits tels que les oranges, les bananes, etc. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché de DOGBO et de celui d'AVOZE dans le COUFFO. La demande des clients est devenue plus forte et n'ayant pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour couvrir ces demandes, elle sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy 2 bags of wheat flour, 3 bags of rice, 4 bunches of bananas and 5 bags of beans.

loans.name: Khady Barry

texts.fr:
Mrs. Khady Barry S. is a widow who lives with her children in the Randoulène district of Thies. She has been earning income for more than 25 years, notably by buying and selling grocery items. She has been a member of the loan program for 4 years and has always paid back her loans. She is requesting this loan with a view to bolstering her inventory before the Ramadan period.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

madame khady barry S. est une veuve qui vit avec ses enfants au quartier randoulène à thies.elle mène des activités génératrices de revenu depuis plus de 25 ans notamment l'achat et la vente de produits alimentaires.elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis 4ans et a toujours remboursé ses crédits .c'est dans le but de renforcer ses stocks avant le ramadan qu'elle demande ce pret.

loans.use:
bolster her little grocery store's inventory

commerce de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Deyinatou

texts.fr:
Deyinatou M. is 40 years old, married and the mother of six children. She sells grains in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometres from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this second FECECAV loan, she wishes to increase her stock by purchasing corn, millet, rice and beans. The income from her business will allow her to contribute to the expenses of her household. In this photo, Deynatou is being helped by her daughter.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Deyinatou M. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce second crédit de FECECAV augmenter le stock de ses marchandises en achetant du maïs, du mil, du riz et du haricot. Les fruits de son activité lui permettront d’intervenir dans la prise en charge des dépenses du foyer. Dans la photo, Deyinatou est aidée dans sa tâche par sa fille.

loans.use: The purchase of corn, millet, rice and beans

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Entente Est Bonne) Group

texts.fr:
The 10 women of the Benkadi group are all married and have an average age of 38 with on average 5 children. They live in big traditional extended families with their parents-in-law, their husbands, brothers and sisters, children, and generally with co-spouses, in the Dandila district of the village of Mèfa (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali). United by societal and professional ties (helped along by activities sponsored by the NGO, Foundation for International Development Africa) for some ten years, they are essentially involved in selling cereals, firewood, condiments, and various items found in shops.

In order to remediate their lack of financial resources, these women decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, from whom they are presently requesting their first loan.

They intend to use this loan to buy 12 sacks of unshelled peanuts, 4 sacks of millet, 32 wagonloads of firewood, a large quantity of condiments, and various items found in shops. They do their purchasing of firewood where they live or in neighboring villages (Zenguela, Farabougou et Gachi); they buy their cereals in Douga, Siguila, and Dialabougou, and they purchase their condiments and diverse items in the regional capital, Ségou.

The products are sold for cash door-to-door in Ségou, retail for cash or credit in the fairs of the surrounding villages, and out of their own homes. Their clientele is mostly female.

They expect to earn a monthly average profit of 16,000 FCFA which will be used essentially to make payments on the loan, to add to their business capital, and to cover family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Les 10 femmes du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec les beaux parents, leurs maris, les frères et sœurs les enfants et généralement des coépouses dans le quartier Dandila du village de Mèfa. (Région de Ségou République du Mali) Unies par des relations d’ordre sociale et professionnelle (les activités de l’ONG FIDA aidant) depuis une dizaine d’année, elles exercent essentiellement le commerce de graines de céréales, de bois de chauffe, de condiments alimentaires et d’articles divers de boutiques.
