Afin de pallier l’insuffisance des ressources financières ces femmes ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elles sont à leur premier prêt.

Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 12 sacs d’arachide non décortiqué, 4 sacs de mil, 32 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, une grande quantité de condiments et d’articles divers de boutique. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place ou dans les villages voisins (Zenguela, Farabougou et Gachi) en bois de chauffe; en céréales (Douga, Siguila, Dialabougou) et Ségou la capitale régionale pour les condiments alimentaires et les articles divers.

Les produits sont vendus au comptant en ambulant à Ségou, en détail et à crédit également au comptant dans les foires des villages environnants ou sur place à domicile. La clientèle est majoritairement féminine.

Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16.000 FCFA.qui servira essentiellement à payer les intérêts du prêt, augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use:
Purchase of firewood, cereals, and various other consumables for re-sale

Achat de bois de chauffe, de céréales, et d’articles divers de consommations

loans.name: Papa Moussa

texts.fr:
Papa Moussa F. is a young merchant who lives in Thies. He has a booth in the open-air market where he sells cell phones and telephone accessories. He is requesting this loan with a view to bolstering his inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

papa moussa F. est un jeune commerçant qui vit à thies.il a une cantine au marché ou il s'adonne à la vente de portables et d'accessoires de téléphone .c'est dans le but de s'approvisionner qu'il sollicite ce pret. ..

loans.use:
sale of cell phones and accessories

vente de portables et accessoires

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo S., age 34, is married and the father of 3 school-attending children. He lives in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, he'd like to outfit his workshop and to buy work tools to improve the performance of his business. In doing so, he will have more customers and therefore he will increase his profits to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodjo S. est âgé de 34 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il réside à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit aménager son atelier et aussi acheter des outils de travail pour rendre plus performant son activité. Ceci lui fera avoir plus de clients et par conséquent tirer plus de profits pour l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To outfit his workshop and buy work tools

loans.name: Dembagnouman (La Bonne Maman) Group

texts.fr:
The 8 members of the Dembagnouman group are all married and have an average age of 31 years and on average, 3 children. They live in traditional polygamous families, mostly with co-spouses, their husbands, children, and other relatives in the Bamanan district of the village of Mèfa (Ségou Region, Republic of Mali).

This group of women, bound by ties of neighborhood, age, and family, sell foodstuffs, agricultural products, and firewood.

In order to satisfy the ever growing demand for their wares, this group decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, which has just approved their request for their first loan. This loan will be used to purchase 30 wagonloads of firewood, 300 liters of fresh cow’s milk, and a substantial quantity of condiments.

They purchase their condiments from wholesalers at the big open-air market of the town of Ségou, their fresh cow's milk where they live in Mèfa and in surrounding villages, and their firewood in the villages of Zenguela, Farabougou and Gachi from legal suppliers.

The firewood and fresh cow’s milk are sold for cash, going door-to-door in the residential neighborhoods of Ségou. The condiments are sold in the surrounding villages or out of their homes. Their clientele is composed of women and men.

They hope to have an average monthly profit of 16,000 FCFA which they will use to invest in their businesses and cover family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Les 8 membres du groupe Dembagnouman sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles traditionnelles polygames en majorité avec des coépouses, leurs maris, les enfants et d’autres parents dans le quartier Bamanan du village Mèfa (Région de Ségou République du Mali)

Ce groupe de femmes lié par des relations de voisinage de groupe d’âge et de parenté, exerce le commerce des produits alimentaires, agricoles et de bois de chauffe.

Afin de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus forte, ce groupe a décidé d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso qui vient d’accepter de leur octroyer leur premier prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 30 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe, 300 litres de lait frais de vache et une importante quantité de condiments.

Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments alimentaires au grand marché de la ville de Ségou auprès des grossistes, en lait frais de vache sur place à Mèfa et dans les villages environnants, en bois de chauffe dans les villages de Zenguela, Farabougou et Gachi auprès des exploitants forestiers légalement établis pour cette activité.

Les bois de chauffe et le lait frais de vache sont vendus au comptant d’une façon ambulante dans les quartiers de la ville de Ségou. Les condiments alimentaires sont vendus sur place dans les villages environnants ou sur place à domicile. La clientèle est composée des femmes et d’hommes.

Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16.000 FCFA.qu’elles utiliseront à investir dans leurs activités et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use:
Purchase of foodstuffs and firewood for re-sale

Achat de produits alimentaires et de bois de chauffe

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr:
Matar B. is one of the first members of the Jammy Xaleyi de Imbec village bank in Thies. He has 14 years' experience in selling groceries. He has a little store located near his home and has already taken out and repaid several loans through the village bank. He is requesting this loan with a view to bolstering his inventory of grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

matar B. est l'un des premiers membres de la caisse de jammy xaleyi de imcec de thies.il a une expérience de 14 ans de vente de denrées alimentaires.il a une cantine située près de chez lui et a eu à contracter plusieurs crédits au sein de la mutuelle .c'est dans le but de renforcer ses stocks qu'il demande un nouveau pret.

loans.use:
bolstering his grocery inventory

vente de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Motar

texts.fr:
This stockbreeder buys sheep, fattens them, and then resells them for competitive prices at the market. Now, M. would like to grow the number of his livestock, and in order to accomplish this, he is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Cet eleveur achete des moutons les engraisse puis les revend sur le marche a des prix competitifs. Maintenant, M. voudrait accroitre son cheptel c'est pourquoi il sollicite un pret pour y arriver.

loans.use: Breeding

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Madeleine B. was born around 1966 in Natitingou, northwestern Benin. She is originally from Dassa. Married to Mr. Philippe Bossou, she is the mother of one child. She has been living in the Sainte Rita neighborhood since 1990. She is on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting this loan in order to meet the many demands of her clientele, which is increasing on a daily basis.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame B. Madeleine est née vers 1966 à Natitingou dans le Nord-ouest du BENIN. Elle est originaire de DASSA. Mariée au sieur BOSSOU Philippe, elle est mère d'un enfant. Elle réside dans le quartier Sainte Rita depuis 1990. Elle est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le but de satisfaire les nombreuses demandes de la clientèle qui ne fait que s'augmenter de jour en jour.

loans.use: To buy 4 cans of oil, 6 boxes of detergent, 3 bags of rice and miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan V., age 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's a fish reseller in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, she'd like to meet customer demand by buying more fish and ingredients. In doing so, she will increase her profits to better support her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Massan V. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de poissons à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit satisfaire la demande de la clientèle en achetant beaucoup plus de poissons et des ingrédients. Ce faisant elle dégagera plus de bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy more fish and ingredients

loans.name: Kotankègnè (Rien Ne Nous Est Impossible) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Kotankègnè (Nothing is Impossible for Us) group have an average age of 39, on average 4 children, and are all married. They live in big traditional polygamous families in the Dandila district of the village of Mèfa (fourth economic region of the Republic of Mali, Ségou). They have come together because of bonds of friendship and work. The Bendiya Mèfa association, to which the Kotankègnè group belongs, has had the chance to participate in lots of training sessions organized under the auspices of aid to rural organizations through the rural loan of the NGO Foundation for International Development Africa.

These women sell agricultural products, firewood, condiments, and charcoal. In their search for financial resources, this group, who had worked with several micro-finance institutions, finally decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, which has approved their first group loan request.

With this loan, they are going to buy 7 sacks of peanuts, 3 sacks of millet, 12 wagonloads of firewood, and a substantial quantity of condiments.

They purchase their condiments in Ségou; their cereals and firewood where they live (from rural people who have an authorization to cut wood) and in the surrounding villages such as Douga, Zenguela, Farabougou, Gachi, Siguila et Dialabougou.

The agricultural products and firewood are sold to wholesalers right in the village or sold in the residential neighborhoods of the town of Ségou, for cash, going door-to-door. As for the condiments, they are sold right in Mèfa out of their houses or in the market fairs of surrounding villages.

The clientele is mostly composed of middlemen who come from the big cities and of women. They expect to make a monthly average profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to make payments on the loan, with the remainder invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Les membres de Kotankègnè (Rien ne nous est impossible) ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4 enfants et toutes mariés vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles polygames dans le quartier Dandila du village de Mèfa (quatrième région économique de la république de Mali, Ségou). Elles se sont regroupées en raison de liens d’amitié et de travail. L’association Bendiya Mèfa à laquelle le groupe Kotankègnè appartient a bénéficié de beaucoup de formations organisées dans le cadre de l’appui aux organisations paysannes à travers le prêt de campagne par l’ ONG FIDA.

Ces femmes exercent le commerce de produits agricoles, du bois de chauffe, des condiments et du charbon de bois. Dans leur recherche de ressources financières ce groupe ayant eu à travailler avec plusieurs institutions de microfinance décida de rejoindre finalement Soro Yiriwaso lequel leur a accorder leur premier prêt de groupe.

Avec ce prêt elles vont acheter 7 sacs d’arachide, 3 sacs de mil, 12 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe et une quantité considérable de condiments alimentaires.

Elles s’approvisionnent en condiments à Ségou ; en céréales et en bois de chauffe sur place (auprès des paysans ayant une autorisation de coupe de bois) et dans les villages aux alentours (tels Douga, Zenguela, Farabougou, Gachi, Siguila et Dialabougou).

Les produits agricoles et le bois de chauffe sont vendus aux grossistes sur place au village ou vendus dans les quartiers de la ville de Ségou au comptant en ambulant. Quant aux condiments ils sont vendus sur place à Mèfa à domicile ou dans les foires des villages environnants.

La clientèle est majoritairement composée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes et les femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use:
Purchase of condiments, cereals, and firewood for re-sale

Achat de condiments, des grains de céréales et du bois de chauffe

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine H. sells groceries and phone credit cards. She is married, but her husband's income as a teacher is not sufficient for Josephine and her 5 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Moulikatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Moulikatou O. was born on August 11, 1965 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She is divorced with three children. She lives in Adogléta, Akpakpa, and has been selling art objects in the Dantokpa market since 1983. She gets her supplies from the markets in Mono Department, from Togo’s political capital Lomé and from Porto-Novo. She is requesting this loan in order to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame O. Moulikatou est née le 11 Août 1965 à Cotonou la capitale économique du BENIN. Divorcée, elle est mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite à Adogléta à Akpakpa et vend des objets d'arts au marché Dantokpa depuis 1983. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés du département du MONO, dans la ville capitale politique Lomé au TOGO, et à Porto-Novo. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire sa cliente.

loans.use: To buy art objects

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna E. sells cereals and other food items. She is married, but her husband's income as an electrician is not sufficient for Hanna and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna K. sells footwear (shoes and boots). He is married, but his wife's income in her business is not sufficient for them and their 3 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase various goods to replenish her grocery store.

loans.name: Louisa

texts.en: Louisa E. sells sweets (biscuits, toffees and others). She is single and is focused on developing herself. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: M. is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car.  He is married, but his wife's income as a trader is not sufficient for Samuel and his 5 children. Demand for his service is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business."

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel M. sells is a commercial driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car. He is married, but his wife's income Hairdresser is not sufficient for Joseph Maxwell M. and his 7 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Joseph Maxwell

texts.en: Joseph Maxwell M. A. sells is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car.  He is married, but his wife's income as a seamstress is not sufficient for Anthony and his 2 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony E. is a commercial driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car. He is married, but his wife's income as a farmer is not sufficient for them and their 6 children. Demand for his services is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr:
Mrs. Clarisse A. was born in Towéta, a Cotonou shantytown, around 1983. She is married to Mr. Akim Houwanou, who sells sheep. Mrs. A. is the mother of three children. She has concentrated on selling used bottles and cans since 1998. For this she goes from house to house collecting cans and bottles that households no longer need. She is requesting this loan to better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame A. Clarisse est née à Towéta un bidonville de Cotonou vers 1983. Elle est mariée au sieur HOUWANOU Akim un revendeur de mouton. Dame A. Clarisse est mère de 3 enfants. Elle est spécialisée dans la vente de bouteilles et de bidons usagers depuis 1998. Pour cette activité elle passe de maison pour recueillir les bidons et les bouteilles qui ne sont plus d'une utilité pour les ménages. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy used cans and bottles

loans.name: Tetteh

texts.en: Tetteh D. sells is a taxi driver who uses his own car. At the moment the car is giving him problems and he needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for the repairs of his car.  He is married, but his wife's income as a trader is not sufficient for Robert and his 6 children. Demand for his service is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aline H. was born around 1978 in Porto Novo, the political capital of BENIN. She is married to Mr. Adjobignon ADONADJI, a retailer of second-hand clothing. Mrs. Aline H. has been selling used bottles and cans since 1993 in the Dantokpa market in Cotonou. She is the mother of two children. These bottles and cans are bought from households before being cleaned and delivered to makers of local leaf- and root-based medicinal products. She is asking for this loan to better serve her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Dame H. Aline est née vers 1978 à Porto Novo la capitale politique du BENIN. Elle est mariée au sieur ADONADJI Adjobignon revendeur de vêtements usagers. Dame H. Aline vend des bouteilles et bidons usagers depuis 1993 au marché Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle est mère de deux enfants. Ces bouteilles et bidons sont achetées auprès des ménages avant d'être mis au propre pour être livré aux fabricants de produits pharmaceutique à base de feuille et racines locales. Elle vient solliciter pour mieux servir sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy and sell used bottles and cans

loans.name: Fatoumata Dioulde

texts.fr:
Fatoumata is a lady who has a shop located close to the Djignabo college. She prepares sandwiches for students and passerbys but she also sells other various items. She is requesting this loan to strengthen her business and to increase her profits so that she can take care of herself.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatoumata, une dame, a une boutique situee pres du lycee djignabo. Elle prepare des sandihw pour les eleves et passant mais aussi elle vend divers articles, elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son activite et faire davantage de benefice pour qu'elle puisse se prendre en charge.

loans.use: Sales

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Mr. MBEMGUE has a store located at the port of Ziguinchor, where he sells sports equipment. He is asking for a loan to strengthen his business. This is because during the wintering period, it is a business that works extremely well.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

M. MBEMGUE a un magasin situe au port de Ziguinchor, il y vend des equipements de sport. Pour renforcer son activite, il demande un credit. Car en cette periode d'hivernage c'est une activite qui marche fort.

loans.use: Sale of sports equipment

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Jacqueline A. was born on 2 October 1962 in Cotonou. Divorced, she is the mother of two children, both educated. Mrs. Jacqueline A. has been selling ready-to-eat meals at the Cotonou hall of arts and culture since 1 January 2008. She has 15 years of experience in the sale of food. She sells rice, beans, boiled maize flour paste, and cooked yams. She is asking for this loan with the hope of better satisfying her customers, composed mostly of visitors to the hall of arts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Jacqueline est née le 02 Octobre 1962 à Cotonou. Divorcée, elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Dame A. Jacqueline vend du repas prêt à manger au hall des arts et de la culture de Cotnou depuis le 01 Janvier 2008. Elle a 15 ans d'expérience dans la vente de nourriture. Elle vend du riz, du haricot, de la pâte de farine de maïs bouillie et d'igname cuite. Elle sollicite ce prêt dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle composée pour sa majorité des visiteurs de hall des arts.

loans.use: To buy one 25 kg bag of rice, 25 kg of beans, and various condiments

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr:
Mr. S. is a salesman at the Boucotte market located not far from the town centre. He only sells cosmetic products generally intended for women. Thanks to this business, he somehow manages to take care of his family. He requests this loan in order to strengthen his store.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

M. S., est un vendeur situe au marche boucotte non loin du centre ville. il ne vend que des produits cosmetiques adresses generalement aux femmes. Grace a cette activite, il parvient tant bien que mal a s'occupe de sa famille. Il sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son magasin.

loans.use: Sale of cosmetic products

loans.name: Jazmines-Uno Group

texts.es:
The community bank JASMINES-UNO is composed of 13 female members that are thankful for the help that the institution has provided. They have got together again in order to be able to work. Due to a bad experience in the previous cycle, in the current cycle the number of members has been reduced, assuring that in the next cycle the number of members will be increased. They are currently in their fourth cycle. The majority of the members invest their money in their businesses that are located in the German Moreno market in the city of Montero, such as Concepción who invested her loan in her clothing store or Sonia who, with a loan from AGROCAPITAL, started her business, which is a grocery store in her home in the Pampa la Madre neighborhood in Montero and proudly wants everyone to know that thanks to the institution she was able to start her business which is prosperous and helps her to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco comunal JASMINES-UNO compuesta por 13 socias agradecidas por el apoyo económico que brinda la institución es que se reorganizaron nuevamente para poder trabajar, ya que una mala experiencia en el anterior ciclo hizo que este actual ciclo disminuye en número D. integrantes , asegurando que el posterior ciclo aumentaran el numero D. socias, actualmente están en el 4 ciclo, la mayoría D. las socias invierte su dinero en sus negocios pues tienen sus ventas en el mercado German Moreno D. la ciudad D. Montero, como el caso D. la sra. Concepción que invirtió el préstamo en su venta D. ropa o el caso D. la Sra. Sonia que con el préstamo D. AGROCAPITAL inicio su negocio, una venta D. abarrotes en su domicilio en la zona D. la Pampa la Madre en Montero, que orgullosa hace conocer a todos que gracias a la institución pudo comenzar con su negocio que es prospero y le ayuda para mantener sus hijos.

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jenny Giovanna

texts.es:
Jenny works to improve the income of her home. Her earnings as a teacher are not sufficient, so, she saw the opportunity to establish a business selling cosmetics via catalog, which has been an economic source for her son’s studies as he will be starting his professional studies at the university soon, and this is the reason she works so hard. Additionally, Jenny offers her educational services providing private tutoring where she also has the opportunity to sell cosmetics to the mothers of her students. Now she wishes to increase her capital, so she is asking for an 800 soles loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

El trabajo de Jenny es realizado para mejorar la economía de su hogar. Sus ingresos como docente son insuficientes, por lo cual, vio la oportunidad de emprender el negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo, el que ha sido un sostén económico para los estudios de su hijo que en poco tiempo iniciará una carrera profesional, esta es la razón de sus esfuerzos. Adicionalmente, Jenny ofrece sus servicios educativos realizando clases particulares donde aprovecha en ofrecer sus cosméticos a las madres de sus alumnos. Ahora desea incrementar su capital de trabajo, para lo cual, solicita un préstamo de 800 soles.

loans.use: Increase capital to buy products.

loans.name: Ruth Gladis

texts.es:
Ruth has two small children, she dedicates herself to selling clothing. She began this business with a small clientele who were companions from her husband’s work as a taxi driver. She never imagined that her business was going to grow so much. The quantity of order she now has had surpassed her expectations and this is what inspires her to continue working hard to get ahead. This business has become an important source of income for her family. She is asking for a loan to travel to Lima so she can buy a greater quantity and variety of merchandise at a low price, that she can then sell in her town, earning greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth tiene dos hijos pequeños, se dedica a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio con un reducido número de clientes, que eran los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, nunca imaginó que su negocio iba a crecer tanto, la cantidad de pedidos que ahora tiene, han superado sus expectativas y es lo que le anima a seguir adelante y ser perseverante. Este negocio se ha convertido en una importante fuente generadora de ingresos económicos para su familia.El motivo por el que solicita este préstamo, es para viajar a la ciudad de Lima y comprar ahí, mayor cantidad de mercadería, más variada y a bajo precio, que pueda vender luego en su localidad, obteniendo mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Travel to Lima to buy merchandise for her clothing selling business

loans.name: Edith Amparo

texts.es:
Edith is a selfless mother of 2 children, whose wishes are to improve every day and this inspires her to continue working. Her husband works in a bakery, and 5 years ago they decided to work delivering the bread that they make. Their goal in the future is to have their own bakery, and to do this they continue working and saving their daily earnings from their baking. Edith is seeking a loan to invest in improving the infrastructure of their bread store, to put in a cement floor and buy more baskets for delivering bread.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Edith es una madre abnegada, tiene 2 hijos, sus deseos de mejorar cada día son los que la impulsan a continuar. Su esposo trabaja en un panadería, y hace 5 años juntos decidieron trabajar repartiendo el pan que ahí elaboran.Su meta a futuro es tener un taller panadero propio, para ello, siguen trabajando y ahorrando las ganancias que día a día les produce esta actividad.Edith solicita un préstamo que invertirá en la mejora de la infraestructura de su almacén de pan, mandarle a hacer un piso de cemento y comprar más canastas para la repartición de pan.

loans.use: improve the floor of her bread store and acquire more baskets to transport her product.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables to keep running her small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase some fashionable pants and blouses for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to produce fried dishes for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in some stylish pants to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase housewares to resell in her community.

loans.name: Lucy, Jackeline Y Elena Group

texts.es:
Lucy, Jackeline and Elena are members of the Good Luck Community Bank.

Lucy is 56 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. She makes a living weaving items such as sweaters, caps, gloves and scarves by hand, depending on the orders she receives. Lucy also sells gold jewelry ordered direct from jewelers on request from her customers.

Jackeline is 40 years old, separated and has two children. She sells milk products that she prepares herself such as yogurt and creme brulee. She buys the milk and then makes the products at home by herself, and her sales are done outdoors at Santo Domingo Park.

Elena is 42 years old, lives with her partner and has a son. She runs a store out of her home selling groceries, vegetables and fruits, and she also makes hand-woven items like sweaters on request from customers.

Lucy, Jackeline and Elena are requesting loans of 900 ($310), 300 ($105) and 900 soles, respectively, money they plan to invest in the purchas of wool, jewelry, sugar, glasses, rice and noodles.

These three women dream of improving their businesses, having a steady place to sell their products, buying some land and making headway for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Lucy, Jackeline y Elena son socias del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Lucy es conviviente, tiene 56 años y 3 hijos, Lucy se dedica a realizar tejidos a mano como chompas, gorras, guantes, bufandas, productos que realiza dependiendo de los pedidos que tenga. Además Lucy vende joyas de oro que manda a elaborar con joyeros de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Por otro lado Jackeline es separada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Jackeline vende productos lácteos que ella misma prepara como yogurt, leche asada, la leche lo compra de los productores y lo elabora sola en su casa, sus ventas los realiza ambulantemente en el parque Santo Domingo.

Mientras que Elena es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 1 hijo, Elena tiene una tienda en su casa donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, también Elena hace tejidos a mano como chompas de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes.

Lucy, Jackeline y Elena necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 300 soles, 900 soles, dinero que sera invertido en la compra de lanas, joyas, azúcar, vasos, arroz, fideos.

Los sueños de Lucy, Jackeline y Elena son mejorar sus negocios, tener un local estable para vender sus productos, comprar un terreno y sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Lucy, Jackeline and Elena are requesting loans of 900 ($310), 300 ($105) and 900 soles, respectively, money they plan to invest in the purchas of wool, jewelry, sugar, glasses, rice and noodles. / Lucy, Jackeline y Elena necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 300 soles, 900 soles, dinero que sera invertido en la compra de lanas, joyas, azúcar, vasos, arroz, fideos.

loans.name: Mirtha, Teofila Y Wilma Group

texts.es:
Mirtha, Teofila and Wilma are members of the Good Luck Community Bank.

Mirtha is 47 years old, married and has two children. She is a sales representative for cooking utensils and surgical supplies, and also sells natural products on credit to friends and relatives. She also runs a convenience store out of her home.

Teofila is 55 years old and single. She sells woven craftwork like tapestries and blankets that she orders from artisans. She purchases the materials like wool and delivers them to the artisans, who then make her orders. She makes her sales at the city markets of Ayacucho, and she also takes her products to Lima.

Wilma is 36 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She sells cosmetics via catalogue to friends, relatives and workers at different offices. She also sells clothing, which she brings in from Lima. The large proportion of her sales is on credit.

Mirtha, Teofila and Wilma are requesting loans of 900 soles ($310) apiece, which they will use to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, sugar, oil, needles, wool, children's clothing and towels.

These three women dream of having their own capital, expanding their businesses and providing better lives for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma son socias del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Mirtha es casada, tiene 47 años y 2 hijos, Mirtha es representante de ventas de utensilios de cocina en material quirúrgico, también vende productos naturales que vende al crédito a amigos, familiares. Además Mirtha tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Teofila es soltera y tiene 55 años, Teofila vende artesanía en telar como tapices, frazadas, que manda elaborar con artesanos, Teofila compra los materiales como lanas y lo entrega a los artesanos que elaborar sus pedidos, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y también lo lleva a la ciudad de Lima.

Mientras que Wilma es conviviente, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Wilma vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos, familiares y trabajadores de distintas instituciones, también vende ropa que trae de la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas en gran proporción son al crédito.

Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, hilos, lanas, ropa para niños y toallas.

Los sueños de Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma son tener capital propio, ampliar sus negocios y brindarle todo lo mejor de sus hijos.

loans.use: Mirtha, Teofila and Wilma are requesting loans of 900 soles ($310) apiece, which they will use to invest in the purchase of milk, rice, sugar, oil, needles, wool, children's clothing and towels / Mirtha, Teofila y Wilma necesitan prestamos de 900 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, azúcar, aceite, hilos, lanas, ropa para niños y toallas.

loans.name: Jeanina

texts.es:
Jeanina is a member of the Good Luck Community Bank. She is 34 years old, lives with her partner and has two daughters. She makes a living selling educational materials for children, school supplies and other novel products to teachers and parents of students. She acquires her products from the city of Lima.

Jeanina has plans to open a multi-service shop where she will sell school supplies, glassware, toys, gifts and snacks. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles ($700), which she will use to invest in the purchase of glasses, dishes, notebooks, ballpoint pens, paper and various gifts.

Jeanina's dreams are to make headway with her daughters, for her business to grow, to get married and have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Jeanina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Jeanina es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijas, Jeanina vende materiales didácticos de niños, útiles y otros productos novedosos, que ofrece a los profesores y padres de familias de los colegios, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.

Jeanina tiene proyectado aperturar una tienda multiservicios donde venderá útiles de escritorio, cristalería, juguetes, artículos de regalos y golosinas.

Jeanina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos, juego de vajilla, cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y regalos variados.

Los sueños de Jeanina son sacar adelante a sus hijas, que su negocio crezca, casarse y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Jeanina is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles ($700), which she will use to invest in the purchase of glasses, dishes, notebooks, ballpoint pens, paper and various gifts / Jeanina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos, juego de vajilla, cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y regalos variados.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina is a member of the Good Luck Community Bank. She is 38 years old, married and has three children. She sells grains that she purchases in the Tambo region located two hours from her home in the city of Ayacucho. She travels there every week on Fridays, visiting the communities and farmhouses in the area to purchase corn, broad beans, wheat and barley, which she stocks together to transport them to Ayacucho. She sells the products at the local wholesale food market. Josefina dreams to improve her business, earn more capital and provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Josefina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Josefina es casada, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Josefina vende cereales que compra en el distrito de Tambo que se ubica a dos horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, a donde viaja todas las semanas los días jueves y visita las comunidades, caseríos de la zona para comprar los cereales, luego de acopiarlos lo transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho y lo vende en el mercado de abastos.

Josefina sueña con mejorar sus negocios, tener más capital y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Josefina is requesting a loan of 3000 soles ($1,050), which she will use to purchase corn, broad beans, wheat and barley for resale / Josefina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de maíz, haba, trigo y cebada.

loans.name: Faustina Palomino

texts.es:
Faustina is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte community bank.

Faustina is married, is 60 years old and has 4 children. Faustina, along with her retired teacher, formed some years ago a taxi company in the city of Ayacucho. Later they became associates with more people but she is currently the chief shareholder in the company and she has two taxis. Each of the taxis are driven by employees that are paid on a daily basis.

Faustina requires a loan in the amount of 2500 soles. These funds will be invested in the repair of the engine of one of her taxi cabs.

Faustina's dream is to expand her business by purchasing more cars and to stabilize herself financially.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Faustina es casada, tiene 60 años y 4 hijos, Faustina junto a su esposo que es jubilado del sector educación, formaron hace algunos años una empresa D. transportes urbano en la ciudad D. Ayacucho para lo cual se asociaron otras personas más, actualmente es la socia mayoritaria D. la empresa y tiene dos unidades que son conducidas por chóferes, a quienes renumera diariamente.

Faustina necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la reparación del motor D. uno D. sus carros.

Los sueños D. Faustina son mejorar su negocio comprando más unidades y estabilizarse económicamente.

loans.use: Faustina requests a loan in the amount of 2500 soles.  These funds will be invested in the repair of the engine of one of her cars.

loans.name: Darcy Catherina

texts.es:
Darcy is a member of the Banco Comunal Buena Suerte community bank.

Darcy is married, is 37 years old and has 2 children. Darcy sells clothing, shoes, bedding and whatever her clients ask for. She carries out her sales on credit to factory workers, friends, and family. She collects her payments monthly or bi-weekly. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Darcy also sells naturopathic products such as creams, oils, and other products for women in the area, selling to friends, family and companies.

Darcy requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of slacks, shirts, jackets and polo shirts.

Darcy's dreams is to have a small exporting business for her naturopathic products, and to improve her businesses and consequently provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Darcy es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.

Darcy es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Darcy vende ropa, calzados, edredones y todo cuanto le piden sus clientes, sus ventas son al crédito y ofrece a trabajadores de instituciones, amigos, familiares, los cobros lo realiza cada fin de mes o quincenal, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Darcy vende productos naturales como cremas, aceite, mates, entre otros productos que son producidos por mujeres organizadas de la zona, sus ventas lo realiza a amigos, familiares y en instituciones.

Darcy necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones, casacas, chompas, polos.

Los sueños de Darcy son tener una microempresa de exportación de productos naturales, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Darcy requests a loan in the amount of 3000 soles.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of slacks, shirts, jackets, and polo shirts.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
You can see the back of my home, although I have finished cementing it. I would like to finish the construction shortly, so I can give my family a place worthy of them to live in. With the little income I have, I only am missing the exterior finish, for which I'm requesting a loan of $400.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Como pueden es la parte de atrás de mi casa, aun no he terminado de enjarrarla deseo terminar de construirla. Para ofrece a mi familia un lugar digno para vivir con los pocos ingresos que tengo solamente me falta el acabado exterior por lo cual solicito un préstamo de $400.00 dlls.

loans.use: Finish construction on my home / CONSTRUCCION

loans.name: Elizabeth Sonia

texts.es:
Elizabeth is 47, lives with her husband and children. She’s had a small general store in her house for 20 years, motivated by the economic needs in her family and knowing that she was an important part that contributed to support it. Every day all day, she offers products for sale, such as basic need groceries.

Elizabeth enjoys her work and is eager to get ahead, she doesn’t find it difficult, only time consuming. Her children’s quality of life is the main reason for her hard work. She requests a loan to include school supplies in her store and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Tiene una pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa hace más de 20 años, movida por la necesidad económica que existía en su familia, al ser parte importante en el sostenimiento de su familia.Ella ofrece diariamente, durante todo el día, productos de pan llevar; como abarrotes, los cuales son tan necesarios en la mesa de cada hogar.

Elizabeth disfruta de su trabajo y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, no considera ninguna dificultad en su trabajo, salvo que ocupa la mayor parte de su tiempo. El motivo de su esfuerzo es ver a sus hijos cada con una mejor calidad de vida. Solicita este préstamo para implementar su tienda con útiles escolares y mayor cantidad de mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store

loans.name: Iliana Olivia

texts.es:
I need to finish putting in a wrought iron fence around my home because as you can see only half of it is protected. I work nights, and my children are young. I want to make sure they are safe because vandalism is abundant near my home, as well as giving it a better look. From this, I will feel safer in my work knowing that my home will be protected. I request $1,000 to help me carry out this endeavor.Ms. V. has already punctually paid off her first Kiva loan to finish the roof of her house.Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer
Tengo la necesidad de colocar protecciones en mi casa como podrán ver solamente la mitad esta protegida. Trabajo de noche y mis hijos están pequeños quiero darles seguridad ya que por mi casa abunda el vandalismo además de darla una mejor vista,  de esta manera me sentiría mas segura en mi trabajo sabiendo que mi vivienda estará mas protegida, solicito la cantidad de 1000 dlls.

loans.use: Put in a wrought iron fence around her home / PONER BARANDAL EN SU CASA

loans.name: Ni Nengah Suciani

texts.id:
Nengah Suciani is a mother of two children and lives in the Batu Agung village in West Bali. Most of her daily activities are the same as those of any other housewife - namely, tending to her two children who are still in elementary school. At the moment her husband, Gede Darmawan, is a chauffeur. Nengah Suciani makes bamboo decorations for a living. In the Balinese language, these thin slices of bamboo resembling palm leaf ribs are called "semat" and are used in religious functions. She has undertaken this business for the past four years as there is uncertainty about her husband’s income. Making “semat” is something that can be done each daily. To create these decorations, Nengah Suciani must have enough supply of bamboo. A loan from DINARI foundation (channeled via her village’s central organization) will allow Nengah Suciani to add to her business’s working needs.

Nengah Suciani already has a regular roster of customers. The net earnings of Rp.20,000 per day (~ US $2) is just enough to cover daily necessities. Nengah Suciani lives in a house which is sufficiently comfortable with her husband and two kids.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Nengah Suciani itulah nama ibu yang sudah memiliki dua orang anak yang tinggal di desa Batu Agung, Bali barat. Kegiatan sehari-harinya layaknya seperti ibu rumah tangga lainnya, mengurus kedua anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah dasar. Sedangkan suaminya bernama Gede Darmawan, adalah seorang sopir. Nengah Suciani mempunyai usaha membuat kerajinan yang terbuat dari bambu. Dalam bahasa Bali dinamakan Semat ( bambu yang diiris tipis yang menyerupai batang lidi pohon kelapa, biasa dipergunakan sebagai bahan baku sarana persembahyangan ). Usaha ini digelutinya sudah 4 tahun lamanya karena ia tidak bisa berharap banyak dari penghasilan suaminya yg pas-pasan. Membuat semat adalah kegiatan rutin yang dilakukan setiap hari. Untuk membuat semat Nengah Suciani harus mempunyai persediaan bambu yang cukup. Dengan adanya bantuan modal dari yayasan DINARI yang disalurkan melalui organisasi yang ada didesanya Nengah Suciani berniat meminjam modal untuk menambah modal usahanya.

Nengah Suciani sudah punya pelanggang tetap. Dengan pendapatan bersih Rp. 20.000.- per hari yang hanya cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-sehari. Nengah Suciani tinggal disebuah rumah yang terbuat dari gedeg yang cukup nyaman dan sejuk bersama suami dan kedua anaknya.

loans.use: Add to working capital to purchase material for her business

loans.name: Ni Komang Ita Mahara

texts.id:
Komang Ita Maharani is a rather appropriate name for this mother of two (“Maharani “means queen). The skill involved in creating “Canang” and “Banten” (arrangements out of leaves and flowers used as offerings by Hindu worshippers) was instilled in her when she was a young teenager. The skill was passed on by her parents, who used to sell these items in the market.

Komang takes orders for large religious ceremonies such as “Galungan” and “Kuningan” (which celebrate the arrival of gods and ancestral spirits on earth to dwell in the homes of descendants). Similarly she caters for other events and festivals such as “Odalan”, “Otonan”, and “Ngaben”. Fulfilling these types of orders requires substantial investment.

To ensure that the process of making these prayer offerings is a smooth one, Komang recruits several of her neighbors to get involved, especially if the orders are large and she is running short of time. Komang pays a daily stipend to the people who help her.

Komang has big hopes for the upcoming loan from DINARI foundation (channeled via her village’s central institution). It will support her efforts by ensuring she has necessary and adequate materials needed to make these prayer offerings.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Komang Ita Maharani itulah nama lengkap ibu dari dua orang anak ini. Ketrampilan membuat Canang dan Banten ( sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ) sudah ditekuninya sejak masih remaja. Ketrampilan ini didapatkan dari orang tuanya yang juga penjual canang sari dan banten dipasar.

Komang juga melayani pesanan untuk sarana persembahyangan besar seperti hari raya Galungan dan Kuningan ataupun acara ritual lainnya yaitu Odalan, Otonan dan Ngaben. Untuk memenuhi pesanan ini dibutuhkan biaya yang cukup banyak

Untuk memperlancar proses pembuatan canangsari dan banten, Komang mengajak beberapa orang tetangganya untuk ikut terlibat dalam proses pembuatannya terutama jika ada pesanan yang jumlahnya sangat banyak dan kejar waktu. Komang juga harus membayar orang yang ikut bekerja ditempatnya dengan hitungan harian.

Dengan adanya pinjaman modal dari yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga di desanya, besar harapan Komang untuk mendapat pinjaman modal tersebut karena modal ini sangat dibutuhkannya untuk menunjang sarana dalam mencukupi kebutuhan bahan-baku yang diperlukan untuk membuat banten dan canang sari.

loans.use: Increase her working capital so that she can purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Danti

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Danti is a housewife who is diligent and resilient in her efforts to run her stall business. Initially she set up shop in simple surroundings, but now Ni Nyoman Danti is able to situate her stall in a place good enough to run her business properly. Ni Nyoman Danti began this enterprise several years ago, back when she first married her husband, Nengah Sudendra. The shop sells many types of basic consumer needs, such as rice, sugar, light snacks, soap, and other daily necessities.

With the help of a working capital loan entrusted to her by the DINARI Foundation (via the village’s central organization), Ni Nyoman Danti will furnish her business with all the necessary items and increase her wares so selection will be more varied. Ni Nyoman Danti opens her stall at 7am after tending to her children, who are still in elementary school. She then sets out to perform all the routine activities of a housewife, such as cooking, washing, and cleaning the house, in addition to waiting on customers who come to purchase items from her stall. The daily earnings, which reach Rp.20,000-Rp.30,000 (~US $2-3) help sustain the household, because her husband has a modest occupation as a farmer.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Danti adalah sosok ibu rumah tangga yang tekun dan ulet dalam menjalankan usaha warung. Dengan usaha awal hanya berjualan di tempat yang sangat sederhana, kini Ni Nyoman Danti bisa menempati warung yang cukup bagus untuk menjalankan usahanya. Ni Nyoman Danti sudah menjalani usaha ini sejak menikah dengan suaminya, Nengah |Sudendra beberapa tahun yang silam. Berbagai macam kebutuhan pokok dijual seperti beras, gula, makanan ringan, sabun dan kebutuhan pokok lainnya.

Dengan adanya bantuan Pinjaman untuk modal usaha dari yayasan Dinari melalui organisasi didesanya Ni Nyoman Danti mendapat kepercayaan untuk menggunakan modal tersebut sebagai modal usaha untuk melengkapi segala macam keperluan untuk usaha warungnya dan juga memperbanyak dagangannya agar lebih bervariasi. Ni Nyoman Danti membuka warungnya jam 07.00 pagi setelah mengurus anak ketiganya yang masih duduk dibangku sekolah dasar. Setelah itu barulah melakukan segala rutinitas sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga seperti memasak, mencuci, membersih rumah dan sesekali melayani pembeli yang datang belanja. Dengan keuntungan bersih sehari mencapai Rp. 20.000.- s/d Rp.30.000.- Penghasilan ini mampu menopang perekonomian keluarganya karena suaminya hanya berprofesi sebagi petani.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise so she can increase her stall's inventory and selection

loans.name: Ni Ketut Manis

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Manis works as a weaver, producing traditional cloth that is well-known for its unique weave. The income generated by her husband is not sufficient to meet her family’s needs. This has made Ni Ketut Manis diligent in her work towards producing one woven cloth each month. Ni Ketut Manis has become quite dependent on the income generated by creating these traditional woven pieces. Ketut Manis has high hopes of getting a loan from the DINARI foundation (via the village’s central institution), with which she can purchase equipment for weaving and various materials, including special thread out of which she can make better and more varied finished pieces.

Typically Ni Ketut Manis sells her finished products directly to the customers in the market. Money from the sale goes towards purchasing more thread. Ni Ketut Manis’s initial outlay for her activity was as big as Rp.200,000 (~US $22) and her earnings amount to Rp.50,000 (~US $5) for each finished woven piece. Ni Ketut Manis’s husband sometimes joins in to spin the thread which will be used to make new woven pieces. Although they live in a simple house, nevertheless Ni Ketut Manis is very happy with her small family in a home environment that is clean and pleasant.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Manis adalah seorang pengrajin Tenun Tradisional yang cukup terkenal karena keunikan cara pembuatannya. Penghasilan suaminya yang tidak mencukupi keperluan hidup keluarganya hal inilah yang membuat Ni Ketut Manis tekun dalam membuat tenunan sehingga setiap bulan bisa menghasilkan satu kain tenun. Membuat tenun tradisional ini sudah lama digelutinya sehingga Ni Ketut Manis sangat bergantung dengan penghasilan yang didapatinya dari membuat tenun. Besar harapan ketut manis untuk mendapatkan dana pinjaman dari yayasan Dinari yang disalurkan melalui lembaga didesanya untuk membeli peralatan tenun dan perlengkapan tenun seperti benang khusus untuk tenun lebih banyak lagi agar hasilnya lebih bagus dan lebih bervariasi.

Biasanya Ni Ketut Manis menjual hasil tenunannya langsung kepasar tempat langganannya, setelah itu uang hasil penjualan dibelikan benang lagi. Modal awal yang dikeluarkan Ni Ketut Manis sebesar Rp. 200.000.- dan keuntungan yang diperoleh Rp. 50.000.- untuk setiap kain tenun yang sudah jadi. Suami Ni Ketut Manis terkadang ikut membantu memintal benang yang akan dipakai untuk membuat kain tenun yang baru. Walau mereka tinggal dirumah yang sangat sederhana tetapi Ni Ketut Manis sangat bahagia dengan keluarga kecilnya dengan keadaan rumah yang asri dan bersih

loans.use: To purchase weaving equipment and raw materials

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mrs. Phin N.,39, is a farmer and the mother of four children. The family lives in Souvongs Leu Village in the Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Chem Oun, is a construction worker who makes a small income to support the family. The oldest child is employed in a garment factory, two children attend school and the youngest child is too young to work or study.

Mrs. Phin N. does not have enough animals to plow her field. She is requesting a loan to add to her current savings so she can purchase an additional cow to work along side her current cow. Mrs. Phin N. had obtained a loan to buy a cow for breeding which she has fully paid back. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to plow the fields

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum C. is 27-years-old and lives in Kanthorm Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Mean Prok, is a palm juice collector who gathers palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine.

Since inflation in Cambodia is increasing, Mrs. Phum C. wants to start another business in order to meet the family's financial needs. She is requesting a loan to buy piglets to start a pig breeding business. The rest of the money will be used to buy fertilizer for her field. Mrs. Phum C. and her husband are shown in the picture with their daughter.

loans.use: To buy piglets to start a pig breeding business and to buy fertilizer for the crop fields.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek Y. is a farmer in Angk Tapok Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a 30-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Although both family members have income, they want to improve their living conditions. She is requesting a loan to add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house in the village.

loans.name: Me

texts.en:
Mrs. Me S., 55, is a farmer in Chres Village in the Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Suk Soeurn, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or palm wine. They have one child who is employed at a garment factory.

Mrs. Me S. faces a problem because her field is infertile. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the soil and increase her crop output. Last year, Mrs. Me S. was ill and had to spend $125 for medical procedures. This is why Mrs. Me S. does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. Mrs. Me S. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to produce a better crop.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mrs. Phann T. is a villager in Sarekakeo Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She and her husband, Mr. Men Hok, are farmers who cultivate rice and grow vegetables. Aside from this business, Mr. Men Hok collects palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. The couple have five children; two are employed in the garment factory; the others are attending school.

Although the family has income from many different sources, they still need another business in order to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Phann T. is requesting a loan to start a bed-making business which her husband would manage. She had previously obtained a loan to buy timbers and has fully paid it back.

Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To start a bed-making business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng M. lives in Sarekakeo Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Soy Heang, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. He also helps his wife on the plantation when he has free time. The couple has six children; one is employed in the garment factory; three are attending school; two are too young to work or study and remain at home.

Mrs. Heng M. is requesting a loan to add to her savings and purchase cows to plow her rice fields. This will improve her crop production. Mrs. Heng M. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy cows to plow the rice field and improve crop production

loans.name: Yoak

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoak Y. is a farmer in Sarekakeo Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Sem Seng, collects palm juice to process into palm sugar and palm wine. In addition, he also assists his wife on the farm when he has free time. They have eight children; one is employed in a garment factory; four are enrolled in school; three stay at home because they are too young to work or study.

The plantation field is far from an irrigation system and by purchasing a pump, Mrs. Yoak Y. can water her rice field and she can water a neighbor's field for additional income. Mrs. Yoak Y. had obtained a loan to buy palm juice collecting equipment and she has fully paid off that loan. She is now requesting another loan to purchase the water pump. Her husband also appears in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a pump to water rice fields for additional income

loans.name: Hoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoem K. is a 42-year-old widow with five children. She is a farmer in Chambork Thom Village in the Kampong Speu Province. She raises pigs, chickens and ducks in order to help meet the financial needs of the family. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory and the other three are attending school.

Even with the income produced from the farm and the salaries of her two children, there is not enough money to build a new house. Mrs. Hoem K. is requesting a loan to add to her current savings to be able to begin construction of a new home.

loans.use: To add money to a current savings account in order to build a new home

loans.name: Ters

texts.en:
Mrs. Ters N., 54, and her husband, Mr. Vong Hun, are farmers in Souvongs Leu Village in the Kampong Speu Province. They have three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the other is enrolled in school.

They plant crops on their plantation twice a year. In the rainy season, they cultivate rice and in the dry season they grow vegetables. Even though the family members have income from different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. In order to improve their lives, Mrs. Ters N. is requesting a loan to buy calves for breeding. Mrs. Ters N. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy calves for breeding.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som K. is a garment factory worker in Prey Totoeng Village in the Kampong Speu Province. Along with working in the factory, she cultivates rice and is breeding pigs when she has free time. Her husband, Mr. Son Khun, is a construction worker and farmer.

Mrs. Som K. does not have enough cows to plow her rice field. She is making a request for her fifth loan to buy a cow to plow her fields along side her existing cow. This is the fifth time Mrs. Som K. has requested a loan. All others have been repaid. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow to plow rice fields

loans.name: Yegana

texts.en: Yegana is a mother of one child. She was born in 1984. Yegana is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the town of Khirdalan. She started this business four years ago. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Shovgy

texts.en: Shovgy was born in 1974. He is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. He has settled in the town of Khirdalan. He started this business 10 years ago. He transports food from the markets. Now he needs a loan of $1,200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira (her husband is pictured) is a mother of three children. She was born in 1986. Khatira is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Agdam region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the Absheron region. Her husband has been as a taxi driver for 10 years. Now this family needs a loan of $1,200 to buy spare parts for improving their business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Stojanka

texts.en:
Stojanka is a young woman from the community of Drijen, outside Derventa. She is not married and is the sole caretaker for her 2-year-old child. She works as a clerk in a shop and gets about 500 KM (US$ 400) a month through this job.

Stojanka has started a small part-time business working as a typist, and she types up papers for students or other individuals who do not have computers or who do not have time to do this themselves. It is her intent to use this, her first loan from Zene za Zene towards buying a printer. Stojanka needs to make this purchase to cut down on her costs and keep her business going.

loans.use: To buy a printer to use for her typing business

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim started this business three years ago. She sells blankets. Khanim is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the Absheron region. She was born in 1961. She is married and has two children. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy blankets to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Merry's Agape Group

texts.en:
Merry is a married woman with 2 children, aged 8 and 1. She has been selling clothing since 2005. Every day, she works from 10 A.M. to 6 P.M. at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Merry now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling with clothes, vegetabes and groceries.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a widow from the small community of Osinja, outside the town of Derventa. She doesn't receive a pension now, so she must support herself solely through her agriculture business. She grows and sells a variety of fruits and vegetables, and in the months that she is able to harvest and sell them she can earn 500 KM (US$ 400). She saves this money so it can last her through the winter months when she cannot grow anything.

This is Nada's first loan in the amount of 500 KM that she will use to buy some piglets. She will feed, fatten, and sell these pigs to make some additional income for this year.

loans.use: To buy piglets for fattening and selling

loans.name: Mwanaharusi's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a 42 year old married woman with 2 children, aged 12 and 3. She has been a milk seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 6 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

In the past, Mwanaharusi has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more milk for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sara and Antonia, who have businesses selling beans and maize.

loans.use: To buy more milk for her business

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is 43 years old and married. She owns a small shop that she has been running since in 1998. Every day, she works from 8 A.M. to 10 P.M. at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $175.

In the past, Pendo has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan (his brother is pictured) is 38 years old, married, and has four children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Agdam in Azerbaijan. He has settled in the Absheron region. The brothers have sold building materials with their truck for nine years. Now Elshan and his brother need a loan of $1,200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Dijana

texts.en:
Dijana is a young woman from the town of Derventa. She is married and her husband has a job as a construction worker. Right now, Dijana is unemployed. She is taking out her first loan in the amount of 1000 KM (US$ 775) to start a small baking business. She wants to focus on making cookies and other desserts that she can sell to people to use for weddings, parties, and other events.

Dijana needs this money to buy some start-up supplies and all the necessary baking ingredients. It is Dijana's wish to produce a lot of different types of cookies and serve a good number of customers. She hopes that this business will provide a good steady income for her family, as her husband's salary is not enough to support them for long.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and materials necessary for baking

loans.name: Thi Ngoai

texts.vi:
Like many other families in the rural areas of Vietnam, Mrs. Ngoai's family mainly focused on farming and raising livestock for a living. In 1999, Mrs. Ngoai joined the TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan of 300,000VND (about 20USD) to invest in raising livestock. Besides livestock, she also invested in planting fruit trees to take advantage of her large garden. Currently, both her husband and she focus on planting fruit trees and raising livestock to increase their family's income. After 9 years, her family's economy has improved tremendously, and she is able to send all her children to school. This time, she would like to borrow 900USD to invest further in planting fruit trees and raising livestock. Her family's monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by P. Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Cũng như nhiều gia đình khác ở vùng nông thôn Việt Nam, gia đình chị Ngoài cũng có nguồn thu nhập chính là từ trồng trọt và chăn nuôi. Năm 1999 chị Ngoài tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay mức vốn đầu tiên là 300.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Ngoài chăn nuôi, tận dụng đất vườn rộng chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vốn để trồng cây ăn quả . Hiện nay cả hai vợ chồng chị đều tập trung vào chăn nuôi và trrồng trọt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Sau 9 năm sử dụng vốn vay, nhờ có nguồn thu ổn định từ trồng trọt và chăn nuôi đến nay kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn, các con của chị đều được đầu tư cho ăn học đầy đủ.Vòng vốn tới chị mogn muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Rubaba

texts.en: Rubaba was born in 1961. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Khaodjali in Azerbaijan. She has settled in the Absheron region. Rubaba is a mother of three children. She has been in this business for seven years. Now she needs a loan of $1,200 to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Asra

texts.en:
Asra is single. She owns a small shop that she has been running since 2005. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 10 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $100 from her sales.

In the past, Asra has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a 50 year old married woman with 4 children between ages 20 and 30. She owns cows and has been selling their milk since 2002. Every day, she works from 8 AM to 2 PM at her business where she can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Bahati now hopes for a loan to buy more animal feed so her cows will produce more milk.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed so she can get more milk from her cows

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en: Shaheen Baji is the wife of S. A. and lives in an area named Shalimar, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son has a mobile phone shop. Her husband is a loader by profession. Her younger son and two daughters are enrolled in a local school in the neighborhood. Shaheen Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her children. She successfully completed her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more handsets to expand her son's business.

loans.use: To buy more handsets

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. D., 31 years old, has 2 school-going children. After marriage, her husband and she mainly focused on farming and raising livestock. In 2003, she joined the TYM Fund. Initially, she borrowed money to invest in raising livestock but the profit was not substantial. As an active and creative woman, she decided to use the subsequent loan to invest in a general store. She was willing to learn and obtain experiences in doing business so her general store has been expanding ever since. Currently, her general store has a wide range of goods, bringing her a stable source of income. Her monthly income of 3,000,000VND (about 200USD) allows her to improve her family's standard of living and take care of her children. This time, she would like to borrow 900USD to continue investing in her general store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị D. năm nay 31 tuổi, gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Sau khi lập gia đình riêng vợ chồng chị chủ yếu chỉ làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Năm 2003 chị bắt đầu tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng dự án cho thu nhập không cao. Là người phụ nữ nhanh nhẹn, năng động vòng vốn sau chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá. Nhờ chịu khó học hỏi kinh nghiệm kinh doanh đến nay mô hình kinh doanh của gia đình chị đã ngày càng được mở rộng. Hiện tại vợ chồng chị đã có một cửa hàng tạp hoá với rất nhiều mặt hàng đa dạng. Công việc kinh doanh đã đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập rất ổn định. Với nguồn thu nhập 3000.000đ/ tháng vợ chồng chị đã có điều kiện hơn để cải thiện cuộc sống và đầu tư cho các con. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000 đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.

loans.use: Invest in her general store

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela is a married woman from the town of Derventa. Her husband works full-time, and they recently had their first child. Danijela had been running a cleaning service for two years. However, after giving birth, she took some time off.

Danijela is requesting this, her first credit from Zene za Zene in the amount of 500 KM (US$ 400). She will use this money to buy cleaning materials and supplies she requires to resume her old job. Danijela hopes that she will get back some of her old customers and that she will earn enough income to meet their family's household expenses.

loans.use: To buy  supplies for cleaning business

loans.name: Allah Ditti

texts.en:
Allah Ditti Baji is the wife of M. A. and has been living in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the last 30 years. Her family consists of twelve members. She is the mother of nice children. Her husband has a decorative embroidery business, having an experience of 25 years.

Allah Ditti Baji is a housewife and helps her husband in making dresses with decorative embroidery. Her husband also sells crockery. She owns a double-storey four-room brick house. She successfully completed her first two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy materials (cloth, needles, thread) for her husband's embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy materials for embroidery business

loans.name: Ni Made Susana Dewi

texts.id:
Living by the sea, Made Susana did not experience life similar those in the city. Everyday Suasana, like the average villager has a limited income. Her husband, a small businessman usually is unable to provide the family’s expenses. Made Susana decided to be more diligent in her pig farming with a loan from DINARI through the KIVA program. With initial funding of Rp.600.000,- (about USD65) used to purchase 2 piglets for breeding. Made Susana borrowed from DINARI to increase funding with the plan to purchase additional 3 larger piglets for breeding and the balance use to purchase livestock supplies. This being the first loan from DINARI will hopefully with this support will add income from sale of pigs raised later. Assisted with good training on pig breeding by the staff of DINARI is felt to provide great benefit for Made Susana. It is hoped that the yield from the sale of the pigs will be able to improve the family’s economic condition and thus save for the children’s education in future.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di pesisir kota tidak membuat Made Susana mengalami kehidupan selayaknya orang di kota. Suasana sehari-hari masih layaknya di pedesaan dengan mata penghasilan yang pas-pasan. Suaminya yang hanya seorang wiraswasta tidak sepenuhnya bisa menanggung semua kebutuhan keluarganya. Made Susana memutuskan lebih menekuni usahanya beternak babi dengan meminjam modal ke DINARI melalui program KIVA. Dengan modal awal Rp.600.000,- yang sudah dibelikannya 2 ekor bibit babi penggemukan, Made Susana meminjam ke DINARI untuk menambah modalnya dengan berencana akan dibelikan 3 ekor babi penggemukan yang lebih besar dan sisanya akan digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternaknya. Pinjaman ini merupakan pertama kalinya ke DINARI dan diharapkan dengan kerja sama ini akan menambah penghasilannya dari menjual babi-babi peliharaannya nanti. Dibantu dengan training tentang cara memelihara babi yang baik oleh staf DINARI dirasakan sangat memberikan manfaat yang besar bagi Made Susana. Diharapkan hasil penjualan babinya akan mampu mendongkrak ekonomi keluarganya dan bisa menabung untuk pendidikan anaknya yang masi kecil nanti

loans.use: Purchase piglets and supplies (membelei anak babi dan pakannya)

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year-old widow with 2 children, ages 20 and 27. She began selling bedsheets in 2001 and works every day from 9am to 10pm at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $US60 from her sales.

In the past, Rose has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more bedsheets to sell.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, ages 5 and 1. She has been a charcoal seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $US110 from her sales.

In the past, Stella has taken out two successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Stella now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida Baji is the wife of Mr. M. Ahmed, who has worked in an office named Dry-Port as a custom officer for the last 23 years. Zubaida Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has been living in an area named "Jani Pura chowk" in Lahore, Pakistan, for the last 10 years. She owns a three-room brick house. She is the mother of seven children: four daughters and three sons. Her eldest son is a salesman and makes embroidered dresses. She successfully completed her two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material (cloth, thread, embroidery machine) for her son's embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery business

loans.name: Ni Ayu Putu Astiti

texts.id:
Although still young as a mother, Ayu Putu did not take life easy.
