She rented a facility which is located in her home town of Ordzhonikidze. Larisa's politeness and rich experience help her operate the business effectively. She's been in this business for only about a year. However, it was long enough to get to know her customers' preferences and tastes, which makes her little store popular among customers and helps her be a successful entrepreneur. 

However, faced with the growing demand of her customers and insufficient financial means Larisa is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to meet her clients needs and to generate more profits. The loan will allow her purchase clothing and footwear products wholesale and to increase yher selling capacity. Successful trade will increase Larisa's income and help her get the amount she needs to provide her family with a decent living.  

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Fatina's Tausi Group

texts.en:
Fatina is 40 years old. She is a married with three children, between the ages of 14 and 18. She has owned and run a small grocery store since 2003. Everyday, she works from 2 p.m. to 11 p.m. at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Fatina now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Janeth, who has business selling rice.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elishiwaria's Rehema Group

texts.en:
Elishiwaria is 23 years old. She is a married with 2 children, aged 4 and 7. She has been selling clothes and rearing chickens since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

Elishiwaria now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and chickens for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rogathe, who has business in brick sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and chickens for her business.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is 38 years old. She is a married with 3 children between 14 and 18. She has been a snacks (carpet) seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Mwanaidi now hopes for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her business.

loans.name: Aimbora

texts.en:
Aimbora is 45 years old. She is a married with 6 children between 15 and 25 years old. She has been rearing chickens and selling vegetables since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Aimbora now hopes for a loan to buy more chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for her business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 22 years old. She is a married with 1 child, aged 2. She owns a salon and is a hair dresser. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Saolme now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business.

loans.use: To improve her business by buying more salon items.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 37 years old. She is married with 1child, aged 3. She is a charcoal seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is 30 years old. She is a married with 2 children, aged 1 and 10 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Elly now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Rajabgul S. lives in the Fayzabad region. She lives together with her large family. Rajabgul is married and has 8 children. Her husband is not able to support such a large family on his own and Rajabgul needs to work hard in order to help support her family.

Rajabgul sells products at the Miskinobod market. She has decided to take out an 18 month loan in order to increase her inventory for the fall season. The loan will help her to increase her product selection and to attract new customers. As a result, her business will grow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайфиддинова Раджабгуль жительница района Файзабад. Живет вместе со своей большой семьей.Замужем и имеет восьмерых детей. Прокормить такую большую семью одному мужу не под силу , поэтому Раджабгуль приходится много работать , чтобы помочь семье. Зангимается торговлей на рынке Мискинобода. Решила к осеннему сезону увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита сроком на 18 месяцев. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и привлечь новых клиентов . Таким образом ее бизнес начнет развиваться.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Robiy

texts.ru:
Robiy S. lives in the Fayzabad region. She is 47 years old, is married and has 6 children. Robiy has a high school education. She has a small store at the regional department store. This business is the main source of income for her large family, as her husband is currently unemployed and her children are still students. Robiy has decided to take out a loan in order to increase the product assortment at her store. She plans to pay back the loan over a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Саъдулоева Робия жительница района Файзабад. Возраст 47 лет, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее.Робия имеет небольшой магазин в универмаге района Файзабад. Этот вид деятельности является основынм источником дохода ее большой семьи.Так как муж клиентки временно не работает.А дети Робии пока еще студенты т школьники. Клиентка решила взять кредит для увеличения ассортимента магазина. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Anor

texts.ru:
Anor D. lives in the Fayzabad region. She is 42 years old and has 5 children. She has a high school education. Anor has a small store at the center of the area. She purchases products from wholesale suppliers and resells them at retail prices. This business allows her to support her large family. Today, Anor would like to increase the product assortment at her store, which requires money. She has decided to take out an 18 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатова Анор жительница района Файзобод . Возраст 42 года, женат,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка имеет небольшой магазин в центре района.Она покупает товар у оптовых поставщиков и реализует его в розницу. Этот вид деятельности позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить асссортимент своего магазина. Для чего ей нужны деньги.Она решила взять кредит сроком на 18 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 46 years old and married with two children. Currently, the two kids are in school. She lives in Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana with her family. She has been a seamstress for fifteen years. She sews all forms of female outfits with various styles that suit the tastes of her customers. She sews kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She also sells ladies' wear, such as jeans, skirts and tops, and other clothing. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, thread and thimbles to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called Asomafo Group. In this group, members guarantee loans for one another as social collateral. Patience is in the photo with her daughter and one of her apprentices.

loans.use: To buy more sewing tools and materials

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.ru:
Rustamjon F. lives in Yavan. He is 53 years old and has worked as a farmer his entire life. He earns the entire family income from harvesting wheat and linen and from reselling cattle. He would like to increase his cattle headcount by taking out a loan. This way, after fattening the purchased calf, he will be able to sell it for a profit in the fall. Rustamjon will use the profits to support his family and will use the loan amount in order to purchase a new calf. He will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Фатхуллоев Рустамджон проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 53 года. Всю жизнь работает фермером и дехканином. Весь доход семьи получает от получаемого урожая пшеници и льна, а так же от перепродажи бычков. Поэтому он бы хотел увеличить поголовье скота путем получения кредита.Таким образом , окормив купленного бычка , к осени он сможет его выгодно продать. Прибыль использует в хозяйстве , а сумму кредита использует для покупки нового бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Sohibjamol

texts.ru:
Sohibjamol A. lives in one of the far off villages of Yavan. She is a widow, who was left with 8 children to raise by herself. Sohibjamol needed to support them on her own. Her eldest son has grown and left to work in Russia, the rest of the children are still small and Sohibjamol and her son are the only earners in the family. Sohibjamol raises livestock. She raises cattle, fattens them and sells them to the butchers at the market.

Sohibjamol would like to take out an 8 month loan to purchase one more calf. This will increase her cattle headcount and allow her to earn more money.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Аминова Сохибджамол жительница одного из дальних кишлаков Явана. Вдова , оставшаяся с восемью детьми на руках. Одна поднимает их на ноги. Старший сын подрос и уехал на заработки в Россию. Остальные дети еще маленькие. Таким образом она и сын являются единственными кормильцами. Сама Сохибджамол занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков , откармливает ипродает на рынке , мясникам. Хочеи получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев для покупки еще одного бычка. Это увеличит поголовье скота и даст возможность заработать больше

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Snježana

texts.en: Snježana Ilić is a 43-year-old married woman from the town of Doboj.  She has 2 grown kids. She and her husband currently run a little restaurant, which they have been doing for 15 years.  This is her first loan with Žene za Žene, which she is requesting in the amount of 1000 KM.  They will make some renovations and repairs to the restaurant, and need this money to be able to afford the upfront costs. Snježana hopes that this renovation will go well and that her business will continue to get some new customers.

loans.use: To renovate restaurant

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús lives in his parents´ house at 2040 Caupolican Street, in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz, with his wife and son, in one room.

Now that he has a child, he needs to make things a bit more comfortable for his family. For this reason, with some money he has saved, he decided to build an extra room. Since Jesús works as a bricklayer he decided to do the construction himself in order to cut costs.

The loan he is requesting now is to purchase materials such as brick, sand, cement, etc. so he can build the room he needs in order to live more comfortably. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from IMPRO, and a socioeconomic and income analysis shows that Jesús is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Jesús vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Caupolican #2040 de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz con su esposa e hijo, en una sola habitación.

Ahora que ya tiene un hijo necesita dar mas comodidad a su familia y es por eso que teniendo un dinero ahorrado decidió construir una habitación extra; además, Jesús trabaja como albañil y por eso él mismo hará la construcción, logrando abaratar los costos.

El préstamo que ahora solicita es precisamente para la compra de materiales, como ser ladrillo, arena, cemento, etc., para construir la habitación que necesita para vivir con mayor comodidad. Es al primera ves que solicita un crédito en IMPRO, y el análisis socioeconómico efectuado más su flujo de caja dan como resultado que Jesús está calificado para acceder a este préstamo.

loans.use: Buy materials to build on another room to his parents´ house.

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru:
Davlatmoh T. lives in Nurek. She is a businesswoman and sells fabrics at the central market. She would like to take out a loan for the autumn and the arrival of cold weather to purchase winter fabrics. Davlatmoh purchases her products in Dushanbe.

Davlatmoh has been in this business for 18 years, ever since her husband abandoned her family and she was left alone with 6 children to support. She now tries to give her children everything that she can. Davlatmoh’s oldest son needs to apply to college and as a result she needs to work very hard. Davlatmoh will pay back her loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тоджиддинова Давлатмо проживает в городе Нурек. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует тканями на центральном рынке. К осеннему сезону , к приходу холодов хочет получить кредит и уже завезти зимние ткани. Привозит она товар из города Душанбе . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 18 лет , с того момента как муж оставил их семью и она осталась одна с шестью детьми на руках. Теперь она старается дать детям все по мере возможности. Старший сын должен поступать в ВУЗ , поэтому ей необходимо очень много работать. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Deisi

texts.es:
Deisi lives in her parents´ house with her husband and two children on Diez de Medina Street, in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. She is 42 years old and a homemaker. Her husband drives a minibus which transports passengers within the city.

Deisi is asking for a loan to build a room which is needed to make her family more comfortable. They currently live in two rooms and have no place to cook.

Her credit history qualifies her for a new loan. They have been clients of IMPRO since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Deisi vive en casa de sus padres con su esposo y dos hijos en la calle Diez de Medina de la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a las labores de casa; su esposo trabaja de chofer de un microbús, transportando pasajeros en el área urbana.

Deisi solicita el crédito para la construcción de una habitación por que nesecita dar mas comodidad a su familia. Actualmente están viviendo todos en dos habitaciones y no hay lugar para cocinar.

El historial que tiene le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ellos son clientes de IMPRO desde el año 2007.

loans.use: Build an extra room onto her house.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.en:
Soria is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her seven children in the slums that surround Santo Domingo. Her children range from 23 years old to 9 years old.

She has a small business where she sells various hair accessories, beauty supplies, and feminine accessories. She asked for this loan so that she could invest more money into the supplies that she is able to sell from her store. With the extra income from this story she hopes to save her money so that one day in the next couple of years she can open an even bigger store and be known as a respectable business woman and leader in her community.

Her dream is to own her own home one day, and one that is built from concrete blocks so that it will withstand the hurricanes and tropical storms that pound her tiny country every year. She also hopes to see her children go to college, and continue with their studies.

Soria and her story represent the Las Flores Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 10 women and men and women who are taking out their first micro loan with Esperanza. Each of these men and women has taken out a similar loan to that of Soria’s—on behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To invest in  the purchase of a better variety of merchandise for her accessories store.

loans.name: Palabra De Mujer Group

texts.en:
Gelene D. is a young and spirited 18-year-old woman who lives in a very impoverished community on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. Gelene has applied for her first loan with Esperanza International for the amount of roughly $150 USD; she’ll be using the money from this loan to go to a local flea market where she can purchase used and new clothing in bulk.

The extra capital helps her not only to purchase more at once so she doesn’t have to spend money on the transportation for return trips, but it also decreases her overall costs, which will in turn slightly increase her profit margin.

Gelene says that it is very hard to maintain a successful business where she lives, but that she is willing to work hard and never give up. With the help and guidance she receives from her loan officer she will be given new tools and skills that will help her manage her business, savings, profits and merchandise better.

Gelene is an immigrant from Haiti and had to give up school a long time ago. She hopes that with the help of this loan her business will allow her to make enough money to pay for night classes at a local school so that she can learn to read and write. One day she also hopes to be able to own her own home and land where she can raise a family.

Gelene and her story represent the Palabra de Mujer Bank of Hope; she belongs to a group of 5 women who are taking out their first micro loan with Esperanza. Each of these women has taken out a similar loan to Gelene’s, and they will all be using them to invest in businesses that range from small corner grocery stores, to clothing sales, to raising pigs and goats—on behalf of all of them, and our team here at Esperanza, thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more used and new clothing for re-sale in her community.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es:
Alfonsa lives in her own house on Héroes del Chaco Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She is 56 years old. She makes "polleras" (long skirts typical of Bolivian highlands) and works independently. Since she is well-known, she has a steady clientele who place orders on an average of two per week. With this work she helps her husband support the family; he is a bricklayer and what he is paid is very little and not enough to survive on.

The loan she requests is to increase her working capital to buy fabric and other materials and to be able to better establish her business, produce more and as a result, increase her income.

Her credit history with IMPRO is good and qualifies her for a new loan. Alfonso has previously received a loan through Kiva, which was repaid without any problem.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alfonsa vive en casa propia en la calle Héroes del Chaco de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 56 años de edad, la actividad que ella realiza es la confección de polleras y trabaja por cuenta propia ofreciendo a domicilio y como ya es conocida tiene clientes estables que le piden en un promedio de dos por semana. Con este trabajo ella ayuda a su esposo en la manutención de su familia ya que él es albañil y lo que le pagan es muy poco y no les alcanza para subsistir.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar telas y otros materiales y poder estabilizar mejor su negocio, producir más y consiguientemente incrementar sus ingresos.

El historial que tiene con Impro es bueno por lo cual califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Alfonsa ya obtuvo anteriormente un préstamo a través de Kiva, el cual fue pagado sin ningún problema.

loans.use: Purchase materiales, fabric, tulle, thread, etc.

loans.name: Santos Nelida

texts.es:
Santos is 78 years old and widowed. She completed primary school, but left because she had a difficult illness and her parents couldn’t afford treatment for her. Santos has eight children who all have found work.

To support herself financially, at a young age Santos started selling grocery items out of her home in San Pedro de Lloc District, Pacasmayo Province in La Libertad state. Her daughter-in-law referred her to the San Pedrito Community Bank, where she was accepted. Santos has been with Manuela Ramos for four years. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase grocery items such as rice and oil. With a loan of 1,000 soles [about US $ 350], which will be paid back in six months, Santos plans to purchase toilet paper, oil, rice, soft drinks, small soaps, gum, sewing supplies, etc. Santos’s goal is to buy her house and support her grandson financially so he can get a professional job.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Santos Nelida, tiene 78 años, es viuda, estudió primaria completa, no continuó estudiando porque tuvo una enfermedad delicada y sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para poder ayudarla, tiene 8 hijos, se encuentran trabajando.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó desde joven en su negocio de abarrotes, en su casa en el Distrito de San Pedro de Lloc en la Provincia de Pacasmayo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Su nuera la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “SAN PEDRITO”, ahí mismo la aceptaron. Tiene cuatro años trabajando con Manuela Ramos, y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 invirtió en compra de abarrotes como arroz y aceite. Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar papel higiénico, aceite, arroz, gaseosas, jaboncillo, chicles, mercería, etc. La socia tiene como meta comprar su casa y ayudar económicamente a su nieto para que sea profesional.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (grocery items)

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Gladis Asunciona

texts.es:
Gladis is 49 years old and married. She started a degree in accounting, but left the program because she needed to take care of her young children. Gladis has two children who both work. She lives in San Pedro D. Lloc District, Pacasmayo Province in La Libertad state.

María started selling candies in a sales stand near Razuri school 14 years ago. The council was renting her the space, but later closed it because it wasn’t profitable. As Gladis is good at making and decorating cakes, she decided to start a business doing this, which has gone quite well. She currently has a sales stand at the San Pedro D. Lloc food market, where she not only sells cakes but also sells party decoration supplies. She also sells breakfast really early in the morning.

Thanks to a female friend, Gladis become a member of the Libertad [Freedom] Community Bank. She received an initial loan of 300 soles [about US $100], which she used to purchase cake decorations. With a loan of 1,200 soles [about US $ 425], which will be paid back in six months, Gladis plans to purchase tables, oven hood, blender and food mixer to improve her business selling breakfast. She will use any remaining funds to purchase technology for making decorations. Gladis hopes to learn how to make piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Gladis Asunciona tiene 49 años, está casada, estudió hasta II ciclo D. Contabilidad, no continuó estudiando porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y tenía que cuidarlos, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales trabajan, vive en el Distrito D. San Pedro D. Lloc en La Provincia D. Pacasmayo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

La empresaria empezó hace 14 años vendiendo golosinas en un kiosco cerca al colegio Razuri, el concejo le alquiló el local, pero lo cerró porque no era rentable; como sabe preparar y decorar tortas se dedicó a este negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien, actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado D. abastos D. San Pedro D. Lloc donD. no solo venD. tortas sino también elabora y venD. adornos para fiestas D. todo tipo y además muy temprano, por la mañana venD. desayunos.

Gracias a una amiga ingresó al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró adornos en acrílico para tortas. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 6 meses tiene pensado comprar mesas, campana extractora, licuadora, batidora, para implementar mejor el negocio D. la venta D. desayunos y si le alcanza tecno por para elaborar adornos. Ella sueña con aprender a elaborar piñatas.

loans.use: Purchase of tables, oven hood, blender, food mixer

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María is 63 years old and married. She studied until middle school, but left when she got engaged. María has five children who live on their own. She lives in Laredo District, Trujillo Province in La Libertad state.

To support herself financially, María started selling cosmetics. The company sales supervisor visited María and encouraged her to join the Esika group of consultants. Seeing she needed capital to purchase products on sale in the company catalogue – and seeing a woman from the consultants group had referred María to the Mercado Modelo Community Bank – she decided to attend a bank meeting and became a member of the bank at that time. María has been working with the bank for two years. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase cosmetic products to increase her stock.

With a loan of 800 soles [about US $ 275], which will be paid back in six months, María plans to purchase cosmetics on sale to get better prices. She is community bank treasurer and, as such, she is responsible for overseeing all the accounts. María hopes for a big business and for good health for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora María Francisca, tiene 63 años, está casada, estudió hasta 5to grado D. primaria no continuó estudiando porque se comprometió, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son independientes, vive en el Distrito D. Laredo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender productos cosméticos, la socia recibió la visita D. la supervisora D. ventas y la animó a formar parte del grupo D. consultoras D. Esika, pero como necesitaba capital para comprar los productos cosméticos que están en oferta en el catalogo y como una compañera del grupo D. consultoras le comentó sobre el Banco Comunal “MERCADO MODELO” ella decidió asistir a una reunión D. este Banco, entonces es cuando deciD. incorporarse a Manuela Ramos, en esta ONG lleva trabajando 2 años y con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/. 300.00 compró productos cosméticos para incrementar el stock.

Con el crédito D. S/. 800.00 que cancelará en 6 meses tiene pensado comprar productos cosméticos que están en oferta para obtener mejores precios. En el Banco Comunal la empresaria tiene el cargo D. tesorera cuya función es llevar el control D. todas las cuentas. La socia sueña con tener un negocio granD. y que su esposo este bien D. salud.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (cosmetics)

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa Coreo lives in the Palo de Leche neighborhood in the Ticuantepe municipality. She is married, her husband is a welder and they have five children; two who study and three who work with her farming. For fifteen years, Teresa has dedicated herself to growing pineapples, a business which she started with her own efforts and with the help of loans from AFODENIC. Currently, she has an upcoming pineapple harvest to which, like always, she is dedicating her best efforts to obtain a 100% harvest. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase organic fertilizers in order to get quality pineapples and then distribute them to the markets in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Coreo habita en el barrio Palo de Leche del municipio de Ticuantepe, es casada, su esposo se dedica a hacer trabajos de soldadura. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian y 3 trabajan junto a ella en la agricultura. Teresa se dedica al cultivo de piña desde hace 15 años actividad que empezó con esfuerzo propio y que se ha podido ayudar con los préstamos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado. Actualmente tiene una próxima cosecha de piña, a la cual como siempre le está dedicando su mejor esfuerzo para poder obtenerla al 100%. Con el crédito solicitado invertirá en la compra de abonos orgánicos para poder darle al producto el mantenimiento necesario para que pueda salir piña de calidad, y así después poder distribuirla en los mercados de Managua.

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer to improve production.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Juana B. lives in the Ticuantepe municipality which is known for its pineapple and pitahaya (cactus fruits) harvests. Juana has been growing pitahayas for the past 20 years. She has 4 children who are married and independent. Juana’s life partner is also in the farming business and both support each other in the harvest. On occasion, he also works as a bricklayer when the harvests do not generate income. Juana also has a small business selling candies from her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase fertilizer to improve the pitahaya and to obtain better harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juana B. habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe conocido por sus cosechas de piña y pitahayas. Y uno de esos agricultores es Juana, tiene 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo de pitahayas. Juana tiene 4 hijos, ya todos están casados y son independientes a ella. El compañero de vida de Juana también es agricultor y ambos se apoyan en el trabajo de la cosecha. Aunque también en ocasiones el trabaja como albañil, para buscar maneras de subsistencia mientras la cosecha no genera ingresos. Juana también tiene una pequeña venta de golosinas en su casa de habitación. El crédito será usado para la compra de abono para mejorar la pitahaya y tener mejores cosechas.

loans.use: Fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. She is resourceful and enterprising. She has supported two children to graduate from high school through her business.

Augustina operates a small restaurant and sells local foods like "fufu" and "banku". Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, eaten with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She needs this loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality.

Augustina wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Augustina is a member of a group called "Adekyensroma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the loan and provide support to one another in repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Juana Petronila

texts.es:
Juana is 46 years old and is separated from her spouse. She completed the first part of an accounting degree, but left the program when she got married. Juana has two daughters: one works while the other is in school.

Juana used to work in a cobbler’s workshop. Because she had to work all day and didn’t have anyone to take care of her daughters, she decided to work for herself in her own business. Now she sells food out of her house in Laredo District, Trujillo Province in La Libertad state. Seeing she lacked capital, Juana decided to become a member of the Mercado Modelo Community Bank. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase a kitchen for her business.

With a loan of 1,200 soles [about US $ 425], which will be paid back in six months, Juana plans to purchase one sack of potatoes, oil, rice, pasta, vegetable stock, etc. Juana’s goal is to start a business selling artisan goods from Chulucanas, a town in northern Peru, in the state of Piura. According to Juana, her house once had no floor, but she has been able to upgrade her house thanks to the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Juana Petronila, actualmente está separada, tiene 46 años, estudió I ciclo de la carrera de contabilidad, no continuó estudiando porque se casó, tiene 2 hijas, 1 trabaja y 1 estudia.

La empresaria trabajaba en un taller de calzado, pero ella laboraba todo el día y no había quien cuide a sus hijas, entonces decidió trabajar en un negocio propio como es la venta de comida en su casa en el Distrito de Laredo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, pero como no tenía capital es cuando decide integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mercado Modelo”, tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró 1 cocina para el negocio.

Con el crédito de S/. 1,200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 6 meses tiene pensado comprar 01 saco de papas, aceite, arroz, tallarín, menestras, etc. La socia tiene como meta tener un negocio de venta de artesanía de Chulucanas, un poblado ubicado al norte de nuestro País en el Departamento de Piura. Ella cuenta que antes su casa no tenía piso y que gracias a las ganancias que obtienen ha ido mejorando su casa.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. He is 28 years old and is married with three young children. His wife sells cosmetics to help with the household expenses and to help improve the living conditions for their children who are in grammar school. Juan works as service laborer; a job he has held for four years. The loan that he is seeking will be used for improvements on their home such as pouring in a concrete floor as their home currently has a dirt floor. For this he needs to buy cement, sand and stones. He wants to improve his home in order to be more comfortable with his family. His dream is to continue improving his home and to help his wife in invest in the sale of clothing as she has been successful in the sale of cosmetics. Juan also wants to be able to have his children continue in school so that they can make an honest living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Juan habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, ella vende cosmético para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y así apoyar a su esposo y poder tener mejores condiciones para sus hijos que están estudiando en la primaria. Juan trabaja de operario de servicios, tiene cuatro años de estar laborando. El préstamo que está solicitando es para hacer mejoras en su hogar como es poner piso de concreto ya que hasta el momento es de tierra quiere hacer la mejora en su casa para estar mas cómodo con su familia, para esto necesita comprar: cemento. arena y piedrin. Su sueño es seguir mejorando su vivienda, ayudar a su esposa para que invierta en la venta de ropa ya que le va bien con la venta de cosméticos. Lograr que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que puedan ganarse la vida honestamente.

loans.use: Add a concrete floor to home.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María is 32 years old and lives with her spouse. She completed freshman year of high school, but left to take care of her younger siblings. María has two children who are currently in school. She lives in Trujillo District, Trujillo Province in La Libertad state.

To support herself financially, María started selling cosmetics seven years ago. At first she assisted with sales, but she was later recommended and began selling on her own. One of María’s female friends encouraged her to join the Luz Divina [Divine Light] Community Bank. As she was seeking capital, she decided to become a member of the bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase beauty products that were on sale in the catalogue.

With a loan of 1,000 soles [about US $ 350], which will be paid back in six months, María plans to purchase cosmetics to increase her stock. She is community bank secretary and, as such, she is responsible for recording meeting minutes and decisions, tracking absences and late payments, and assisting with archiving documents. María hopes to own her own house and provide a better life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora María Susana, tiene 32 años, actualmente es conviviente, estudió hasta 4to año de secundaria, no continuó estudiando porque tenía que cuidar a sus hermanos pequeños, tiene 02 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender productos cosméticos hace 7 años, primero ayudaba a vender, después la recomendaron e ingresó a vender sola. Una amiga la animó a participar en el Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” y como quería capital, entonces decidió incorporarse a este Banco y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró los productos de belleza que estaban en oferta en el catalogo.

Con el crédito de S/. 1000.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar productos cosméticos para incrementar el stock. En el Banco Comunal, La empresaria tiene el cargo de secretaria cuya función es escribir en el acta lo que se acuerda en las reuniones, llevar el control de las inasistencias y tardanzas y ayudar con el archivo de documentos. La socia sueña con tener una casa propia, y darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (cosmetics)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is 54 years old and lives with her spouse. She finished primary school, but was not able to continue her studies for lack of money to support her siblings. María has seven children, five of whom work, while the other two are students. She lives in Trujillo District, Trujillo Province, in La Libertad state.

To support herself financially María started selling soft drinks eight years ago. Later she decided to set up her business. Her female friends encouraged her to become a member of the Luz Divina [Divine Light] Community Bank and she later decided to participate. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for four years and used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase soft drinks for sale.

With a loan of 1200 soles [about US $425], which will be paid back in six months, María plans to pay a few invoices for groceries and purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar, oil, etc. María hopes to renovate the second floor of her house to make it more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora María tiene 54 años, actualmente es conviviente, estudió primaria completa, no continuó estudiando porque eran muchos hermanos y el dinero no alcanzaba, tiene 7 hijos, 5 trabajan y 2 estudian, vive en el Distrito D. Trujillo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó vendiendo gaseosas hace 8 años, después quería implementar el negocio y sus amigas la animaron a incorporarse al Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” luego ella decidió participar, tiene 4 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/. 300.00 compró gaseosas.

Con el crédito D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 6 meses tiene pensado pagar algunas facturas D. abarrotes y comprar gaseosa, arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc. La empresaria sueña con mejorar el segundo piso D. su casa para tener más comodidad.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (grocery items)

loans.name: Erick Danilo

texts.es:
Erick L., a 22 year-old small merchant, has a small grocery store in his house. From a very young age, he began selling sweets, but because he didn’t have capital and because of his age, he wasn’t eligible for a loan. Through the years, though, he has learned to manage his business and make it grow until became the store that it is today. He does not yet have children, so he says that all of his strength and dedication go to his store. He hopes to be able to have a better life when he marries and has children. The loan will be used to buy products, like basic grains and perishable goods, to invest in his business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Erick L., un joven que a sus 22 años es un pequeño comerciante, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Empezó desde muy joven vendiendo golosinas, ya que no contaba con capital y por su edad no era apto para un crédito. Pero a través de los años ha aprendido a manejar su negocio y hacerlo crecer hasta convertirlo en la pulpería que es ahora. Todavía no tiene niños, así que él cuenta que todo su esfuerzo y dedicación están en la pulpería. Espera poder tener una vida con mejores condiciones para cuando se case y tenga hijos. El crédito será usado en la compra de productos para inversión en su negocio, como son granos básicos y productos perecederos.

loans.use: To buy products to supply his small grocery store

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Ms. Luz María is 41 years old, a single mom, and studied higher technical education which she was not able to finish, has three children who are students, and lives in the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

The entrepreneur began selling juices and out of her display cabinet she sold bread, later she was advised by a non-governmental organization helping mothers. Because she wanted to expand her business she decided to join the communal bank “Luz Divina” and with the first loan of 300 soles (US $100) that she received she purchased a small car to sell juices, cakes, bread.

With a loan of 1200 soles (US $425) which will be repaid in six months, she intends to purchase beer, rice, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc. In the communal bank in which she belongs she has the role of treasurer, whose function is to receive all payments, keep accounts. She dreams of having a garment manufacturing company.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz María tiene 41 años, es madre soltera, estudió educación superior técnica la cual nunca pudo ejercer, tiene 03 hijos, son estudiantes, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria inició vendiendo jugos y en su vitrina vendía pan, después le avisaron que una ONG ayudaba a las madres, como ella quería ampliar su negocio decidió incorporarse al Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 que recibió compró un coche pequeño para vender jugos, pasteles, pan. Con el crédito de S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado compra cerveza, arroz, leche, azúcar, gaseosa, etc. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de tesorera, cuya función es recibir todos los pagos, llevar la contabilidad. La socia sueña con tener una empresa de confecciones de ropa.

loans.use: Purchase of various products (groceries)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Miss. María is 28 years old, single, and studied until the fourth cycle of primary education but did not continue studying because she was dedicated to work. She does not have children and lives in the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad.

To help herself economically, she began selling live chickens a year ago, but because she did not have capital her grandmother recommended the communal bank, “Amigas en accion” and for her first loan she received 300 soles (US $100) and purchased live chickens, food for the chicks and vitamins.

With a loan of 700 soles (US $250), which will be repaid in four months, she intends to buy live chickens and food for the chickens such as for fattening, birth, growth and B complex.

In the communal bank in which she belongs she operates as the prosecutor, whose function is to visit new members, explain to them and encourage them to join the group. She dreams of having her own house and a grocery business.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita María tiene 28 años, está soltera, estudio hasta IV ciclo de educación primaria no siguió estudiando porque se dedicó a trabajar, no tiene hijos, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Para ayudarse económicamente hace 01 año empezó a comprar pollos vivos, pero como no tenía capital su abuelita la recomendó en el Banco Comunal “AMIGAS EN ACCION” y con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 (US $ 100) compro pollos vivos, comida para los pollitos, vitaminas. Con el crédito de S/. 700.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 04 meses tiene pensado comprar pollos vivos, alimento para los pollitos como: engorde, inicio, crecimiento, complejo B. En el Banco Comunal al que pertenece tiene el cargo de fiscal cuya función es visitar nuevas socias, explicarles y animarlas para que ingresen al grupo. La socia sueña con tener una casa propia, y un negocio de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and food for young animals

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena, age 44, is a widow and mother of eight children. Through her business, she has been able to support two children to complete high school. Helena enjoys selling goods, the trade through which she obtains her daily source of income. She is a petty merchant who trades in vegetables and fruits in the local market. Helena has good customer service, and because of that many customers buy from her stand. However, she buys her supplies on credit at relatively high prices for lack of adequate working capital. With this loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of vegetables and fruits to serve her customers. She belongs to the community group called Adekyensroma Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee loans for one another as social collateral.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 45 years old and a mother of five children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been selling foodstuff, such as maize, plantains, beans, ground nuts and gari, in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative, and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family. Akosua is a member of the group called First King Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee loans for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Marcos Erminio

texts.es:
Mr. Marcos Herminio is a traveling salesman in a market in Managua; he sells watches, wallets, and other such articles. He lives in Concepción de Maria in Managua. He is married, and his wife takes care of their family and home. They have two children, who are 9 and 17 years old. Mr. Marcos’ life was very hard; as a result, he wants to pull his family forward and give them what his parents couldn’t give him. He began his traveling sales 10 years ago, and says that it was very difficult because he was opening a niche in the market with his traveling watch sales, but he has gone forward. His plans are to be able to establish a permanent place in this popular market. He needs this loan to supply more merchandise. He will buy watches and wallets to continue his sales.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Marcos Herminio es vendedor ambulante en un mercado de Managua de relojes, billeteras y demás artículos. Habita en el barrio Concepción de Maria de la ciudad de Managua. Es casado, su esposa se dedica al cuido de su familia y del hogar, tienen 2 hijos de 9 y 17 años. La vida de Don Marcos fue muy dura, es por eso que él desea sacar adelante a su familia y darles lo que sus padres no pudieron darle a él. Empezó hace 10 años sus ventas ambulantes, y cuenta que fue muy difícil porque él estaba abriendo un nicho de mercado en las ventas ambulantes de relojes, pero ha salido adelante y los planes que tiene es poder establecerse en un punto fijo en este populoso mercado. El préstamo lo necesita para surtirse más de mercadería, comprará relojes y billeteras para continuar con sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy watches and wallets

loans.name: Juana Marianela

texts.es:
Ms. Juana Marianela is 38 years old, single, and studied up until the third cycle of accounting; she did not finish her studies because she did not have enough money. She does not have any children and lives in the district of Trujillo in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Liberatad.

The entrepreneur started off selling cookies, soft drinks, beer and as her customers asked her to sell more products she decided to increase her capital and received an invitation from a friend to participate in the communal bank “Luz Divina.” With the first loan she received of 300 soles (US $ 100) she bought rice, oil, beer, etc. With the loan of 1400 (US $475) soles, which will be paid off in six months, she intends to buy coffee, noodles, soft drinks, candy, cookies, eggs, butter, yogurt and soap. She dreams of having a mini-market and a home of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith], Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Juana Marianela tiene 38 años, está soltera, estudió hasta III ciclo de contabilidad, no concluyó sus estudios porque no había solvencia económica, no tiene hijos, vive en el Distrito de Trujillo en la Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. La empresaria empezó a vender galleta, gaseosa, cerveza, y como los clientes le pedían que venda más productos entonces decidió incrementar el capital y recibió la invitación de una amiga para participar en el Banco Comunal “LUZ DIVINA” con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 compró arroz, aceite, cerveza, etc. Con el crédito de S/. 1400.00 que cancelará en un plazo de 06 meses tiene pensado comprar café, fideos, gaseosa, golosinas, galletas, huevos, mantequilla, jabón yogurt. La socia sueña con tener un minimarket y tener una casa propia.

loans.use: Purchase of various groceries

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia, 40 years old, is married with four children, aged 17, 15, 12, and 6 years respectively. They are currently in school. She is a petty trader who sells yams and rice. She has been selling these products for the past fifteen years and has always been a great resource for her family.

Afia wants to use this loan to buy in bulk a supply of rice and yams to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing food prices due to the current food crisis in the country.She believes this loan will also enable her to decrease her costs very significantly to increase savings to support her children at school. Afia is a member of the trust group called Disciples. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy in bulk a supply of rice and yams

loans.name: Maria Neria

texts.es:
María Neria and her family moved to Reynosa dreaming of a better future, as in their own region employment opportunities were scarce. Upon arriving in Reynosa, her husband started looking for a job and found one. As time went on, they began to save so they would have some money available for any situation that arose.

Later her husband was laid off and with their savings, she started her own food business so that they could keep up with their household expenses. Little by little she increased her supply and variety of food and up to now things have gone well.

She is currently requesting a loan for US $500, which will be repaid in 6 month, to buy more supplies, and she hopes that with Kiva´s support she will receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglsi, Kiva volunteer.

María Neria junto con su familia emigró a Reynosa con el sueño de tener un mejor futuro, ya que en su tierra natal las fuentes de ingresos eran muy escasas, al llegar aquí su esposo empezó a buscar empleo, el cual lo consiguió, al paso del tiempo, empezaron a ahorrar para tener dinero disponible para cualquier situación. Posteriormente a su esposo lo desocuparon del empleo, entonces con los ahorros que tenían ella decidió poner su propio negocio de comidas, para poder salir adelante con los gastos económicos. Poco a poco le fue surtiendo y teniendo variedad de comida, hasta hoy en día le ha ido muy bien.

Actualmente esta solicitando un crédito por US $500 a 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase supplies.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo began her business to help out the mothers in her neighborhood, as most of them worked and it was difficult for them to take their children to school. For this reason she started the business and also to help herself financially.

She started with just one van for school transportation in her own neighborhood. With the income from that and her own efforts she expanded her business and now has another van. Now she has several schools to where she transports children, not only in her own neighborhood.

She needs a loan for US $1,000, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy parts and for general maintenance work on the vehicles before school starts. She has faith that with Kiva´s support, she will be able to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Consuelo inicio este negocio para beneficiar a las madres de familia de su colonia ya que pues la mayoría de ellas trabaja y les es difícil llevar a sus hijos a la escuela y por tal motivo inicio el negocio y también para ayudarse económicamente.

Empezó solamente con un transporte escolar para su misma colonia, con los ingresos, esfuerzos ha podido ampliar su negocio, ya que hoy cuenta con otro transporte escolar. Ahora tiene varias escuelas a donde va y lleva niños, ya no es únicamente la de su colonia.

Ella necesita de un crédito por US $1,000 que pagara a 6 meses para la compra de refacciones, mantenimiento general de las unidades para este regreso a clases, tiene la fe que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To purchase parts and for maintenance of vehicles.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth was, at first, selling foods; later, she and her husband were selling both whole chickens and kilograms of chicken. Then, their clients asked Elizabeth and her husband to also sell meat by the kilo, so they supplied beef and pork. Up until the present, they have been a good income. At present, they no longer sell chickens and meat.

Elizabeth needs a loan for US $500, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy merchandise. The loan will also allow her shop to be well stocked for all her clients. She has confidence that with the help of Kiva she will receive her loan.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth inicio primero con la venta de comidas, posteriormente con la ayuda de su esposo fueron vendiendo pollos en kilos y enteros, posteriormente sus clientes les pedían que también vendieran carnes por kilos, el cual pues surtieron carne de res y de puerco. Hasta hoy en día les ha generado buenos ingresos. Actualmente nada más se dedica a la venta de pollos y carnes.

Ella necesita de un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía, y para tener bien surtido para todos sus clientes, tiene la confianza que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Nora Elia

texts.es:
Nora Elia decided to start a stationery business in order to help the family finances and to get ahead with the expenses and the education of her small children. She started with a small shop in her home, later she expanded the premises and stocked more merchandise. She likes this type of business because it gives her the time to do housework, pay attention to her children, and also have an income.

Now she needs a loan of US $500, which she will repay over 6 months, to buy merchandise for the new school year, which is her best sales season. She is confident that with Kiva's help, she will receive her loan to supply her stationery shop and be able to meet the needs of her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Nora Elia decidió iniciar el negocio de papelería, para apoyar la economía de su hogar y poder salir adelante con los gastos económicos y la educación de sus pequeños hijos. Primero empezó con un pequeño local en su domicilio, posteriormente fue ampliando el local y fue surtiendo de más mercancía. Le gusto este tipo de negocio, por que le da tiempo de hacer las labores de su hogar, atender a sus 3 hijos y poder tener ingresos.

Ahora necesita de un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía para este regreso a clases, ya que es el tiempo donde tiene mejores ingresos, tiene la confianza que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendrá su crédito para poder surtir bien su papelería y así poder satisfacer todas las necesidades de sus cliente

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea decided to start her business in order to help the family finances. Since her husband was unemployed, they started the business together. They started with a grinder, doing the work that came to them in a small space in their own home that only had a roof and was exposed to the weather. With that income they bought a drill to help them attract work from small companies, as well as the necessary materials.

Now she needs a loan of US $600 which she will repay over 6 months, in order to buy work materials. She believes that with Kiva's support, she will obtain her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Andrea decidió iniciar el negocio, para apoyar la economía de su hogar. Ya que en ese tiempo su esposo se encontraba desempleado y juntos emprendieron el negocio. Iniciaron con una Fresadora y realizando el trabajo que le llegaba en un pequeño espacio de su mismo domicilio que solo estaba techado y expuesto a los diferentes climas. Con los ingresos que obtenían fue comprando un Torno que le ayuda a captar trabajos para pequeñas empresas y demás material necesario.

Ahora necesita de un préstamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de material de trabajo, tiene la fe que con el apoyo de Kiva obtendrá su crédito.

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Maria Ceferina

texts.es:
Ceferina started the business 7 years ago because she could not catch up with her regular expenses. She decided to sell meals among her neighbors. Not only did they buy meals from her, but now she is commissioned to make tortillas for the panuchos (a Yucatan specialty) which are made every morning in the town market.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay over 3 months, to buy a grill in order to speed up the meal preparation. With you help she will achieve it!

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Ceferina inicio el negocio hace 7 años al ver que no alcanzaba para los gastos familiares decidió vender comida entre sus vecinos, los cuales no solo le compran comida, sino que ahora le encargan tortillas para la venta de panuchos que se hacen todas las mañanas en el mercado del pueblo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una parrilla para hacer mas rápida la elaboración de su comida. Con tu apoyo podrá lograrlo!!.

loans.use: To buy a grill

loans.name: Juany Del Pilar

texts.es:
Juany spent her time as a homemaker, but two years ago her husband had an accident and is still disabled. She found herself looking for a business that would help her to meet expenses, since his pension alone was not adequate. Thus she decided to open her small shop, which she has stocked little by little and has successfully increased her sales.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 3 months, in order to buy more merchandise. With your help, she will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Juany se dedicaba a las labores del hogar, pero hace 2 años su marido tuvo un accidente y quedo discapacitado, fue entonces que se vio en la necesidad de buscar un negocio que le ayudara a cubrir los gastos familiares, ya q con la pensión de su esposo no les alcanzaba. Fue así como decidió poner su pequeña tienda, la cual poco a poco ha ido surtiendo y ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más mercancía. Con tu ayuda ella hará crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Patzutzun 1 Group

texts.en:
Crecencia tells me there is not much happening in the village of Patzutzun where they are from. Most of them do not have running water in their homes. Their living situation is often not very good. Following the suggestion of one group member's husband, they formed the group and travelled to the office of Friendship Bridge in Sololá to apply for a loan. The bonding between the group members is strong because they know each other very well. There is a lot of laughing when Crecencia tells me with a flashing smile how she trusts and loves everybody equally and very much.

Like most of the women, Dominga, the president of the group, has a business dealing in agriculture. She has some chickens and grows vegetables such as carrots and onions. Some group members buy and re-sell various condiments such as beans and fruit and vegetables. They will sell them at different markets. There are also some women who sell tortillas and/or bread. The ones who have animals have raised animals their whole life. This is a very common way to try to make money in Patzutzun. 

For many of the members of this group, it is the first time they've received a loan through Friendship Bridge. They have ambitious plans such as: increasing the amount of products in their stores and using their land as economically as possible. The loan will enable them to buy better seeds at lower costs. By using the credit to buy in bulk, the women who buy and sell vegetables will be able to buy at lower prices and thus be able to make more profit.

Crecencia tells me their children all go to school, but need more supplies to be able to study well. The lacking pencils, paper, and schoolbooks are something she wants to provide them with first. When she is able to buy more, she really wants to buy them better school uniforms. The uniforms they wear now were bought for other family members and don't fit very well. The others agree, it is their biggest wish that their children have a chance at a better future!

loans.use: invest in inventory for their businesses and buy at better prices

loans.name: Deisy

texts.es:
Deisy has been selling clothing and shoes for two years. She started among her neighbors in order to help her husband with the family expenses. Since then her sales have continued to increased and her clientele has grown quite a bit.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay over 3 months, to buy merchandise to offer to her clients. With your support she will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Deisy desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, ella empezó en esta actividad entre sus vecinas para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, desde entonces ha ido incrementando sus ventas y ahora ha crecido bastante su clientela.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y ofrecerla a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Patzutzun 2 Group

texts.en:
Patzutzun is a calm and quiet village, where everybody knows one another. The living circumstances are not very good. The houses are not well equipped and often lack running water. Therefore they talk a lot about how to improve their lives. One of the members of this group once heard of micro-finance and started searching for a way to arrange this for them. They contacted Friendship Bridge and after a successful first loan, this is going to be their second loan now.

The women of this group have daily food stores and raise cattle. One of them also has chickens, and Rosa S. buys and sells candles. The president of the Group is called Clavia, who buys corn in Sololá. She takes this to Patzutzun to sell to all her friends, family, and neighbours. They all go to the local millers to have their corn ground into flour, to make their delicious tortillas. The fact that there is a miller in their village saves them a lot of work, not having to do the grinding by hand, says Clavia. 

Mercedes, who is here with her daughter, will buy a new bull and all the necessities, such as food and fencing, to take care of him. When he is big and strong, she will sell him. It was Mercedes who initially started using credit this way. She has done it several times now. Her daughter Eusebia is going to follow her mom's example. This is a reasonably steady business, she tells me while holding the tiniest baby on her arm! When I ask them why they don't buy a cow to produce calves, they tell me that it is a very different business to raise young cattle. Cows are also not easy to find and much more expensive. And since working with the bulls is something they have a lot of experience with, their buyers already know the good quality of their bulls.

Rosa is a very good cook and people buy her tortillas as far away as Guatemala City! She runs her business with the help of her daughter. Her daughter makes the 2-3 hour journey a couple of times a week to sell her mother's tortillas. Maria is hoping to expand her store to be able to sell different products in the future. Next to her sits Antonia, who wants to do the same and eventually improve her home.  

Antonia also wants to provide her children with their own bed and better school clothes. All her hard work is for one purpose only: to give her kids the best she can. And when I ask whether all the kids go to school they answer as one person: YES! 

All of them are very determined to ensure their children will have better and more education than they had themselves.

loans.use: invest in cattle and expand the variety of the products they sell

loans.name: Mamodu's Group

texts.en:
These teachers are from the Benevolent Islamic Secondary School in Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000. They want this loan for various reasons. Mamodu B., 27, would like to invest his in business. Mamodu is an assistance teacher and has been teaching for the past two years now.

Alhassan A. F. would like to use his to purchase building materials. Alhassan is 37 and married with 4 children. He has been in the teaching profession for the past 14 years now.

Alimany K. will use his to purchase pieces of furniture. He is 40 and married with 2 children. Alimany has 17 years of experience in the teaching field.

Alhaji J. will invest his in business. Alhaji is married with 1 child.

loans.use: Buy top-up cards and phone accessories

loans.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es:
She started her business with an investment of 20 soles (US $ 6-7) in the sale of spices, nowadays she invests 150- 200 soles weekly (US $ 50-70), generating a profit of 90-100 soles a week (US $ 30-35) She considers that her husband was a hindrance in her life, who did not allow her to grow and was only a breadwinner; now she fights alone to raise her two younger children and hopes to buy their land in order to have a place to live.

Silvia is 33 years old, is a member of the communal bank “Señor del Cautivo II” of Huaraz. With this loan of 800 soles (US $ 275)that will be provided by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she will buy three sakcs of red chili pepper, yellow chili pepper and garlic to store and then go sell them. This loan will be repaid in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Inicio su negocio con 20 soles de inversión, en la venta de especerías, en la actualidad invierte de 150 a 200 soles semanales, generándole una ganancia de 90 a 100 soles a la semana. Considera que su esposo fue un estorbo en su vida, quien no le permitió crecer y solo era un mantenido, ahora lucha sola, por hacer crecer a sus dos hijos menores, espera comprar su terreno para tener un lugar donde vivir.

Silvia tiene 33 años, es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II” de Huaraz. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 soles que le otorgará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella comprará 3 sacos de ají panca, amarillo, rojo y ajos para almacenarlo y luego ir vendiéndolo. Este préstamo será pagado en 6 cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of spices

loans.name: Marlene Mónica

texts.es:
After her husband abandoned her five years ago, she decided to move to Yungay, because she found a place for sell in this city. Each morning, together with her two children she goes out to sell bananas which are brought from the city of Trujillo. She sends a bank draft every weekend so that the bananas arrive on time, mature and ready to sell on market days, which are Wednesday and Sunay, where she can make 100 soles per week (approximately US $35). Now her main concern is for her three children to become professionals and study a carrer, so that they won’t have to go through the bad weather that she endures daily selling fruits in the market Modelo de Yungay. She is constantly preoccupied over her son of nine years who crys constantly and seems sad all of the time. She hopes to be able to help him and do what he needs.

With the loan of 500 soles (US $ 175) that will be provided by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy bananas in bulk for her business. R. is 39 years old and belongs to the communal bank “Yungay Hermosura II;” before she separated from her husband she sold fruits in bulk for 15 years, now she wants to return to selling in the same manner but she can’t because this would require her to travel and she doesn’t want to leave her children alone, especially the younger ones.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

Después que su esposo la abandonara hace cinco años ella decidió radicar en Yungay, porque encontró un lugar de venta en esta ciudad, cada mañana junto a sus dos hijos sale a vender los plátanos que es traído desde la ciudad de Trujillo, con un giro bancario, que ella envía cada fin de semana para que los plátanos le llegue a tiempo, maduren y pueda venderlos los días de feria que son los miércoles y domingo, donde logra ganar 100 soles semanales. Ahora su mayor preocupación es que sus tres hijos sean profesionales y estudien una carrera, para que no tengan que pasar las inclemencias que ella pasa a diario en la venta de frutas que tiene en la puerta del Mercado Modelo de Yungay. Tiene una constante preocupación hacia su hijo de nueve años quien llora constantemente y parece triste todo el tiempo, ella espera poder ayudarlo y hacer que lo ayuden. Con el préstamo de 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, ella comprará, de los mayoristas, plátanos, mandarinas, pepinos y otras frutas para implementar su negocio. R. de 39 años, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Yungay Hermosura II”,antes de separarse de su esposo vendía las frutas al por mayor durante 15 años, ahora espera volver a vender de la misma manera, pero no puede hacerlo, porque eso implicaría viajar y ella no desea dejar a sus hijos solos ya que son menores de edad

loans.use: Purchase of fruit in bulk

loans.name: Mery Del Rosario

texts.es:
Mery del Rosario, 24, is an intelligent young woman. She finished her accounting studies a year ago but due to a lack of job opportunities she hasn't been able to work in her profession. Now, with the goal of helping her mother who has sacrificed a lot so that she could finish her studies, Mery del Rosario has decided to start a business selling and distributing beer. The business is starting to generate a good income but, above all, it provides a means for Mery del Rosario to support her mother. Mery del Rosario distributes her drinks at various social events in the city. Her hope is to be able to increase the amount of money that she invests every month in the purchase of product so that she can, in turn, increase her earnings and provide a better quality of life for her mother. She's sure that with dedication and effort, she'll be able to build a successful business and, in the future, to practice her profession.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Mery del Rosario es una joven inteligente de 24 años, hace un año terminó sus estudios superiores de contabilidad, pero por falta de oportunidades de trabajo no puede desempeñarse profesionalmente, ahora, con el fin de ayudar a su madre y así corresponderle por el sacrificio que hizo al brindarle estudios superiores, decidió abrir un deposito de cerveza y dedicarse a la venta y distribución de esta bebida. Este negocio que le viene resultando muy rentable y sobre todo le permite apoyar económicamente a su madre.Mery del Rosario distribuye sus bebidas en los diferentes compromisos sociales y días festivos de su ciudad.El deseo de esta emprendedora jovencita es poder incrementar la suma de dinero que invierte mes a mes en la compra de su producto, para así incrementar también sus ganancias, y brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida, está segura que con dedicación y empeño lo podrá conseguir, y en un futuro cercano poder ejercer su carrera.

loans.use: Increase working capital for liquor business in order to buy larger inventories.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
We found Luzilla, happy and diligent, making her delicious meat "anticuchos" (a kebab-like dish made with grilled meat and potatoes) for the large number of happy customers that she serves. Luzmilla begins making her delicious kebabs at 3:00 in the afternoon and continues until 7:00 in the evening. Thanks to her excellent seasoning, the good service she provides and, above all, the reasonable prices she charges at her stand located in an easily-accessible part of the city, the business is widely visited. Luzmilla is applying for this loan to renovate her stand so that she can offer her customers a more comfortable, more secure place to buy her products. After all, it's her customers who allow her to make a living and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Encontramos a Luzmila muy contenta y diligente preparando sus deliciosos anticuchos de carne (pedazos de carne y papa a la parrilla encajados en palitos de madera), que son consumidos satisfactoriamente por la gran cantidad de clientes con los que cuenta.Luzmila empieza la preparación de sus deliciosos potajes desde las tres de la tarde hasta las siete de la noche, gracias a su excelente sazón, a la buena atención que brinda y sobre todo a los precios cómodos con los que vende en su puesto ubicado en una zona estratégica de la ciudad, es muy visitada.Solicita este préstamo para acondicionar su puesto de venta y brindarle mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus clientes, clientes que le permiten mantener sin privaciones económicas a su familia.

loans.use: Make improvements to "anticucho" (kebab) stand.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a very happy woman, a good example of dedication and perseverance. Since her marriage, she's made a living selling beer, soft drinks, gas (for cooking, presumably) and other basic commodities that she buys in the Peruvian city of Juliaca and hauls, with much effort, to different markets in nearby towns for resale. While Juana and her husband are away, their 2 young children stay in the care of a young woman who they consider part of their family. Juana's hope is to increase her supply of capital and generate more income. She thinks that once this project is realized, she'll finally be able to begin construction on the house that is her family's dream.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer muy alegre, ejemplo de constancia y dedicación, desde que contrajo matrimonio se dedicó al comercio de cerveza, gaseosas, gas e insumos de primera necesidad, mercadería que adquiere en la ciudad de Juliaca y la transporta con mucho sacrificio hacia las distintas ferias de los pueblitos aledaños de su localidad.Mientras Juana y su esposo se dedican a esta actividad, sus 2 menores niños se quedan bajo el cuidado de una jovencita a la que consideran parte de la familia.El deseo de Juana es aumentar su monto de capital y obtener mayores ingresos, ella considera que concretando ese proyecto finalmente podrán hacer construir su vivienda con la que su familia sueña.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Valentina Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia, 19, is a young woman from Juliaca in Peru. She has little money so she's had to apply herself to different kinds of work to cover her basic needs. She's a happy and enterprising woman despite having had to work from a very young age. She buys and sells craft products and operates a small stand selling ceviche (a traditional Peruvian dish made with fish and lemon) in a city market. Thanks to this business, she hopes to improve her quality of life and be able to shape her own future and that of her beloved parents. For now, with great hope, she's applying for a loan of 800 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of products for resale and for supplies to make ceviche. She promises to repay the loan in a period not to exceed 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Felicia es una joven de 19 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus bajos recursos económicos la obligaron a trabajar en diferentes actividades y así cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes.Esta emprendedora y alegre joven, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a la compra y venta de artesanía, comercio por campaña y además tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ceviche (plato típico peruano a base de pescado y limón) en un concurrido mercado de su ciudad, gracias a este negocio tiene la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida y ser protagonista de su propio desarrollo y el de sus queridos padres.En estos momentos, con mucha ilusión, solicita un préstamo por el monto de 800 soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de los productos que vende y de insumos para la elaboración del ceviche, se compromete a rembolsar éste, en un lapso no mayor de 6 meses.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Doris Olivia

texts.es:
Doris is 23 years old with two children; she is a member of the community bank “Senor de Ramos,” and intends on increasing her sale of salchipapas, a dish made of french fries and sausages, which are difficult to sell in Catac because there are very few buyers who don’t go out at night because of the cold, which is why she sells her product on festival days.

Living with her husband has not been very pleasant for her because he works in a mining company as a worker. She is looking for independence and to be able to raise her children and she hopes to have and manage a grocery store in her house.
