With the loan of 300 soles ( US $125) that will be provided by the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which will be paid off in four monthly installments, she will buy two sacks of potatoes and a box of oil.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith,Kiva Volunteer.

Doris tiene 23 años y dos hijos, es socia del banco comunal “Señor de Ramos”, intenta crecer en su venta de salchipapas ,ya que es difícil vender en Catac este producto, porque son muy pocos los compradores, que por el frío no salen en la noches, es por esta razón que ella expende su producto en fechas festivas. La convivencia con su esposo no le ha sido muy placentera quien trabaja en una planta minera como obrero, ella busca su independencia, y poder criar a sus hijos, espera tener e implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y con el préstamo que le otorgará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de 300 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, ella comprará dos sacos de papas y una caja de aceite.

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale potatoes and oil

loans.name: Erika Isaura

texts.es:
Erika is a 27-year-old single mother with two children. She belongs to the communal bank ““Señor de Ramos” in Catac. She gets up early every morning to go by burro to mountain tops of the region of Catac in order to exchange products such as sugar and rice for milk and cheese with the people who live in these high areas. She later sells the milk and cheese to women who sell to people traveling through Catac on their way to Huaraz

“I consider my independence to be the best thing I have. I don’t need a husband to help me make my decisions although my children (claim/want/need their father reclaman a su padres”) explains Erika who we find in the Plaza de Armas (the main square) in Catac. She tells us that these days she typically does not make cheese, but rather collects and exchanges it with other vendors. With the loan of 500 Soles ($175 USD), which she will replay in four installments, she will purchase a sack of rice and make a payment to the milk producers in the high region of Catac so that they can supply her with milk that she at times uses to make into cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Erika de 27 años, madre soltera con dos hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos”de Catac, se levanta en las madrugadas para ir con burro a las punas de Catac y de esa manera intercambiar los productos que compra por mayor, como azúcar ,arroz y otros, con leche y queso con las personas que viven en las partes altas de Catac, para luego venderlo por mayor a las señoras minoristas que venden el queso a los pasajeros que van hacia el sur de Huaraz ya que todos ellos pasan por Catac. “Considero que mi independencia es lo mejor que ahora tengo no necesito del esposo para tomar mis decisiones aunque a veces mis hijos reclaman a su padres” nos manifiesta Erika que la encontramos en la plaza de armas de Catac, ya que esta época, dice no preparar el queso y que solo lo recoge o intercambia. Con el préstamo de 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el mismo que será pagado en 4 cuotas, ella comprará un saco de arroz y dejara pagado a los ganaderos de la parte alta de Catac para que le abastezcan de leche ya que a veces ella misma lo prepara.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of rice and milk

loans.name: Silvia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Silvia, needing to help with family expenses, started to sell shoes from catalogs among her friends. Little by little her sales increased and they began to ask her to sell clothing, so her business has grown. She wants to buy more merchandise to offer more options to her clients.

She needs a loan of US $250, which she will repay in 4 months, in order to buy new catalogs and seasonal items to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Silvia ante la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos familiares, empezó a vender entre sus conocidos zapatos por catalogo, poco a poco sus ventas fueron incrementando y comenzaron a pedirle que vendiera ropa de esta manera ella ha ido creciendo en el negocio y es por esa razón que quiere comprar mas mercancía para poder brindarles mas opciones a sus clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar los nuevos catálogos y productos de temporada para ofrecerles a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase new catalogs and merchandise

loans.name: Lucila Antonia

texts.es:
Lucila is 55 years old. She was left a widow 10 years ago and has had to raise her five children on her own. She works raising young animals, mainly lambs, which she later sells to various purchasers. Her youngest son is now 21 and so she now works for herself and at times cares for her grandchildren.

She is a member of the communal bank “Señor de Ramos” in Catac. With this loan of 700 Soles ($250 USD), which she will repay in four payments, she will purchase four lambs which she will care for and later sell. Although the gain off each lamb is not much, she will have a profit of 30 to 40 Soles from each. She has concerns that her purchasers will not pay a good price, but she is accustomed to this manner of making a living and wishes to continue working to support herself.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Lucila de 55 años, quien se quedó viuda hace 10 años, ha tenido que hacer crecer a sus cinco hijos, dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, principalmente corderitos, los cuales después los vende a diferentes compradores. En la actualidad su hijo menor ya tiene 21 años, así que trabaja solo para ella misma y de ves en cuando cuida a los nietos. Con este préstamo de 700 soles, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará 4 corderos a los cuales alimentará y luego los venderá, aunque su ganancia no es muy significativa, que por cada cordero vendido es de 30 a 40 soles. La preocupación de Lucila que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos” de Catac, es que sus compradores no pagan el precio de sus animales, pero manifiesta que ella ya se acostumbro a este negocio y que ya no piensa cambiarlo ni dejarlo.

loans.use: Purchase of lambs

loans.name: Marina Luz

texts.es:
Marina’s ultimate goal is to help generate greater income for her family by purchasing a cart and sell salchipapas (a common fast food in Peru consisting of sliced sausages and french fries in various sauces) and roasted chicken in the afternoons along the main street of Catac. This will enable Marina, a member of the communal bank “Señor de Ramos” to augment the family income. Although her current work generates 140 Soles a week (~$48 USD) and her partner is a chauffeur, their current combined income is not enough to support their six children and provide for their educational needs. For five years Marina has sold ice cream and other sweets, which she purchases in the city of Huarez, outside of a secondary school in Catac

With this loan of $50 USD, which she will be granted by the Manuela Ramos Movement and which will be repaid in four installments, she will initiate her new business with the purchase of ice cream, cones, lollipops and ice cream spoons.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

La meta de Marina, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos” es comprar su carrito salchipapero y vender por las tardes en la calle principal de Catac, salchipapas y pollo broaster, para así tener mas ingresos, aunque su actual negocio le genera una ganancia de 140 soles semanales y su conviviente es chofer, esto no les es suficiente para mantener a sus seis hijos, ya que no se abastecen para darles lo necesario para sus estudios. Durante cinco años ella vende en el colegio secundario de Catac, helados y Chupetes, que los compra al por mayor de la ciudad de Huaraz. Con este préstamo de 100 soles, que le otorgará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y que será pagado en 4 cuotas, ella implementará su negocio con la compra de Barquillos, Helados, Chupetes y palitos para helados.

loans.use: Purchase provisions for food sales

loans.name: Victoria Pascuala

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Victoria needed to look for work because her husband´s salary was not enough to cover the family´s expenses. After looking for a long time, she decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Little by little her sales increased and now she would also like to sell new clothing so that she can offer more choice to her customers and earn more income.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 4 months, to buy goods and increase her inventory, and to be able to offer more options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Victoria desde hace 7 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, después de mucho buscar decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, y fue así como poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas y es ahora que quiere surtir con ropa nueva para así tener mas opciones para sus clientes, y tener un mayor ingreso

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y así aumentar su inventario, para poder ofrecerles más opciones a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase goods.

loans.name: Rosa Libertad

texts.es:
Renting rooms has become the most important source of income for Rosita, the name by which she's affectionately known to all of her renters and friends. Rosita is a much-loved woman, respected and valued in her neighborhood because despite hard economic times and family problems, she's had the strength to endure. With diligence and effort, she's managed to partially refurbish some of her rooms so that they could be rented and generate extra income. Now, seeing the need to make her renters more comfortable, she's decided to complete the renovations in order to better provide for the comfort and well-being of her guests and her family. With the goal of buying construction materials for the refurbishment, she's applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El alquiler de habitaciones se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de Rosita como cariñosamente la sueñen llamar sus inquilinos y amigos, Rosita es una mujer muy querida, respetada y valorada en su vecindad, ya que pasó por malos momentos económicos y graves problemas familiares, pero tuvo suficiente fortaleza para seguir adelante.Con empeño y diligencia logró refaccionar parte de sus habitaciones para finalmente ponerlas en alquiler y así obtener ingresos extras, pero ahora viendo la incomodidad de sus inquilinos se ve en la necesidad de concluir con algunos detalles, para mayor tranquilidad y bienestar de su huéspedes y su familia.Con ese objetivo, la compra de materiales para construir, Rosita espera obtener el préstamo que solicita.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to refurbish rented rooms.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo is an exemplary young man and very responsible. From a young age, it was obvious that he was an enterprising and hard-working guy. Since he didn't go on to university to finish his studies, he decided to start a taxi business with the goal of saving enough to resume his studies in the future. Unfortunately, some weeks ago, he was robbed of his radio transmitter, an important device for communicating with his customers and fellow cab drivers because it facilitates better and faster service for his customers and greater security for him. This young entrepeneur now needs a loan to continue developing his business with the enthusiasm, pleasure and security that he had before.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hugo es un hijo ejemplar y muy responsable, desde niño demostró ser un muchacho emprendedor y laborioso, al ver que no ingresó a la universidad para seguir estudios superiores, decidió dedicarse a brindar servicio de taxi a la población de su zona, con los beneficios que obtiene desea ahorrar lo suficiente para más adelante, cubrir los gastos de sus estudios superiores.Desafortunadamente hace algunas semanas sufrió el robo de su radio transmisor, importante aparato de comunicación que utiliza con sus clientes y compañeros taxistas para un mejor y rápido servicio a sus clientes y sobre todo mayor seguridad para su persona.Este emprendedor joven, en estos momentos requiere de un préstamo para seguir desenvolviéndose en su trabajo con el mismo entusiasmo, alegría y seguridad de siempre.

loans.use: Buy radio equipment for taxi business.

loans.name: María Rosario

texts.es:
Maria is an enterprising woman, she has worked on different activities, but unfortunately she didn’t succeed in any of them because she was alone facing family problems and hard economic times. Recently, with hard work and determination she started a business selling spare parts for cars. She brings the merchandise from La Paz, Bolivia and then distributes them in the city of Juliaca. In addition, Maria sells basic need items. She has been able to support her children with these two activities. She requests a loan to increase her working capital and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

María es una mujer emprendedora, se dedicó a diferentes actividades, pero desafortunadamente en ninguna pudo salir airosa, porque sola tuvo que enfrentar sus problemas familiares y difíciles momentos económicos por las que atravesaba su familia.Ahora con empeño y mucha dedicación viene emprendiendo su negocio de venta de repuestos para carros, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de la Paz- Bolivia y los distribuye en la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a este oficio María se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, con estas dos actividades viene manteniendo sin privaciones económicas a sus hijos, con quienes vienen lidiando para mejorar su situación de vida.Por ello, solicita este préstamo para aumentar su capital de inversión y para en adelante, mejorar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Jazmina De Los Angel

texts.es:
Jazmina sells clothing and various shoes both by traveling and in her house. Sometimes, she also sells clothes that she herself makes; she hopes to be able to strengthen her clothing production business. The business is 6 years old and since she began the business, she is most affected by the low sales that she has in some seasons. She is 30 years old, is a single mother of a son, who is in elementary school. She lives in the Sabana Grande area, which is a remote area near the city of Managua. Previously, Jazmina rented a room in her house, and with the income she earned, she was able to begin selling clothes and shoes. Her plans are to be able to increase her clientele through more sales. As a result, the loan she is requesting will be used to buy pants, shirts, and intimate apparel for women. In this way, it will be invested into her business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Jazmina se dedica a la venta ambulante y en su casa de habitación de ropa y zapatos variados. En ocasiones también vende ropa que ella misma confecciona y espera poder fortalecer el negocio de la confección. Tiene 6 años y medio de haber empezado el negocio, en lo que la mayoría de las veces lo que más le afecta son las ventas bajas que en algunas temporadas se dan. Tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo que se encuentra en educación primaria. Habita en la comarca Sabana Grande, un lugar alejado de la ciudad de Managua. Anteriormente Jazmina alquilaba una habitación en su vivienda, y con los ingresos obtenidos pudo empezar las ventas de ropa y zapato. Sus planes son poder aumentar la clientela a través de más ventas, es por eso que el crédito solicitado lo usará para la compra de pantalones, camisas y ropa de interior de damas, y así invertirlo en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, and intimate apparel for women

loans.name: Angel Alfonso

texts.es:
Angel has a job as a driver, but upon seeing that with his wages, he wasn’t able to support his children, he decided four years ago to dedicate himself to the sale of toys in the villages. Upon realizing that it was going very will for him, he started to sell at he village fairs, and this is how each day he has increased his sales.

He needs a loan of $250 which he will repay in four months to buy merchandise and have a better inventory to sell at the town fairs.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Ángel tiene un empleo de chofer, pero al ver que con su sueldo no le alcanzaba para mantener a su hijos decidió hace 4 años dedicarse a la venta de juguetes en los pueblos, al darse cuenta que le iba muy bien, empezó a vender en las ferias de los pueblos, y es así como cada día han ido aumentando sus ventas.

El necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y tener mayor inventario para vender en las feria del pueblo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Liliam Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lilian is 31 years old and lives in the Sabana Grande area. She has a small son, who is in elementary school. Liliam and her partner sell seafood. It has been 3 years since she started selling seafood, using both her own capital and the economic support that she received from her husband. They carry out these sales in their home and sometimes travel to sell their goods as well.

Liliam wants to give the best to her small son, and it is because of him that she works hard every day in order to sell as much as possible. She needs to increase the variety of seafood that she offers to meet the needs of her clients. The loan will be used to buy more varied seafood to increase the offerings of her sales.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliam tiene 31 años de edad, habita en la comarca sabana grande. Tiene un pequeño hijo quien estudia la educación primaria. Su compañero de vida trabaja con ella en las ventas de mariscos. Hace 3 años empezó la venta de mariscos, con capital propio y con apoyo económico que recibió de su marido. Estas ventas las realizan en su casa de habitación y algunas veces de forma ambulante también.

Desea darle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo y es por eso que diariamente trabaja muy duro para alcanzar su nivel máximo de ventas. Necesita aumentar la variedad de mariscos que ofrece para así captar mayormente las necesidades de los clientes, el préstamo será usado en la compra de más variedad de mariscos para aumentar la oferta de sus ventas.

loans.use: To buy a varied selection of seafood

loans.name: Verónica Antonieta

texts.es:
Verónica is 21 years old. Her greatest difficulty in life was to have had to begin her adult life at age 16 when she became pregnant with her first child. She had to begin working to support her new family and started off selling food in the city of Catac. She now provides meals for 30 clients, all mine workers in the Alpaquita mine in Aija, where her partner also works. She has to have provisions brought by dump truck from the city of Huaraz once a month after she leaves the mine and goes into the city to make her purchases. What really bothers her is thinking about when the time comes for her two children to start school, as she does not know how she will get a chance to see them.

Verónica, who belongs to the communal back “Señor de Ramos” in Catac, spends time in the mine teaching her children the alphabet and she hopes one day to have a chain of restaurants in Lima specializing in regional food and “chifa,” a fusion of the cuisine of Lima and the traditional Chinese food brought to Peru by Cantonese immigrants. With this loan of 500 Soles ($175 USD) which will be provided by the Manuela Ramos Movement and which will be repaid in four installments, she will purchase a sack of rice, sugar, a box of oil and other products she will use in her cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Lo mas difícil para Verónica, de 21 años, ha sido iniciar su vida de adulta a los 16 años, cuando se embarazó de su primer hijo, tuvo que empezar a trabajar, en un inicio vendía comida en la ciudad de Catac, ahora brinda pensión a 30 clientes, todos ellos obreros de la mina “Alpaquita ”, en Aija, donde también labora su conviviente. Tener que llevar los víveres en volquete desde la ciudad de Huaraz ya se le ha hecho costumbre ,donde una vez por mes baja de la mina y compra al por mayor los víveres. Lo que le atormenta es pensar cuando sus 2 hijos tengan que entrar al colegio y no saber como poder ver por ellos. Verónica, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos”de Catac, se dedica en la mina a enseñar a sus hijos las vocales, ella espera tener una cadena de restaurantes en la ciudad de Lima y especializarse en la preparación de comida regional y chifa. Con el préstamo de 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el mismo que será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará un saco de arroz ,azúcar ,una caja de aceite y algunos otros insumos para que pueda cocinar.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of supplies

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
The serious and sometimes melancholy expression on Ana’s face is caused by the death of her daughter, which she still has not gotten over. She lives with her retired husband and one of her six children, the only one who is unmarried. Ana has a shop on Villaizán Ave. in the Independencia district in Huaraz. Ana, who is a member of the communal bank “Las Candelarias II”, is 59 years old has her own business and a shop in Lima which she rents out to generate income. She is just completing construction of a small stand besiD. her shop to open another business selling a bean salad maD. from lupin seeds, (“tarwi” “chochos” “altramuces”)

With this loan of 500 Soles which will be awarded by the Manuela Ramos Movement, to be repaid in four installments, she will purchase two sacks of rice, a sack of sugar and other supplies that she is running out of.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

El rostro serio D. Ana y a veces melancólico lo atribuye a la muerte D. su hija, la cual aún no ha podido superar, vive junto a su esposo jubilado y su único hijo soltero, D. los seis que tiene, ella tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en la Av. Villaizán en el distrito D. independencia D. Huaraz. Ana, que forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”,D. 59 años ha logrado tener su propio negocio y una tienda en Lima la cual alquila y le genera ingresos líquidos, ahora esta acabando D. construir un local independiente, al lado D. su tienda ,para poder abrir otro negocio, un Cebichocho (venta D. chocho o tarwi a manera D. ensalada ). Con el préstamo D. 500 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, implementará su negocio comprando por mayor dos sacos D. arroz ,un saco D. azúcar y otros productos que ya se le acabo.

loans.use: Purchase various supplies

loans.name: San Bartolo Chacaya 1 Group

texts.en:
San Bartolo is a small town. The calmness and quiet isn't helping their businesses to go well, says Carmen. Although the women in this group have all known each other for many years, they have never had the time to get to really know each other. Their hard work and many travels to different markets left them little time to socialize. 

When one of Cruz's brothers suggested forming a micro-finance group, she became the president of the group. Her business selling fruit helps her to meet new people so forming the group was not difficult at all. The group consists of people whose lands are next to each other: so-called vecinas (neighbours). And together with having some success after their first loan, they have gotten to know each other much better, says Paula. Her business in carrots and potatoes is better after her first loan. 

They have their meetings at the office in Sololá. During the meeting they hand in their loan repayment and receive a non-formal education session. They have a lot of fun and there is a lot of laughing going on!

Where most of the women are working in buying and selling food, some of them sew traditional skirts and blouses. Isabel has her store right behind her house and she invested her first loan in big bags of frijoles (beans). When she sold these, she bought more, different kind of beans. Her customers like the diversity of her shop and buy more.

When we talk about what their desires are, the women get very excited and start talking a lot in Kachiquel. After the loan officer's translation, I realise there is something they all work very hard for. The new gained self-esteem and better financial position allows them for the first time to dream. They want their children to do much better than they themselves were ever able to do.

loans.use: invest in their stores, buy in bulk to raise their profit margin

loans.name: Maria Ynes Del Carme

texts.es:
Maria Ynes is a single mother, and owing to the necessity she had of raising children, she decided to dedicate herself to selling clothes, seeing that this was not reaching her needs, she started to also sell toys and groceries. This is how, little by little, her sales have been increased and now she wishes to have a larger inventory to offer her customers more options.

She needs a loan of $250, which she will repay in three months, to buy merchandise and offer her customers more options.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

María Ynes es madre soltera y debido a la necesidad que tenia para mantener a hijos decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa, viendo que con esto no le alcanzaba empezó a vender además juguetes y bisutería, es así como poco a poco sus ventas han ido aumentando y ahora desea tener mas inventario para ofrecerles mas opciones a sus clientes. Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y ofrecerle más opciones a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: San Bartolo Chacaya 2 Group

texts.en:
Even though the women of the trust bank San Bartolo Chacaya come from different villages around Sololá, they have known each other for many years. They have gotten to know each other very well, says Francisca. For this reason a solid base of trust has been formed, and this factor allows the women to work with a social collateral.  

The women of this group are mostly working in buying and selling foods. They carry their foods in baskets on their heads to the markets of Sololá and Panajachel. Four of the women sew clothes and one of them is working in embroidery. There are two women who have chickens to sell at the markets, one is buying and selling beef, and there are the others who sell all kinds of fruits and vegetables such as carrots, corn, beans, and potatoes. Marta, the president of the group, will invest her share of the loan to buy avocado trees. When the trees are grown, she can harvest and sell the avocados. Santos tells me she also sells avocados and beans at the markets of Sololá and Panajachel. Because of the different market days, she is able to go to both of the markets. 

Francisca told me that none of the women went to school themselves, but they can say proudly that all of their kids are. Also, with the revenue they are getting back from their investments the ladies can fix up their houses; that is also great! The women of the group argue that the best thing about receiving a loan and investing it in their now profitable businesses is that they are creating opportunities they never had themselves for the ones they love most: their kids!

loans.use: buy in bulk and grow better crops

loans.name: Chela

texts.es:
Chela is 29 years old and helps her mother-in-law prepare ice cream treats and lollipops to sell wholesale to various schools to be sold on. She has two children and with the help of her husband she hopes to have her own business and not depend on her mother-in-law. For the moment she is selling ice cream and lollipops outside a school for a very low price and generates about 100 Soles (less than $40) each week.

Chela, a member of the communal bank “Las Candelarias II” in Huaraz city will use the loan of 1,200 Soles, to be provided by the Manuela Ramos Movement and repaid in six installments, to purchase two sacks of sugar, milk, bags for packaging the lollipops and other materials that she is out of. At the same time, Chela has a dream of bidding on municipal projects involving brickwork and for this reason she is saving her money to purchase a concrete mixer and be able to rent it out.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Chela de 29 años, ayuda a su suegra a preparar helados y chupetes, quien distribuye por mayor a los diferentes colegios para su venta. Ella tiene 2 hijos y con la ayuda de su esposo espera tener un negocio propio y no depender de su suegra, por el momento ella vende en la puerta de un colegio, helados y Chupetes a muy bajo precio, con la cual le genera un ingreso semanal de 100 soles. Chela, que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Candelarias II”de la ciudad de Huaraz, con el préstamo de S/. 1,200 soles que le brindará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, piensa comprar 2 sacos de azúcar, leche, bolsas para embolsar los chupetes y algunos materiales que ya se le han desgastado, pero a la vez tiene un sueño, el de licitar con las municipalidades para ofrecer servicios de albañilería, por esta razón esta ahorrando para comprar una mezcladora de concreto y poder alquilarla.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili sold sugar cane juice in the streets. Nonetheless, her siblings helped her install a store in her home 6 years ago. Now her sister-in-law prepares the juices, as Lili has given her an extractor machine so she can work. Lili has small children, and having the store in her house lets her be close and take care of them. The loan will be used to supply the store with more merchandise. Lili would like to convert her store into a mini-market.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lili vendía jugo de caña de azúcar en las calles. Sin embargo, sus hermanos le ayudaron a poner una tienda en su casa hace 6 años. Ahora es su cuñada quien prepara lo jugos, ya que Lili le ha dado la máquina extractora para que ella trabaje. Lili tiene hijos pequeños, por lo que la tienda en su casa le permite estar cerca y cuidar de ellos. Los préstamos que recibirá le va a servir para surtir la tienda con más mercadería. A Lili le gustaría convertir su tienda en un minimarket.

loans.use: Stock her store with more merchandise

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith is a member of the Banco Comunal Manantial community bank.

Judith is married. She is 28 years old and has 2 children. Judith lives in the Muyurina community that is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Judith, together with her husband, dedicates herself to the agriculture of vegetables. The variety of vegetables depends on the market's demands. Her producs she sells in the market in the city of Ayacucho where she has a stand. She conducts wholesales as well.

Judith requires a loan in the amount of 1500 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and seeds and to cover the labour costs.

Judith's dream is to improve her business, and to have larger plantations in more fields, and to have her children complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Judith es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Judith es casada, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Judith vive en la comunidad de Muyurina que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Judith junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de verduras variadas dependiendo de la demanda del mercado, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde tiene un puesto, sus ventas son por mayor y menor.

Judith necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono, semilla y para el pago de los peones.

Los sueños de Judith son que su negocio mejore, sembrar en más terrenos y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Judith requires a loan in the amount of 1500 soles.   These funds will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer and seeds and funds to cover the labour costs.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
10 years ago, María sold sweets in a school in central Lima, but it was difficult to travel there, so she decided to install a store in her house. Thus, every afternoon, until midnight, María will leave to sell sandwiches outside of her house in a little sandwich car. It was her daughter who convinced her to start this business. The loan that she has requested will be used to buy a sandwich car, stock her store, and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 10 años, María vendía golosinas en un instituto en el centro de Lima, pero luego le fue difícil trasladarse hacia allá, por lo que decidió poner una tienda en su casa. Asimismo, todas las tardes, hasta la medianoche, María va a salir a vender sandwichs afuera de su casa en su carrito sanguchero. Fue su hija quien la animó a incursionar en este negocio. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los utilizará en comprar su carrito sanguchero, stockear su tienda y arreglar su casa.

loans.use: Buy a sandwich car, stock her store and fix up her house

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel worked as a factory worker, but after seeing that with his salaries he was not covering his family’s expenses, and because of his knowledge of tin and paiting, he decided to start his own business four years ago. To date, the business has done very well, and each day, it has been growing.

He needs a loan for $250 which he will repay in three months to buy tools for work. With your support, he will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Manuel trabajaba como empleado de una fábrica, pero al ver que con su sueldo no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares y debido a los conocimientos que tenia en hojalatería y pintura, decidió poner su propio negocio, hace 4 años, con el cual a la fecha le ha ido muy bien y cada día ha ido creciendo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar herramientas de trabajo con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying tools for work

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina is a member of the Banco Comunal Manantial community bank.

Paulina is married, is 39 years old and has 2 children. Paulina runs a cafe within the Señor de Agonia school that is located near her home. She pays a monthly rent for the space. She sells sweets, fruits and food. She depends on her daughters' help because she runs the business from 7a.m. to 8pm every day from Monday to Friday.

Paulina requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of pots and pans, cutlery, and various sweets.

Paulina's dreams is to have a more stable business, and one that is less labour intensive but still enough to be able to provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Paulina es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Paulina tiene un cafetín dentro de la escuela Señor de Agonía que esta ubicado cerca de su domicilio, por el cual paga una renta mensual, donde vende golosinas, frutas y comida, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas, actividad que realiza desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, de lunes a viernes.

Paulina necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ollas, platos, cubiertos, golosinas variadas.

Los sueños de Paulina son tener un negocio estable, menos trabajoso y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Paulian requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles.  These funds will be invested in the purchase of pots and pans, cutlery, and various sweets.

loans.name: Liz Diana

texts.es:
Liz is a member of the Banco Comunal Manatial community bank.

Liz is a single mother. She is 22 years old and she has a son. Liz, together with a friend, has a ladies' clothign store. She is located in the city of Huanta, in a rented shop. She depends on the help of an employee to take care of the sales. She acquires her producs in the city of Lima where she travels once a month. Liz lives in the city of Ayacucho for her employment but every weekend she travels to Huanta to supervise the sales and finances of her store.

For this she requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of polo shirts and slacks.

Liz's dream is to expand her business by providing a greater selection with more products. She wishes to have a gallery, to complete an education program for professionals and to provide a good eductation for her child.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Liz es socia del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Liz es madre soltera, tiene 22 años y 1 hijo, Liz junto a una amiga tienen una tienda de venta ropa para mujeres, ubicada en la ciudad de Huanta, en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de un personal que se encarga de las ventas, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viajan 1 vez al mes. Liz vive en la ciudad de Ayacucho por razones de trabajo y cada fin de semana viaja a la ciudad de Huanta a supervisar las ventas e ingresos.

Liz necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de polos, pantalones.

Los sueños de Liz son ampliar su negocio surtiendo con mas productos, tener una galeria, estudiar una carrera profesional y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Liz requests a loan in the amount of 1050 soles.  These funds will be invested in the the purchase of polo shirts and slacks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María has sold sweets outside of a high school in her neighborhood for 10 years. Her daughter gave her the cart that she uses, and it was because of this that María began to do this work. She leaves to sell in shifts, depending on the entrance and exit of the students from the school. She takes advantage of this to spend time with her grandchildren in her home. The loan that she will receive will be used to stock her cart and fix up her home. María would like to supply her cart with more sweets and then sell them outside her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años, María vende golosinas afuera del colegio que está en su barrio. Su hija le regaló la carreta donde ella vende, fue así que María empezó a trabajar de esta forma. Ella sale a vender por turnos, dependiendo la entrada y salida de los alumnos al colegio. Luego aprovecha para estar en casa con sus nietos. Los préstamos que recibirá los utilizará para stockear su carreta y para arreglar su casa. A María le gustaría surtir su carreta con más golosinas y luego vender afuera de su casa.

loans.use: Para stockear su carreta de golosinas y arreglar su casa.

loans.name: Mery, Gladys Y Sofia Group

texts.es:
Mery, Gladys and Sofia are members of the Banco Comunal Manatial community bank.

Mery is married, is 36 years old and has 2 children. She makes hamburgers, cakes, and appetizers that she makes at home using her small gas oven. She started her business in Lima and she works constantly to proviD. more variety in her desserts. Her sales are mainly to stores, restaurants and cafes.

Gladys is married, is 37 years old and has 2 children. Gladys travels to the markets twice per week where she sells her clothing but there, she also purchases cheeses that she then resells to the market in Nery. In addition Gladys has an alfalfa plantation and she sells her product also in the markets.

Sofia is married, is 41 years old and has 6 children. Sofia travels to the markets in the region where she sells groceries. And while she's at the markets she also purchases cheeses, cereals, and chicken and she then resells her purchases in the markets of Ayacucho.

The greatest dream from Mery, Gladys and Sofia are to have a large pastry shop, a clothing store, and a to see their children attend school so that they may see a better life than they have./p>

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mery, Gladys y Sofia son social del Banco Comunal Manantial.

Mery es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Mery se dedica a la elaboración D. tortas, queques, bocaditos, que prepara en su casa para lo cual cuenta con un horno pequeño a gas, actividad que aprendió en la ciudad D. Lima y actualmente se sigue capacitando constantemente para ofertar más variedad D. postres, sus ventas los realiza por mayor a las tiendas, restaurantes, cafetines.

Por otro lado Gladys es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Gladys viaja a las ferias dos veces por semana donD. venD. ropa y D. las ferias compra quesos que venD. por mayor en el mercado Nery. Además Gladys siembra alfa que venD. en el mismo mercado. Mery, Gladys y Sofia necesitan préstamos D. 750 soles, 750 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina, azúcar y mantequilla, faldas, ropa D. niños, cereales, azúcar y arroz.

Los sueños D. Mery, Gladys y Sofia son tener una panadería granD., una tienda estable D. venta D. ropa y que sus hijos estudien y sean mejores que ellas.

loans.use: Mery, Gladys and Sofia request a loan in the amount of 750 soles, 750 soles, and 600 soles. These funds will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter, skirts, children's clothing, cereals, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Flor de Maria lives in the neighborhood of Villa Venezuela in the city of Managua. She is married, and she and her husband are both merchants. She has 6 children, of whom two are in her care. Mrs. Flor sells costume jewelry and makes fried snacks, which she sells at night. She began the business with the help of her husband and with her savings.

The loan will be used to buy perishable goods for the production of the fried snacks and, as a result, she will be able to serve more clients. Because of a lack of capital, sometimes she doesn’t have as much food as she would like. With the sale of the fried snacks, she hopes to be able to invest more into her costume jewelry business.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Flor de Maria habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y su esposo al igual que ella es comerciante. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solamente dos están a su cargo. Doña Flor se dedica a la venta de bisuterías y a la elaboración de fritangas, venta que realiza diariamente por las noches. Empezó el negocio con la ayuda de su marido y con ahorros de ella.

El préstamo será usado para la compra de productos perecederos para la elaboración de las fritangas y así poder atender a más clientes, ya que por la falta de capital, algunas veces no hace tanta comida como ella quisiera. Con las ventas generadas de la fritanga espera poder invertir más en el negocio de la venta de bisuterías.

loans.use: To buy perishable goods for the fried snacks

loans.name: Llermey

texts.es:
Llermey has sold lunches from her home each Sunday for three years. Her neighbors convinced her to make food on the weekends, and so she opened her garage, set up tables, and offered lunches to her neighbors. Before this, she had worked as a domestic employee. The loan that she has requested will be used to buy the ingredients she needs to make her lunches. Llermey would like to put a new roof on her house, as the current roof is made of mats, and then she would like to open a store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace 3 años, Llermey vende menú en su casa todos los domingos. Sus vecinas la animaron a preparar comida los fines de semana, por lo que decidió abrir su cochera, colocar mesas y ofrecer menú a sus vecinos. Antes ella trabajaba como empleada doméstica. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para ofrecer sus menus. A Llermey le gustaría techar su casa, ya que su techo es de esteras y luego poner una tienda.

loans.use: Buy ingredients that she needs to make her lunches

loans.name: Yovana Ambar

texts.es:
Yovana is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her life partner. Yovana has a stand in the Santa Clara market that she inherited from her grandmother. She sells seeds, vegetables, flowers and ojotas (sandals with soles made from used car tires) that are worn by the local campesinos. She buys her products in the city of Lima and she also receives shipments from suppliers after she makes payments at the bank. She works every day from 7:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night.

Yovana needs a loan of 2,000 soles – money that will be used to buy seeds, alfalfa and carrots.

Her dream is to build her house, have a car and establish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Yovana es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Yovana es conviviente y tiene 26 años, Yovana tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Clara, que fue heredado por su abuelita, Yovana vende semillas de verduras, flores y ojotas (sandalias elaboradas de neumáticos usados de carro) que son utilizadas por los campesinos de la zona, sus productos los compra de la ciudad de Lima y también le envían sus proveedores previo pago en el banco, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Yovana necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas alfalfa, zanahoria.

Los sueños de Yovana son construir su casa, tener un carro y estabilizar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, alfalfa and carrots

loans.name: Julia Karina

texts.es:
Julia is 36, has four children that go to school and are her inspiration to keep going, she lives with her husband Amancio, who is a cargo handler and supports her a lot. She sells food (chicken soup) only during the morning, has done it for 9 months. Julia sells outside of her house, in a small “ramada” (open space with palm roof) built by her children.

What she likes the most about her job is that so many people enjoy her good cooking and the most difficult thing for her is not having a suitable location to provide better services to her clients. Julia works to help her husband with the family expenses and, of course, with the education of their children. She wants to build a terrace in which to sell her chicken soup more comfortably, and in the future have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Julia, de 36 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos que estudian y son su mayor inspiración para seguir adelante, vive junto a su esposo Amancio, que es estibador y la apoya mucho. Se dedica al venta de comida (caldo de gallina) sólo por las mañanas, desde hace 9 meses. Julia vende en las afueras de su vivienda, en una pequeña “ramada” (espacio abierto con techo de paja) construida por uno de sus hijos.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que muchas personas degustan de su buena sazón y lo más difícil para ella es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una buena acogida a sus clientes. Julia trabaja para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, y desde luego, para la educación de sus hijos. Ella quiere mandar a construir un kiosco adecuado para vender cómodamente su caldo de gallina, posteriormente tener su pequeño restaurante.

loans.use: Build a terrace to sell chicken soup.

loans.name: Herminia Y Rocío Group

texts.es:
Herminia is married, 56 years old and has seven children. She travels to the Vilcas Huamán market two times a week where she sells vegetables and fruit. At the market she buys young animals that she sells to the merchants of the 12 de Abril market.

Rocío lives with her life partner, is 31 years old and has six children. She lives in the city of Chincheros and makes ojotas (sandals that have soles made from used car tires) for the local campesinos. She travels every two weeks to the city of Ayacucho to sell the sandals in addition to honey, meat, limes and anything else she can sell.

Herminia and Rocío need loans of 450 and 900 soles – money they will use to buy fruit, vegetables, used tires and rubber.

They dream of educating their children so that they become professionals, building their businesses and having homes in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Herminia y Rocío son socias del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Herminia es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Herminia viaja a la feria de Vilcas Huamán 2 veces por semana donde vende verduras, frutas y de la feria compra animales menores que vende a los comerciantes del mercado 12 de abril.

Mientras que Rocío es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 6 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Chincheros, Rocío se dedica a la fabricación de ojotas (sandalias elaboradas de neumáticos usados de carro) que son utilizadas por los campesinos de la zona, viaja cada quincena a al ciudad de ayacucho para vender sus ojotas y también miel, carne, limón y todo cuanto pueda comercializar.

Herminia y Rocío necesitan prestamos de 450 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas, verduras, neumáticos usados y jebes.

Los sueños de Herminia y Rocío son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

loans.use: Purchase fruit, vegetables, used tires and rubber

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra is 53 and has five children, who are independent. She currently lives with her husband Jose, who is a construction worker and one of their daughters, who is a single mom. Sandra sells fish, bananas and fruits in her house and has done this for 18 years. What she likes about the business is that thanks to it, she was able to help her children, not necessarily with professional studies, but at least they are people that do well. The business is open during the day. She works to cover everyday expenses and to support her daughter and grandson who are studying. She wants to expand and have a better business, and with time be able to have a store where there are all types of products.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra, de 53 años es madre de 5 hijos que ya son independientes, en la actualidad vive con su esposo José quien es albañil y una de sus hijas, que es madre soltera. Sandra se dedica a la venta de pescado, plátano y frutas, dentro de su vivienda, desde hace 18 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que mediante éste apoyó a sus hijos con lo necesario para que salgan adelante, aunque no con estudios profesionalmente, pero al menos son hombres de bien, cuenta. Ella vende sus productos durante todo el día. Trabaja para sus gastos diarios y apoyar a su hija y su nieto que están estudiando. Quiere ampliar e implementar mejor su negocio, y con el tiempo llegar a tener una bodega donde no falte producto alguno.

loans.use: Expand and improve the location where she sells her products.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Five years ago, Lucila’s husband lost his job, so she had to start working. She decided to sell sweets from a cart outside a high school in her neighborhood. Lucila also crochets hair accessories. A woman taught her to crochet and since then she has offered her services to other people, who then sell the merchandise wholesale. Every week, Lucila crochets 20 dozen of these accessories. When the need is urgent, Lucila has to leave at night to offer her crochet services to workshops. She works 3 or 4 hours, but when they make a request, she will stay all night. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in her sweets cart. Lucila would like to put a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 5 años, el esposo de Lucila se quedó sin trabajo, por lo que ella tuvo que empezar a trabajar. Fue así que decidió vender golosinas en una carreta afuera del colegio de su barrio. Asimismo, Lucila teje a crochet accesorios para sostener el cabello. Una señora le enseñó a tejer y desde allí empezó a hacer servicios de tejidos para otras personas, quienes reparten la mercadería por mayor. A la semana, Lucila teje 20 docenas de estos accesorios. Pero cuando la necesidad apremia, Lucila tiene que salir en las noches a hacer servicios de costura a talleres. Trabaja 3 o 4 horas, pero cuando se lo piden, se queda de amanecida. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le servirá para invertir en su carreta de golosinas. Lucila quisiera poner una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Invest in sweets for her sweets cart

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is separated, 36 years old and has two children. Felipa buys used car tires that she uses to make ojotas (sandals) that are worn by the local campesinos. She works in the city of Lima in a rented locale and has people to help her. Sometimes the tires in good condition are retreaded in order to sell them later to be reused. Also, Felipa sells clothing that she buys in the city of Lima.

Felipa needs a loan for 1,750 soles – money that will be used to purchase more second-hand tires.

She dreams of having her own home in Lima, helping her children get ahead so they can be professionals and having a store to sell footwear materials.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Felipa es separada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Felipa compra neumáticos usados de carros con los cuales fabrica ojotas (sandalias elaboradas de neumáticos usados de carro) que son utilizadas por los campesinos de la zona, actividad que realiza en la ciudad de Lima en un local alquilado para lo cual cuenta con operadores, en algunas oportunidades los neumáticos en buenas condiciones los hace reencauchar para luego comercializarlos como neumáticos de segunda. Además Felipa vende ropa que compra en la ciudad de Lima.

Felipa necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de un lote de llantas de segunda.

Felipa sueña con tener casa propia en la ciudad de Lima, Ayacucho, sacar adelante a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, tener una tienda de materiales de calzado.

loans.use: Purchase used tires to make sandals

loans.name: Jose Marcelo

texts.es:
Jose Marcelo is a person who based on much dedication has been able to create his business. He started it 10 years ago when he was unemployed and had to look for an activity that would allow him to meet his family’s expenses, so utilizing his knowledge of fishing, he decided to dedicate himself to this. Little by little he has achieved a portfolio of customers that has allowed him to move forward.

He needs a loan of $150 which he will repay in three months to buy material for the creation of fishing nets, now that he is thinking about making traps and nets during the off season, and taking advantage of the demand for fishing traps for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

José Marcelo es una persona que a base de mucha dedicación ha logrado hacer crecer su negocio, el lo inicio hace 10 años cuando se quedó sin empleo y tenia que buscar un actividad que le permitiera solventar los gastos de su familia, entonces aprovechando sus conocimientos sobre pesca decidió dedicarse a esto, poco a poco ha logrado tener una cartera de clientes que le han permitido salir adelante.

El necesita un préstamo por US S150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material para la elaboración de redes para pescar ya que piensa elaborar trampas y redes para la temporada de pulpo que esta por empezar y aprovechara la demanda para ofrecer trampas para pesca en venta.

loans.use: Buying materials to make nets.

loans.name: Angela Sardiz

texts.es:
Angela is 30, has four children that are in elementary and high school, she lives with her husband Amner. He travels to different towns and villages to buy wood, then sends it to Angela to sell for the best offer. They have been doing this activity for the last three years. What she likes the most about her business is that she meets people that know about the business and she learns how to manage it and what to do. She doesn't work on this every day, but when product arrives, she works all day with no breaks. Angela works to help with the daily expenses and her children’s education, who she hopes to see become professionals in the future. The reason why she is requesting a loan is to rent a location where to store the wood and sell it easier.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Ángela, de 30 años, tiene 4 hijos que cursan estudios primarios y secundarios, vive con su esposo Amner. Él realiza varios viajes por diferentes caseríos para comprar madera y luego la envía a Ángela para que la venda al mejor postor. Realizan esta actividad desde hace 3 años. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a personas que saben de este negocio y le enseñan como es el manejo y qué se debe hacer. Su actividad no es diaria, pero cuando tiene su producto trabaja todo el día sin descanso. Ángela trabaja para solventar sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos, a quienes desea verlos profesionales más adelante. El motivo de su solicitud, es para alquilar un local donde almacene su madera y poder llevarla a vender con mayor facilidad.

loans.use: Rent a location to store wood.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
After having a disastrous relationship, as she describes it, where her partner beat and mistreated her, she started her life as a merchant, some 18 years ago. This was in spite of the fears she had of starting a business due to her low self esteem.

Ana is part of the Señor del Cautivo II community bank and currently has 3 stores, 2 of which are rented (internet service and cleaning products sales) and the other is a children's footwear store.

Taking advantage of the market day of Huaraz, and this loan of 1,700 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will rent two stands and set them up, one selling various toiletry items and the other selling typical foods.

Ana, who is 49 years old and without children, hopes to finish building her house and to open stores in Lima to be able to live on the income in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de tener una relación desastrosa, como lo califica ella ,donde su conviviente la golpeaba y le maltrataba, ella inicio su vida de comerciante hace 18 años, a pesar de los temores que le causaba comenzar un negocio debido a su baja autoestima.

Ana forma parte de Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”, en la actualidad tiene 3 tiendas, dos alquiladas (servicio de internet y venta de productos de limpieza) y la otra para la venta de sus productos de calzado para niños.

Aprovechado la feria de Huaraz, y el préstamo de S/. 1,700 soles, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, alquilará dos stand e implementará, uno para venta de diferentes artículos de tocador y otro para la venta de comidas típicas.

Ana de 49 años y sin hijos espera concluir la construcción de su casa y abrir tiendas en Lima y en su vejes vivir de sus rentas.

loans.use: Purchase of toiletries to sell.  Ingredients for selling food.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia is 55, lives with her husband Miguel, who is an independent worker, and their three children that went to school, now work and support her. In the afternoon she sells cold drinks (sodas and beer) in her house, she has sold these products for about two years. In addition, in the morning she works as part of the cleaning personnel in a recognized institution of the region.

What she likes about her job is meeting people to exchange business tips. The most difficult thing for her, is not having a suitable location and provide better service to her clients. Lilia works to cover her own expenses and keep her business going. She wants to build a “ramada” (open space with palm roof), install tables and chairs and have an adequate atmosphere to provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Lilia tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo Miguel, quien es trabajador independiente, tienen 3 hijos que ya cursaron estudios, trabajan, la apoyan y viven con ella. Por las tardes se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (cervezas y gaseosas) dentro de su domicilio, vende estos productos desde hace 2 años atrás, además, por las mañanas trabaja como personal de limpieza en una institución muy reconocida en la región.

Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conocer mucha gente con quien comparte conocimientos de negocio. Lo más difícil para ella, es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una mejor acogida y atención a su clientes. Lilia trabaja para sus gastos propios y mantener activo a su negocio. Quiere mandar a construir una ramada (espacio libre con un techo de paja), implementarlo con mesas sillas y desde luego ambientarlo adecuadamente para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.

loans.use: Build a better and comfortable area to sell cold drinks.

loans.name: Ruth Pilar

texts.es:
Ruth is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is a 25-year-old single mother with one child and has a restaurant in the Hatunpampa community that is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho. Ruth started her business there but, in search of more income, she went to the city of Ayacucho where she opened a restaurant in a rented locale. Unfortunately, it didn’t go well for her because she had few sales while incurring more expenses and for that reason she returned to her small town. Now the business offers more products and, in the same locale, she sells groceries and candy and is able to count on the help of her parents.

Ruth needs a loan for 2,000 soles – money that will be used to buy rice, sugar, candy and soft drinks.

Ruth’s dream is to buy her own home, grow her business, enjoy some recreation and give her son the best education.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30408&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida

Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Ruth tiene un restaurante en la comunidad de Hatunpampa que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Ruth inicio su negocio en el mismo lugar pero en búsqueda de mayores ingresos se fue a la ciudad de Ayacucho donde aperturó un restaurante en un local alquilado y que desafortunadamente le fue mal no tenia muchas ventas e incurría en más gastos, razón por la cual retorno a su pueblo, actualmente su negocio esta mas surtido y en el mismo local vende artículos de abarrotes, golosinas, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres.

Ruth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, golosinas y gaseosas.

Los sueños de Ruth son tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio, tener un recreo y brindar la mejor educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, candy and soft drinks

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María has made snow pants in the shop she has in her house for eight years. A friend of hers taught her how to sew, so she decided to start her own business. However, María can only make pants because she doesn't have the necessary equipment to make other types of garments. She delivers her pants in the market to her fixed customers. She also offers a sewing service to other people and companies.

She has used the loans she has received to purchase the materials to make the pants she sells.

María would like to have a more complete shop and to have more machines so she can make a larger variety of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 8 años, María confecciona pantalones de tela polar en su taller instalado en su casa. Fue una amiga quien le enseñó a coser, por lo que decidió poner su propio negocio. Sin embargo, María solo puede confeccionar pantalones, ya que no cuenta con las maquinarias suficientes como para fabricar otro tipo de prendas. Ella reparte sus pantalones en el mercado a sus clientes fijos. También hace servicio de costura a otras personas o empresas.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado en comprar los materiales para confeccionar los pantalones que vende.

A María le gustaría tener un taller más completo, contar con más máquinas y poder confeccionar más variedad de prendas.

loans.use: To purchase the materials she needs to make the pants she sells

loans.name: Trinidad Esperanza

texts.es:
Trinidad is a mother of 11 children. Nine of the children are independent with their own families, leaving the last two still under her care; they are studying and are her reason to carry on. She is 61 years old and lives together with her husband Armando who earns a living working independently, and who helps her a lot.

Trinidad works selling beauty products of various types (perfumes, talcs, creams and others) from a catalogue cosmetic line that is nationally well-known. She takes these products to sell in the various zones of Pucallpa, leaving them for cash payment or on credit. She works only by the hour. What she enjoys about her work is that she meets and socializes with many people and also gets to know many places. Her work generates income and is going well.

Now she wants to buy a display case to keep her products more secure, and later she wants to earn a living selling food in her house, since she lives in a very busy zone.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Trinidad es madre de 11 hijos, siendo 9 de ellos independientes y de familia, quedando los dos últimos a su cargo, quienes estudian y son su motivo de seguir adelante. Ella tiene 61 años, vive junto a su esposo Armando, quien se dedica a trabajar independientemente, y la apoya mucho. Trinidad se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza en sus distintas variedades (perfumes, talcos, cremas y otros) de una línea cosmética por catálogo muy reconocida a nivel nacional. Estos productos los lleva a vender por las diferentes zonas de Pucallpa, dejándolos al contado o al crédito, trabaja sólo por horas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce mucha gente con la cual se socializa y también conoce muchos lugares. Su trabajo le genera ingresos y le va muy bien. Ahora quiere comprar una vitrina para tener más seguros su productos, posteriormente quiere dedicarse a la venta de comida en su casa, ya que se encuentra en una zona muy concurrida.

loans.use: To buy a glass show case to protect and display her beauty products

loans.name: Magna

texts.es:
Magna is a member of the Pura Vida Communal Bank. She is single and 27 years old. Magna lives with her parents and everyone in her family has the same [type of] business but operates them independently. Magna buys potatoes in different small towns in the region. She [gathers and transports] them with her father’s car and then sells them in the Santa Elena potato market where her father has two warehouses. Besides that, in the months of July and September, Magna buys cereals and then sells them at wholesale prices to merchants in the different markets located in the city of Ayacucho. Before, Magna also maD. dried potatoes but had to stop that activity because her mother was ill and she had to take care of her.

Magna needs a loan of 2,500 soles - money that will be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley.

Magna dreams of building her house on the land given to her by her father and to have more capital to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30409&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Magna es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.

Magna es soltera y tiene 27 años, Magna vive con sus padres y toda su familia tienen el mismo negocio pero con capitales independientes. Magna compra papa en los diferentes pueblos D. L. región, el acopio lo realiza con el carro D. su papa y lo venD. en el mercado D. papas D. Santa Elena donD. su papa tiene dos depósitos. Además Magna en los meses D. Julio a septiembre compra cereales que luego venD. por mayor a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho. Magna también hacia papa seca, actividad que dejo D. realizar porque su mama estaba delicada D. salud y tenia que atenderL..

Magna necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. trigo y cebada.

Los sueños D. Magna son construir su casa en el terreno que le regalo su papa, tener más capital para ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase wheat and barley

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of ingredients.  Personal use.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is 24 years old, is the mother of 2 precious children, one of whom is still a baby and the other a primary school student. She lives with her husband José Alberto who is a driver. She earns a living selling groceries and other staples in her house (store). She has been working at this business for 3 years and enjoys it very much because it keeps her active. She is also the owner of a car, the one that her husband drives, and that she administers. Nelly works to cover the daily household expenses and for the education of her child. She wants to expand her business and fix up some parts of her home, and it is for this that she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly tiene 24 años, es madre de dos precioso niños, siendo uno de ellos aún un bebe y el otro estudiante del nivel inicial. Ella vive junto a su esposo José Alberto que es chofer. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad dentro de su vivienda (bodega). Lleva en este negocio 3 años y le gusta mucho, ya que la mantiene activa. También es propietaria de un motocarro, el mismo que maneja su esposo, y el cual ella administra. Nelly trabaja para los gastos diarios de su hogar y para la educación de su niño. Quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio y mejorar algunas partes de su vivienda, por ello solicita el presente préstamo.

loans.use: Improvement and expansion of the store that she has in her house

loans.name: Maria Rosa De Lima

texts.es:
Rosa started her business a little bit before she separated from her husband, and decided to take care of her six children washing, ironing and caring for children since her income does not cover the expenses of her household, so she decided to dedicate herself to selling makeup, an activity she has done for ten years taking her children forward. Thanks to this, she has had a very honorable way of taking care of herself.

She needs a $500 loan which she will repay in six months to buy merchandise, with your support she will move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa, inicio su negocio poco antes de que se separara de su pareja, y decidió mantener a sus 6 hijos lavando planchando y cuidando niños ya que no le alcanzaba con sus ingresos para solventar los gastos de sus casa, entonces ella decidió dedicarse ala venta de hamacas y cosméticos, actividad que ha realizado durante 10 años sacando a sus hijos adelante, y gracias a eso ella ha tenido una forma muy honrada de mantenerse.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía, con tu apoyo ella saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es:
For 32 years, Fernanda has sold anticuchos (meat on skewers) that she makes with cow or bull hearts outside of the market in her neighborhood. She sells from 4:00-9:00 p.m. In the summer, she also sells soft drinks and iced drinks.

Fernanda is also the president of the "comedor popular" (a restaurant where poor families can eat inexpensively) in her neighborhood.

She has used the loans she has received to purchase the ingredients she needs for her business.

Fernanda would like to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 32 años, Fernanda vende anticuchos de corazón de res afuera del mercado de su barrio. Sale a vender desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. En el verano también vende gaseosas y refrescos helados.

Fernanda también es presidenta del comedor popular de su barrio.

Los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprar los ingredientes que necesita para su negocio.

Fernanda quisiera tener una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase the ingredients she needs for her anticuchos (meat on skewers)

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda, 33 years old, is the mother of 2 children who are studying. She lives alongside her husband Augustín, who is a wood supplier. Nilda works in selling wood since her husband is also in this business. She works with the wood making planks, strips and other items. Nelly invested all the money in the business that she has with her husband. Her husband is responsible to send her the raw logs from the place where he purchases them so that Nilda may take them to one of many sawmills to have them converted to lumber. This business takes up the entire day and she likes it very much because she can socialize more. She works in order to cover daily expenses and expenses for the education of their children. With the funds she is requesting she wants to rent a space to store her wood and lumber.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Nilda, de 33 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que están estudiando, vive al lado de su esposo Agustín, quien es maderero. Nilda se dedica a la venta de madera, a razón de que su esposo se encuentra también en este negocio, trabaja con madera haciendo listones, tablillas y otros. Nelly invierte toda cantidad de dinero en el negocio que tiene con su cónyuge, quien se encarga de mandarle la madera rolliza desde el lugar donde la compra para que Nilda la lleve a cualquier aserradero y la convierta en madera trabajada. Este negocio le toma todo el día y le gusta mucho porque socializa más. Trabaja para los gastos diarios y para la educación de sus hijos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere alquilar un local para almacenar su madera e implementarlo con materiales de aserrío.

loans.use: To rent a space to use as a warehouse for her wood

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
At a very young age, Manuel stopped studying to help his family’s income and dedicated himself to working as a helper in a clothing store, until later when he came to have his own business, for which he makes capital to watch it grow. This is why he is asking for support to increase his inventory.

He needs a loan of $650 which he will repay in six months to buy merchandise in bulk and get better prices. With your support, he will move forward!

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Juan Manuel desde muy joven dejo de estudiar y para ayudar en su casa con los gastos se dedico a trabajar como ayudante en un puesto de ropa y hacia mas adelante logro tener su propio negocio al cual le hace capital para verlo crecer y por eso pide apoyo para engrandecer sus inventarios.

El necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía a mayoreo y tener mejores precios. Con tu apoyo el saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Eduviges

texts.es:
Eduviges, 47, is an elementary school teacher. She lives with her husband, Milton, who is also a teacher and they have 3 marvellous children, all in school and all with plans to pursue professional careers. In addition to teaching, Eduviges earns an income from selling two lines of beauty products that she buys from catalogs and resells. She makes the most of her workday by selling her products to her fellow teachers, as well as other people she knows. Thanks to her friendly manner and attention to detail, she has a wide range of customers who buy lots of her products. She's operated the business for 7 years and what she likes best is staying active, exchanging ideas and socializing. She wants to rent a store so that she can exhibit her beauty products. She also wants to complement her existing product lines by selling costume jewelry which is why she's applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Eduviges tiene 47 años, es de profesión profesora de educación primaria, vive junto a su esposo Milton, quien también es profesor, y ambos tienen 3 hijas maravillosas que estudian y a quienes esperan ver profesionales. A parte de la enseñanza, Eduviges se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de dos líneas cosméticas por catálogo, ella aprovecha en vender sus productos a su colegas de trabajo, así como también a todo persona que conoce. Por su amabilidad y buena atención cuenta con una gama de clientes que consumen muchos de sus productos. Con esta actividad lleva ya 7 años, y lo que más le gusta es estar activa, intercambiar ideas y socializar. Quiere alquilar un local, para exhibir sus productos de belleza y complementar esta tienda con bisutería, por ello solicita este préstamo, esperando una respuesta positiva de su parte.

loans.use: Rent a shop to sell beauty products and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Esmirna

texts.es:
Esmirna, 57, is a single mother with 8 children, one of whom has died. The others are independent now but still live with her. She has a vehicle repair shop in a small space at her house. One of her sons is a mechanic and works with her. Esmirna is not only a mechanic; she sells car parts. She tends the sales side of the business but still helps her son with the repairs and it's she who is responsible for oil changes. She's made a living with the business for 4 years and it's now generating a good income. She used to sell clothing before but it didn't go well. What she wants from work is to be able to feel active and useful. She will use the loan that she's applying for to expand her business and remodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Esmirna tiene 57 años, es madre soltera, tuvo 8 hijos, uno de ellos murió y los demás ya son independientes, pero viven junto con ella. Tiene un taller de mecánica en un pequeño local dentro de su vivienda, donde uno de sus hijos que es mecánico y trabaja junto con ella. Esmirna no solo tiene su mecánica, sino también vende repuestos, ella atiende la venta, pero no deja de darle la mano a su hijo, ya que es ella quien se encarga de hacer los cambios de aceite. En esta actividad tiene ya 4 años, le es muy rentable, anteriormente vendía ropa y no le fue bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente activa y útil a la sociedad. Ahora, el dinero solicitado lo usará para ampliar su negocio y remodelar para de la infraestructura.

loans.use: Remodel vehicle repair shop.

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe, 29, is the mother of 3 elementary school aged children. She lives with her husband, Esau, who makes a living selling gas (for cooking). He supports her plans for developing her business. Lupe has sold fruit from a small stand at her house for two years. She only works a few hours each day because fruit spoils easily and she has to sell it fast. Thanks to the good and friendly service she provides, she has a large and loyal customer base and she always has good and fresh products to sell. She likes her work very much because it gives her a chance to meet lots of people. The hard thing for her is not having a shop that's appropriate for her business. She works to educate her children and contribute to the family's income. She wants to invest the loan that she's applying for in the construction of a kiosk and the purchase of more products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
